10. Should be an excellent team player

11. Should have exposure to Agile Methodology

Name: Full Time Sales Promotion Consultant (Marketing Specialist)
Description:
HQ SALES PTY LTD
142 High St, Cranbourne VIC 3977

Full Time Sales Promotion Consultant (Marketing Specialist)
Salary Range: $65,000 to $80,000 + SUPERANNUATION

DUTIES
•	Research and develop marketing and product mix, formulate strategies for short-term and long-term advertising objectives, targeting opportunities in an open, listing, auction or primary to tertiary markets depending on the seasonal trend.
•	Utilise various platforms and avenues to advertise properties on bus, publication media online and on other platforms. It also includes dealing with various companies in offering the product/services and getting quotations, differentiating between all, and then finalising the best that suits the company’s interest, needs and budget.
•	Organise related marketing reports on current trends and strategies, and present them to the management and clients with analysis of opportunities and potential risks, emphasising pricing mix and strategies reflecting assessors’ value and market value among other considerations like location, and facilities, amenities, etc.
•	Coordinate marketing and support staff in enacting all product mix and strategies, focusing on actionable steps and forward-thinking solutions that prevent detrimental effects whilst taking into account risks.

•	Directly deal with the companies and their representatives to get the marketing done for the business, prioritising lead contacts and first-contact clients and partners to increase company influence and networking.

•	Maintained a good and healthy relationship with our clients and with the marketing agencies’ representatives.

•	Building and maintaining client relationships with the agencies and partners for marketing, including building confidence through various client programmes and promotions.
•	Keep track of designated teams in sales, emphasizing targets and team morale to booster productivity to attend to their KPI.
•	Proactively pursue new business and sales opportunities, taking initiatives in predicting potential markets through in-depth research and analysis of current market trends. This includes liaising with potential clients and partners.

REQUIRED SKILLS
Relevant bachelor’s degree.
At least 2 years of relevant marketing and advertising experience.
Experience in pursuing new business and sale leads.
Strong client relationship management skills.

Please send your CV to info@businessnest.com.au

Name: Cyber Security Analyst
Description:
•	Cyber Security Analyst
•	Permanent full-time opportunity, Sydney NSW
•	Salary relative to experience, and ranges from $70,000 to $80,000 

Are you a Cyber Security Analyst with a keen interest in broadening your experience? 

Our Company is looking for a Cyber Security Analyst that will act as a technical expert to identify, mitigate, and respond to threats against the security, confidentiality, and integrity of client and corporate systems, networks, and data. The Security Analyst is responsible for monitoring existing controls, analysing network and system activity, and working with administrators to create, maintain, and enforce controls and business continuity processes. This position interfaces company wide as well as partnering with internal and external resources to address and communicate any security issues.

Responsibilities
•	Protect data and information systems against unauthorized access, modification, or destruction
•	Maintain and monitor data security
•	Manage network, intrusion detection and prevention systems
•	Respond to and analyse security incidents
•	Prepare status reports on security matters to develop security risk analysis scenarios and response procedures.
•	Responsible for the tracking, monitoring and resolution of security incident tickets.
•	Audit and report on user accounts and access permissions
•	Provides direct support to the business and IT staff for security related issues.
•	Recommend and implement appropriate cyber security tools and countermeasures
•	Assist in the development and documentation of security procedures and business continuity plans

Qualifications & Skills

•	2-3 years of related work experience with a bachelor’s degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD, or PhD) in a computer science or related field.
•	Security qualification such as CompTIA Security+, CISMP, CISSP, CISM an advantage, but not essential
•	Familiarity with security threats involving devices, networks, and systems as well as solutions that prevent, detect, and respond to those threats.
•	Proven experience in Security Incident Response, IAM, SIEMs.
•	Familiarity with current cyber security technologies such as firewalls, proxies, network and host-based intrusion prevention, data loss prevention, security information/event management, endpoint security, anti-virus/anti-malware, etc.
•	In-depth understanding of ICT Security, specifically Vulnerability Management of ICT systems
•	Ability to read and write basic reporting scripts (PowerShell).
•	Understanding of Cyber security policies, procedures and good knowledge on ISO27001, NIST or similar frameworks.


Could this be the role for you? Apply now through the link or send your CV to thushara@xnetit.com.au to start your journey with XnetIT. 
For more details on the role, or other roles we have available please call 0414 580 944.

Providing a range of IT support and services among many IT companies in Australia, XnetIT will help you succeed in your transformation to this digitalised world. We know that understanding the right mix of IT is crucial in this transformation, hence we work closely with our valued clients to deliver the most affordable end-to-end ICT management services & business it support services that are flexible to adapt changing business conditions and meet its existing needs.

Name: Cyber Security Specialist
Description:
Amcoll Pty Ltd is a privately owned Australian ICT Managed Services Provider (MSP) & wholesaler for networking & IT gear. 

We are a growing business with a focus on three technology areas – Cloud, Infrastructure and DevOps, Cyber Security, and networking. We support our customers at every step of their technology journey, change your business, run your business in the cloud, secure your business, get more value from IT and Find the right people

Apart from ICT services, Amcoll Pty Ltd, is also #1 source for top notch home automation services. We provide wide range of services and products such as Savant , Fibaro, and many more. We are dedicated to give our customers the very best service with a focus on usability and security in friendly home automation solutions. We cater private customers as well as small to medium size businesses across NSW for networking and smart home solutions.


About the role 
In this role, the successful candidate will be responsible for various activities in ICT Security domain. The ideal candidate will have experience in IT Security, cyber security, managing risks, compliance, and vulnerability assessments.
 

Job tasks and responsibilities: 
 
•	Managing Security Policy, Compliance and Risk through performing
•	Conducting Vulnerability Assessments and Penetration Testing 
•	Designing Perimeter, Datacentre and Cloud-SaaS Integrations
•	Writing data encryption programs to protect sensitive information
•	Evaluating reports to identify gaps in security policies and then make necessary changes to make network more secure.
•	Adding extra layer of security to the information using SQL server tools, UNIX shell scripting and SSAS.
•	Operation and maintenance activities including management of security patches, upgrades of the critical IT infrastructure.
•	Liaising with security vendors and consulting with stakeholders

Requirements:
•	Holds current penetration testing certifications such as CREST, OSCP or CEH
•	Minimum 2-years of relevant work experience as a security specialist in IT environment.
•	Master’s level qualification is desired but not a constraint for suitable bachelors candidate. 
•	Perfect writing and oral English communication skills

Job title: Cyber Security Specialist
Attractive Salary: $120K + Super

Name: Principal Recruitment Consultant
Description:
At the Onset, we’re on a mission to grow our brand as Australia’s leading technology recruitment agency and we’re looking for insightful, creative, and engaging Principal Recruiters to join the journey. Specifically, if you've owned and developed a contract desk, we'd love to hear from you.

As a Principal Consultant here, you’ll take full ownership of your vertical. You’ll focus on the complete candidate lifecycle, proactively develop business and manage accounts across your client base. You will leverage our existing client relationships as you grow your contract desk across your market.

You’re already a subject matter expert in your eld and now you’re looking to join a business that can offer more. Our culture rewards success and allows for individual growth and development.

You wouldn’t be joining just another agency. We’re a talented and savvy bunch of recruiters who are passionate about our specialisms. Together we collaborate and support each other to be the best recruiters we can be. Our culture is honest, focused, and transparent, we have fun and aren’t afraid of stepping into the unknown.
You'll be based in awesome offices in Surry Hills to keep you at the heart of our client base in the start-up community and close to our enterprise customers in the city. You’ll also get your hands on the latest AI sourcing technologies and shiny new systems to help you succeed.

Benefits with The Onset:

Autonomy, trust and flexibility
Competitive salary and commission model
Complete training
iPhone and Apple Mac
Annual off-site and holiday incentives + regular social events

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
Morgan McKinley is looking to hire an experienced and driven Recruitment Consultant to join their established and highly reputable team. You will be set up for success from the outset with a strong PSA client base, an extensive network built up across 12 years and an already signify can’t, yet continuously growing, market share in Sydney. The position will be full-time with annual remuneration of between $80,000 to $105,000 (negotiable) on offer.

Morgan McKinley is extremely proud to have made the Top 50 Best Places to Work list for 2022, securing the #3 spot in the Under 100 Employees category - apply now to find out more about why!

What is involved in the role?

· This is an established and reputable organisation, with lots of warm hunting ground;

· Full 360-degree focus, new business development, account management and candidate talent pooling;

· Sourcing and interviewing qualified candidates and managing them through the recruitment process;

· Writing job advertisements;

· Negotiating job offers with candidates & clients;

· Working closely with existing and potential client contacts to intimately understand their respective business and to be ahead of the curve with their recruitment needs; this will include both account management of key PSA clients, as well as business development of new clients;

· Developing and maintaining expert knowledge within the space;

· Ensuring that the space you will work in receives the highest possible level of service.

What skills and experience will help you succeed?

· Ambitious recruitment professional with at least 2+ years' experience

· Must have a strong commercial focus and business acumen

· Degree level or equivalent, or 5 years' highly relevant experience

· Driven and self-motivated

· Excellent communication, presentation & consultative skills

· Thrives in a fast-paced, target-driven environment, with a quick speed to response

Why join #TeamMMK Sydney?

· Multiple award-winning agency with an enviable global brand reputation, and an establishedand impressive leadership team

· Long-standing preferred supplier relationships with high-profile and dynamic companies

· Career progression with a clear pathway to promotion, tailored to your strengths and aspirations(demonstrated by more than 1/3rd of our consulting team having been promoted in the last 6 months)

· Regular incentives such as high performers' lunches (Cafe Sydney, Balmoral Bathers’ Pavillionetc), 4 hour Fridays and travel vouchers

· Monthly /quarterly team nights out, fresh fruit in the office, beer and wine in the fridge

· Additional leave day per quarter

· Support and encouragement to give something back to the community, through our award-winning Corporate Social Responsibility program and 2 annual volunteer days

· Industry-leading training and development.

Name: Vibration Consultant
Description:
Engineering Consultancy in the Western suburbs is looking to hire a Permanent Vibration Consultant.  Your new company Our client is an Engineering Consultancy who has offices across Australia and is unique in their diversity of breadth and depth of projects available across all industries. They are known to truly value and trust their team members, offering a lot of flexibility and project ownership.   Your new role You will have a client orientated role where you will be involved in a variety of exciting projects, which you will be taking full ownership over and managing from inception to completion. On a day-to-day basis this will involve;

Designing of engineering solutions for industrial applications
Analysis and mitigation of engineering dynamic issues
Structural dynamics investigations including Finite Element Analysis (FEA)
Application of rotor dynamics principals to diagnose complex machinery problems
Instrumentation, signal processing and data acquisition   What you'll need to succeed You will need to have had solid demonstratable experience in a Vibration Consultant capacity, field experience and a degree level qualification in Mechanical Engineering or a related degree such as Mechatronic Engineering. You will thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy working a variety of technical projects, which may require travel throughout SA and interstate. You will have excellent communication skills and project management experience, and enjoy the process of collaboration required to solve client problems. You will be commercially astute with a keen interest in developing business in a competitive environment.   What you'll get in return You will work with an organisation that is in a state of growth and development across each of their states, however relatively lean in South Australia. You will have the opportunity to showcase your business acumen, and capabilities, and see them rewarded by propelling your career development. Due to the project nature of the role, you will have excellent flexibility where you will be trusted to work in a hybrid capacity. You will have access to a variety of project scopes and industries, giving you excellent exposure and experience to continuously improve your skills.   What you need to do now If this role sounds exciting, and you are ready to grow your career email your CV to ioana.oliphant@hays.com.au [mailto:ioana.oliphant@hays.com.au] or call Ioana now on (08) 72214159 for a confidential discussion!  SA Licence number : LHS 297508

Name: Consultant Data & AI
Description:
Consultant – Data & AI

Overview
Why Microsoft: We are Microsoft Consulting Services, and are passionate about delivering Microsoft’s mission:

“to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more”. 

We are the Azure Cloud and AI team, and we believe in the power of personal growth and development. We succeed as a team by sharing knowledge and experience. Don’t worry about what you don’t know; come and show us what you do know, and we will teach you the rest. We want to invest in you, you’re training and development.

We provide technical direction to our customers who are deploying, maintaining, or innovating solutions using the latest technology. We enable our customers to have the skills to deploy, support and maintain their environment in line with Microsoft best practices. 

The ideal candidate will have the ability to combine their technical passion, creativity, and customer focus to deliver great solutions to their customers and ensure they get the best out of our technologies and solutions. 

 
Responsibilities
The purpose of the role: 

We are looking for a consultant to join the team who will focus on one of the following technical skill sets. You may already have these skills, or you might be interested in learning about them.
 
Data and AI consultant:
Understanding of database concepts and deployments
Planning for and conducting database migrations such as for SQL and Oracle
An understanding of both IaaS and PaaS SQL
Designing and utilising ARM templates 
Building large scale data sets in Azure, AWS, Hadoop, or similar big data environments
Utilising and developing solutions with cloud based Cognitive Services
Understanding of Machine Learning operations
Developing and deploying modern cloud-based data analytical platforms
Data visualisation and extracting insights using Power BI and Power Platform products
Designing and building customer solutions leveraging DevOps practices

Qualifications 
What skills do you need to have? 
There will be many opportunities for you to learn and grow into this role and Microsoft. However, to be able to best deliver on the purpose of this role, these are the core skills and experiences you should have on day one: 
Ability to quickly build relationships and credibility with customers 
A passion for learning about and experimenting with new technologies
Confidence in creating and delivering technical presentations and training
An interest in learning to read, interpret and/or develop technical specifications and diagrams
Ability to learn new technologies quickly through self-learning
Ability to build trust to drive change with customers
Excellent organisation and planning skills

We would also expect you to be able to pass the following Certifications in the first 12 months of employment with us, if you do not already hold them:
AZ-900: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals
and one of the following
DP-100: Azure Data Scientist Associate
DP200/201: Azure Data Engineer Associate
AI-100: Azure AI Engineer Associate

WHAT WE OFFER

Salary Range: aud $80,000 – aud $90,000
Microsoft offers a flexible working environment to enable you to better balance your work and life
Microsoft prides itself on the parental and family related leave we offer to help when you need to be with your family
Microsoft provides a vast range of training and learning experiences for their employees from online self-paced training, through to face-to-face conference style learning. We want to invest in your learning, so bring your passion and we will help you find the right path.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Name: RECRUITMENT CONSULTANT
Description:
RECRUITMENT CONSULTANT - $80K - $100K 

 
	 Cracking opportunity to work within lucrative technology niches 
	 Boost your bank account with fantastic commissions 
	 Senior opportunity, global company, fun and driven team environment  
 

 WHO ARE OPUS? 
 
Opus Recruitment Solutions are a fun, driven and ambitious global recruitment consultancy. We are multi-award winning and have been voted as one of the world’s most innovative and fastest growing agencies. We are proud to supply top technical talent to niche roles all over the world. 
 
This is a cracking opportunity for an experienced and driven recruitment consultant, to jump on board a mixture of warm clientele and new business development. A genuine chance for you to be a subject matter expert in your niche field of expertise, earn great money and be a part of our fun Sydney family. 
 
 It’s all go, go, go and we need YOU! 
 
With earning potential of up to $300k+, plus bundles of incentives (holidays, VIP trips, lunch clubs), what more can you ask for?  We back our word at Opus and genuinely believe this is an opportunity not to be missed.  
 
I'd love to give you the run down on our company and the opportunity for you to develop a cracking career here. 
 
 THE ROLE: 
  

 
	 Provide high quality professional recruitment services to match the needs of your clients and candidates. 
	 Strive to be the best by driving new business & encouraging repeat business.

	 Business excellence is expected and success rewarded; the team are incredibly supportive, providing guidance on building, maintaining and expanding business. 
 

 
 YOU WILL HAVE:

Name: Senior Recruitment Consultants
Description:
Senior Consultants  – Brisbane 
  
Technology People Group, part of Xpert Group, is a well-established specialist IT recruitment firm, with a national presence, with offices in Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane. Our diverse clients range from ASX Top 50 organisations to the tech industry’s most promising digital start-ups. 
Our vision is simple – to set new standards in search for digital talent, and we continue to evolve alongside the technology industry to provide the best possible outcomes for our clients’ success. 
  
At the heart of realising this vision, is our people. Our most important asset. 
  
Hiring the best talent in the business is our biggest focus, and our team is considered family, where all interactions are based on a level of trust and camaraderie. 
As part of our clear growth aspirations, we are seeking two experienced Senior Recruitment Consultants to join our team. 
  
This is the chance to truly build your own portfolio, with the support of a mature research/delivery and leadership team to ensure your success. 
Senior Consultants are responsible for driving a culture and foundation built on regular business development, continually seeking out and securing new business opportunities, and managing relationships for key customers of the business. They oversee core technical components of client engagement and oversight of delivery quality and execution. 
  
 What will you do? 
 Development of New Client Opportunities  Take a proactive approach to business development within both new and existing clients, targeting acquisition of new business opportunities and leverage of services. 
  
 Management of Existing Client Accounts and Key Contacts  Take a proactive approach to business development activity within existing client accounts that exist within your area of technology specialisation, requiring regular meetings with existing contacts. 
  
 Delivery Management  As the primary client contact, you will provide oversight to all delivery activity for roles within those accounts managed by you. This includes responsibility for the quality of service and client satisfaction. 
  
 What are we looking for? 

 
	 A proven track record as a high achiever, consistent in New Business billing activity 
	 Extensive understanding of the end to end recruitment processes, and best practice sourcing principles 
	 Strong business development skills; can demonstrate where you have actively targeted and secured new business opportunities 
	 Prior experience working across specialist I.T.markets, and able to demonstrate your knowledge 
	 A strong network of customers and contacts, preferably of a senior nature 
	 Experienced in mentoring junior consultants and rookies 
	 An appreciation for profit and loss (P&L’s) 
	 Extensive experience in responding to tenders, and presenting to customers on business capability; specifically, technology related solutions and capability 
 

 Please in the first instance send a Microsoft Word copy of your resume and a brief summary outlining key relevant experience based on the above criteria.

Name: NetIQ Identity Management Consultant
Description:
NFP IT Consultancy is an IT Consultancy designed to minimise how much money is skimmed off the top from a consultant. 

We have a large client requiring a few more NetIQ Identity and Access Management Consultants. 

Perks:
Fully Remote Work Available - Australia or International (Office in Melbourne available for hybrid work)
Contractor or Permie roles
Full Time & Part Time roles
Flexible Work Hours - provided you attend meetings in Melbourne time zone you can 
No non-competes (provided you haven't cost us money) - if we don't offer you value you can negotiate directly with client
Training - If you want to learn a skill that is on the preferred list (or if relevant) we will train you

Skills/Technology Expectations:
NetIQ Identity Manager experience - alternate Identity Management tools like Ping, ForgeRock, Microsoft Identity Manager (MIM), FIM, IBM Security Identity Manager (ISIM or ITIM), OneIdentity, SailPoint, SAP Identity Management, Savyint considered if you have LDAP & Coding experience. 
LDAP directory experience

Skills/Technology that are preferred but not required (will increase your daily rate)
•	Single Sign On (SSO) - SAML2/OAuth2 with OIDC - NetIQ Access Manager, AAD or alternates such as Okta, Ping or others.
•	Jira/Confluence
•	Git
•	Software Engineering Background - C#, Java, 
•	Scripting knowledge - Powershell & Bash
•	Automated Testing - Experience at writing test plans for our test automation engineers. If you have experience with jMeter or Unit Test Frameworks
•	DevOps Tools - Ansible, Terraform, Azure DevOps and others
•	Azure Cloud experience
•	Active Directory
•	Azure Active Directory
•	AADC
•	PAM (Cyberark)

Day-to-Day Job:
On a day-to-day basis you will be doing project work with NetIQ Identity Manager on various drivers such as Active Directory, REST, Null, Microsoft365 and others. 

You will work directly with Project Managers, however you will have a Team Lead to provide you with training, a BA to help you gather requirements, an architect to provide high level designs and Test Automation Engineers to assist you with writing automated test cases.

You will document your solutions and write test plans for the testers. If you have experience or are keen to learn how to automate testing - training will be provided

If you have other skills on the preferred list we will talk with you about other tasks.

Name: Marketing Cloud Consultant
Description:
*Open to candidates from all over Australia.
About the role
You will be responsible for delivering new and exciting Marketing Cloud projects for our large partners.
Marketing Cloud Consultant
Essential

3+ years of experience working with clients delivering marketing campaign solutions using Salesforce Marketing Cloud
Managing a team of marketing cloud consultants
Software development background experienced with development languages and frameworks e.g HTML, CSS, SQL and Javascript
Strong knowledge of the Salesforce platform and it’s data model
Strong knowledge of AMPScript, text and HTML emails, landing pages, SMS and MMS messages, and push notifications from MobilePush.
Proven working experience using various marketing cloud components: Cloud Pages, Email Studio, Social Studio, Advertising Studio, Web Studio, Journey Builder, Audience Builder and Content Builder.
Knowledge of Marketing Cloud Best Practices
Thorough understanding of Database objects and ability to write complex SQL queries
Ability to participate/demonstrate work to client via presentation or verbally to articulate product features and can propose solutions
Demonstrable experience with all phases of the SDLC using either Agile or Waterfall methodologies

Responsibilities

Manage a team to deliver a range of projects
Direct involvement and/or oversight of understanding business requirements, creating specifications, designing marketing journeys and email templates, developing campaigns and managing end to end delivery.
Define segmentation criteria for batch and trigger emails/SMS campaigns and conduct A/B testing.
Create and manage SFMC Cloud Pages and use audience builder data in journeys.
Create data extensions using SQL scripts and AMPscript by analysing the campaign requirements.
Design, develop and debug custom solutions
Provide ROI details to various stakeholders on a timely manner.
Work closely with all our teams in delivering the marketing cloud solutions.

ABOUT KATZION
We are a fast growing start-up, with some of the largest auto manufacturers in Australia as valued clients. As a Salesforce premium partner we are trusted to deliver innovative and creative solutions using the power of Salesforce.
We are quite humbled by the amazing journey we have been on since we started in 2017.
Fast forward to 2021, we now have 6 offices around the globe, employing over 160 phenomenal people who are creating amazing customer experiences for 14 large partners. 
Our journey is only just beginning and we are excited for the opportunities ahead. If you want to play a key role in the growth of an organization – Katzion is for you.
Sorry, no recruiters please!

Name: Technology Consultant - Azure Data Engineering
Description:
Where you’ll fit in:

Technology Consultant – Azure Data Engineering | Reporting to the Technical Services Manager, Data & AI | Part of our Data & AI department | Based in Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne.

How you can unlock your potential: 

•	Focus on Data Engineering solutions using the Microsoft Data Platform.
•	Provide technical thought leadership and mentor/develop others in the team.
•	Opportunity to expand your experience while working across a variety of different types of projects, sometimes you may have an in-depth 6-month gig, other times you may be delivering across multiple smaller engagements.
•	Hybrid working with plenty of flexibility. 
•	Funded training and development where you're encouraged to further your education.

Here’s a sneak peek into what you’ll spend your time doing: 
•	As part of a Develop technical solutions from planning and design through to deployment using the latest Azure Data Services (Synapse Analytics, Data Factory, Data Lake, Data bricks etc.)
•	Participate in client engagement activities, including client presentations & design workshops.
•	Plan the design and delivery of solutions that meet business requirements into new and existing client infrastructure.
Technology you’ll get to play with:
As far as Data stacks go, our core offering is pretty awesome. You’ll be developing Data Solutions using Microsoft Azure Data Services such as: Azure Synapse Analytics including Synapse Dedicated SQL Pools, Synapse Pipelines, Synapse Spark Pools, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Bricks, T-SQL, Azure DEVOPS.

Additionally, you may get the opportunity to Develop Data Analytics solutions using Microsoft Power BI, Data Modelling (DAX, M Query), Data Visualisations (Dashboards & Reports) and Azure Machine Learning.

What we’re looking for in our next awesome human: 
•	Strong exposure to Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Analysis Services and SQL Database.
•	Technical leadership in requirements management, solution architecture planning and design.
•	Extensive and demonstrated experience in designing, developing, and deploying data solutions using the Microsoft Data Platform (Cloud and On-Premises).
•	Strong knowledge of the complexities of Cloud Services and enterprise class project exposure.
•	Exceptional communication skills in the translation between business outcomes and technology solutions.
•	Technical (Design and As Built) and User (Transition / Support) documentation.
•	Ability to build rapport and genuine relationships.
•	Ability to prioritise between competing project needs.
•	We require Australian Working Rights for this position. 
•	Due to our ISO27001 Compliance we require all staff to have a clean criminal record, we will facilitate a police check upon acceptance of an offer.
Who are MOQdigital? 

We enable organisations to accelerate their technology driven transformation. We do this through our end-to-end lifecycle of services of Advise, Enable and Manage.
1.	We work with organisations to help them to understand, evaluate and advise based on their individual technical requirements.
2.	We implement and build custom solutions that enable organisations to thrive.
3.	We manage and support systems that enable organisations to accelerate their vision.
Our purpose is to celebrate new thinking, bring together solutions and engage and educate. We partner with ambitious organisations to reimagine and revamp their systems with a vision for what the future might entail for them. MOQdigital helps People and Technology to intersect.

A few key things you should know about us:
•	Intro to MOQdigital video link - shorturl.at/hGYZ0.
•	Our LinkedIn Company Page is stacked with goodness and awesome insights into who we are and what’s important to us – Check it out!
•	We’re an Australian founded ASX listed organisation built on a number of acquisitions plus organic growth, with global presence. We’ve been around for circa 17 years with now circa 300 employees nationally (450 globally).
•	We’re a Microsoft Gold Partner and have a number of advanced specialisations. 

What we offer at MOQdigital:
•	Why choose MOQdigital video link - shorturl.at/bhilC
•	Our Story & Benefits video link - shorturl.at/wyC57
•	Flexible working is part of our DNA.
•	16 Weeks Paid Parental Leave - No minimum service period for eligibility.
•	Funded learning and development plus study days alongside our comprehensive training plans.
•	Proven career progression opportunities, we’re passionate about helping our people unlock their potential and grow across different capabilities.
•	Meeting free Thursdays – Reducing the impact of meetings to improve mental health, productivity and wellbeing.
•	Loads of regular learning and connection opportunities.
•	Continuous sharing of knowledge, where you will be encouraged to voice your ideas.
•	Diversity is a strength and we love having people from different backgrounds and experience, for example, we have employees from over 30 different countries working here - that’s just one attribute, talk to us about our other diverse people! 
•	We sponsor Women in Technology (WiT) and have our own ‘Women Crushing IT’ (WCIT) initiative.

Our Values are what make us, us:
•	We’re the first to put our hand up, take ownership and show initiative.
•	We’re genuinely concerned about the welfare of others.
•	We value a growth mindset, smart, creative thinking and the ability to simplify.
•	We’re open, honest and polite – with no politics allowed.
•	We’re fixer’s – not finger pointers.

Name: Recruitment Consultant (Sydney)
Description:
About Us

We are a global recruitment agency with offices throughout Australia, Asia and the UK. Operating for over 21 years, we are in an exciting period of growth and are looking for Recruitment Consultants with experience in Banking, Finance, Accounting Support & Technology.

Annual leave: when you work hard, you need time to relax too. We offer an extra day's annual leave for every year of service (up to a maximum of 25 days) PLUS an extra day off for your birthday

This is a 360 role, where you will own the client and candidate life cycle. More specifically, you will:

- Generate new business activity
- Establish relationships with new clients and candidates
- Maintain relationships with existing clients and candidates
- Source, screen and interview candidates

You will be:

- An excellent communicator, both verbal and written
- An effective negotiator
- Resourceful as you will relentlessly pursue leads and opportunities.

Salary
$80,000 - $100,000 + Commission

Name: Expert Implementation Consultant (ICT Business Analyst)
Expert Implementation Consultant (Software Engineer)
Description:
The Expert Implementation Consultant (Software Engineer) will be responsible for utilizing senior level application and domain knowledge to correct and timely develop and deliver Custom Reports solutions for new and existing clients.  The specific duties of the role include: 

- Researching, consulting, analyzing and evaluating health care IT system program needs 
- Identifying health care IT technology limitations and deficiencies in existing systems and associated processes, procedures, and methods 
- Testing, debugging, diagnosing, and correcting errors and faults in healthcare IT applications programming language within established testing protocols, guidelines, and quality standards to ensure programs and applications perform to specification 
- Writing and maintaining program code to meet customers’ system requirements, system designs and technical specifications in accordance with quality accredited standards 
- Writing, updating, and maintaining technical programs, end user documentation and operational procedures for clients  
- Providing advice, guidance and expertise in developing proposals and strategies for healthcare IT software design activities such as financial evaluation and costings for recommending software purchases and upgrades 
	 
Academic and Professional Qualifications: 

-- Bachelor’s degree or relevant Technical / Business experience 
 
Experience:

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
Recruitment Consultant 

•	Join a fun and supportive team environment of high-performing recruitment experts
•	Hybrid working model, offering great work/life balance
•	Uncapped bonus structure

About the business

Six Degrees Executive is one of Australia’s leading independent, specialist executive recruitment consultancies. The business was founded with the intent to focus on ‘long game’, relationship-based recruitment, and our expert consultants have a reputation for understanding the dynamics of the roles and industries in which they specialise, acting as ‘talent magnets’ for the most dynamic and high potential candidates in the market.

As our name suggests, Six Degrees is built around high-touch human connections, and we pride ourselves on building an enviable culture of continuous improvement, and personal and professional development. 

Our culture is our superpower, so it is our priority to ensure our people enjoy coming to work. We have unrivalled tenure among our consulting and leadership teams, proving we know how to keep each and every one of our SDE Family members happy and engaged. 

About the role

As a consultant within our business, you will provide a highly customer-centric service, with a genuine desire to positively shape the futures of the individuals we engage. The focus is on helping our clients build successful, sustainable businesses via the recruitment of exceptional talent.

Activities include:
•	Successfully developing and managing a profitable portfolio of clients through the placement of high-quality talent
•	360o consulting assignments, including both retained and contingent processes
•	Regular proactive and planned communication and client engagement to nurture and grow accounts 
•	Strategic business development
•	Uncovering and sharing cross functional and interstate referrals to support business-wide growth 
•	Developing and executing business plans aligned to company strategy
•	Professional and ethical candidate management to the highest service/quality standards

Skills and experience
To be successful in this role, you will have 2+ years recruitment experience within an agency environment. You possess the innate the ability to build strong networks with candidates and clients.

Driven, ambitious, and with the desire to continuously learn and grow professionally and personally, you possess a well-developed commercial acumen and are solutions focused with best practice time management skills. 

Strong interpersonal and communication skills are essential in this role, as is the ability to be forward thinking with the ability to challenge thinking and innovate in a rapidly changing market. 

Six Degrees values life experience, as such volunteer work, community engagement, international or industry experience will be well regarded.

Name: Software Engineering Consultant
Description:
Software Engineering Consultant 

 Location:  This role is open Australia wide and in all major cities: Sydney, Canberra, Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth & Adelaide.  

 About the role 

 This is a role for the problem solver, the constantly curious and the lifelong learner. You'll partner with our clients to help them build bespoke products, modernise their applications and get the most of their technology landscape. This role is more than about systems and coding, it's about asking the right questions, having good practices and collaborating on the bigger picture. You'll help influence our clients on selecting the right technologies, shape requirements, design and architect solutions, set up good engineering and quality practices, and get hands-on with development 

 About you 

 
	 You're a full-stack software engineer who really knows their stuff 
	 Frontend experience in JavaScript and either React, Vue, or even Svelte 
	 Backend experience in Nodejs, Python, Java or Ruby 
	 Previous experience leading and shaping product delivery 
	 You might love anything about the cloud (AWS, Azure or GCP) 
	 A high level of proficiency in modern architecture practices 
	 An expert in engineering practices such as BDD, TDD and CI/CD 
	 A consultant at heart or really want to develop your skills as one 
	 You live and breathe agile (understand the purpose, value and common practices) 
	 You're always curious and always learning 
	 You're "all about the band" and keen to help others learn and develop their knowledge, whether it's through mentoring, Meet-ups, writing blogs or an active Github account. 
 

 Why work for us?  

 At DiUS, we're really proud of the work we do and have an excellent track record in growing our people. We've created a place to call home for those who love emerging tech, are inspired by learning, and want to leave the world a better place than they found it. We're big fans of gaining and sharing knowledge and support our people through funding events, memberships and broader development opportunities.  

 We value our people and provide an inclusive environment. Being different, diverse, and having trust is important for us.  

 At our core, we are driven by our values—always be growing, move humanity forward, seek greatness, and be about the band. They reflect our passion, purpose, and beliefs. We are excited about what comes next in our journey, and we are hoping you'll join us along the way.

Name: *SAP MM Consultant and Manager*
Description:
Job Description

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com. 

We are: 

Accenture’s SAP practice, and we bring the New to life using design thinking, agile development methodologies, and the latest smart tech like IoT, automation, and AI. We even built myConcerto, a mix of SAP and Accenture that helps lead our clients to big wins. Ready to learn as much as you can? We train our people on "new" SAP like SAP Leonardo, S/4HANA and Cloud, and we offer classes and support through our 50,000+ member community. It’s also nice to know our hard work doesn’t go unrecognized. We’ve got over 70 SAP awards—more than any other partner—and we’re the leading business partner for SAP SuccessFactors, SAP Ariba, SAP Hybris, SAP FieldGlass, SAP Concur, and more. 

You are: 

An SAP transformation ace with deep experience helping clients meet the challenges of digitization. You’re in your element using your supply chain know-how and boss-level creative and analytical powers to solve clients’ most complex business problems so their companies can do more. Communication and people skills? You have both in spades and you’re as comfortable inspiring teams to bring their A-game as you are presenting to the C-suite. 

The work: 
•	Be involved in large scale Integration projects
•	Translate business requirements into system solutions
•	Understand the procurement best-practice
•	Gather requirements & write Functional Specs for SAP Material Management Solution
•	Ensure the configuration of the solution meets the complex business needs
•	Work closely with Business Leads, solution team and developers on a daily basis
•	Work autonomously & part of a team to deliver best solutions and outcomes within business needs

Job Qualifications

Qualifications: 

Here’s what you need
•	Strong MM (Materials Management) configuration experience
•	As a Consultant, Minimum 5+ years of experience
•	As a Manager , Minimum 7+ years of experience and 2+ years of experience in managing a team.
•	Experience with MM integration with SD and Finance
•	Self Motivated and proactive, take ownership and follow through
•	Strong communication & presentation skills - both written and verbal

Benefits of working at Accenture:
•	Holistic well-being program including health insurance
•	Life & Salary Continuance Insurance
•	18 weeks paid parental leave
•	Long & short-term career break opportunities
•	Structured career development program
•	Local and international career opportunities.
•	Certified as a Family Inclusive Workplace™
•	Flexible Work Arrangements - centered around Accenture’s Truly Human ethos and our commitment to supporting the health and wellbeing of our people.
•	We are proud to be in the top 3 of last year’s Diversity & Inclusion Index!

We are a WORK180 Endorsed Employer, to see our benefits and policies click here

All our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development. You’ll also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career. 

Accenture is a an EEO and Affirmative Action Employee of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities. 

Equal Employment Opportunity 

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, colour, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

Name: Senior Consultant - Contract and Risk Assurance
Description:
Senior Consultant - Contract and Risk Assurance

Your next role
In this client facing role, you’ll be responsible for planning, developing and delivering internal audits, contract performance audit and assurance engagements. Engagements will include assignments such as financial establishment audits, independent financial audits, review of compliance to contracted commercial terms and arrangements, reviewing operational and maintenance performance against contracted KPIs, funding acquittal audits etc.

You’ll also provide assurance services to our key clients through independent review of project estimates and contractual arrangements prior to contract execution. You’ll utilise your knowledge, skills and experience to support other team members and foster strong client relationships.

Duties and Responsibilities

•	Scoping and delivering a variety of internal audit, contract performance audit and advisory projects
•	Engaging with clients and stakeholders to deliver tailored solutions on a variety of internal audit and contract assurance projects
•	Maintaining and developing good relationships with clients as well as identifying future opportunities
•	Identifying business or technology business or technology risks, internal controls which mitigate risks and related opportunities for internal control improvement

While you may not have direct experience with contract performance audits if you have strong internal audit skills and a genuine interest in specialising in the contract performance audit and assurance space we’re happy to provide training and to develop your skills.

What you will bring
•	Relevant tertiary qualification
•	Post Graduate professional qualifications (CA/CPA/CIA), or currently studying
•	Proven experience in a similar Internal Audit / Contract Performance Audit role 
•	Excellent analytical skills and report writing capability
•	Strong negotiation skills
•	Ability to work autonomously and in a team

What we will offer you

BDO offers professional development, collaborative culture, workplace flexibility, global career growth opportunities and an industry-competitive salary package of $90,000.

We are committed to building your technical, advisory, leadership, and management skills, and balance work with promoting health, wellbeing, workplace giving and social activities. At BDO, we want you to enjoy what you do and the community of colleagues and clients you work with.

As a firm, we embrace an inclusive culture and value the difference and unique perspective of every individual. We are proud to be named an Inclusive Employer for 2021-2022 by Diversity Council Australia (DCA).
To submit your application please click Apply or for further information please contact Matt Coates from our Talent Acquisition Team on 03 9244 2089. 


IDEAS | PEOPLE | TRUST

Recruitment Agencies - thank you for thinking of us, however we do endeavour to fill our opportunities through direct channels wherever possible. If we find that we do need agency assistance, we’ll be in touch.

#BDOCareers
www.bdo.com.au/careers

Name: Management Consultant QLD
Description:
Management Consultant  

 The position 

 The position is responsible for generating business growth and development through the execution of the technologies solutions and recruitment divisions objectives by developing and improving new and current operating models with clients and internal staff and drive efficiencies to contribute positively to the goal of growing the business in market share, customer satisfaction, revenue and gross profit (quarterly and annually), in accordance with the divisions strategic objectives. 

   

 The position is responsible for achieving business (and personal) targets through: 

 • Developing and executing client and internal organisational and operational improvement plans 

 • Providing leadership in business efficiency 

 • Managing operations and client delivery 

   

 Main Accountabilities 

 • Strategy development and execution 

 • Operational management and continual improvement planning 

 • Client development and management 

   

 Strategy development and execution 

 • Research industry delivery models, concepts and innovation to ensure the divisions consulting services are current and competitive 

 • Act as consulting lead or delivery manager for key client consulting and project delivery engagements to implement proposed solutions. 

 • Champion the process from a key clients perspective and work with Division Head in the preparation of new business tenders and pitch presentations, including solution design and the creation of new or improved client delivery models. 

   

 Operational management and continual improvement planning 

 • Drive the adoption of agile methodologies and lead monthly retrospectives to generate CIP’s 

 • Champion client and consultant satisfaction through analysis of NPS surveys and generate appropriate strategies to improve overall NPS 

 • Conduct quarterly reviews with key clients to discuss current levels of performance, existing operating models and potential improvements or innovations to improve 

 • Manage and own customer implementations plans for new customers and improvement and efficiency plans for existing customers 

 • Prepare and recommend proposals to alter operating procedures, delivery models and job functions to drive constant improvement 

 • Lead and manage the induction of consultants to ensure business and client plans have been achieved, and regularly review induction programs to cater for changes in operating models. 

 • Provide leadership, coaching and support to teams and consultants to ensure that they perform to the maximum of their abilities. 

 • Assess and address training needs of consultants to support personal development plans. 

 • Provide regular communication to staff to update them on industry developments, business priorities and client progress and to create a positive working environment. 

   

 Client development and management 

 • Participate in growing existing business through improving customer engagement and increasing customer satisfaction. 

 • Research the competitive landscape and set key strategies for the positioning of Randstad’s service offerings across consulting, projects, staff augmentation and recruitment. 

 • Conduct “as-is” and “to-be” analysis of client and internal service offerings and project delivery. 

 • Ensure operational and client strategy is synergistic with corporate business goals and objectives and facilitates the delivery of successful consulting engagements. 

 • Maintain and develop industry networks to ensure high Randstad profile 

 • Develop and maintain trusted relationships with clients to ensure a good understanding of their current and future priorities and to identify new leads within the Randstad Group 

   

 Candidate profile 

 Experience 

 • Management consulting experience – 2 years minimum experience. 

 • Consistent record of client engagement, with experience of engaging customers around consulting and delivery strategies 

 • Passion for driving and owning continual improvement plans with clients and operations 

 • Knowledge and/or experience of the IT sector and IT service business models 

 • Solution design and project execution experience with key clients 

 • Consultant leadership and onboarding experience 

 • Strong communications skills and excellent stakeholder engagement 

 • Literacy, numeracy and IT ability 

   

 Language skills 

 English 

   

 Reporting Relationship 

 The Lead Management Consultant will report into the Regional Manager or Director. 

   

 Salary $150,000 - $170,000 + Superannuation 

 Please note only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for this role.

Name: Business Transformation Software Implementation Consultant - Sydney
Description:
As a Software Implementation Consultant you will work directly with our clients on key initiatives. You will have the opportunity to build an in-depth understanding of their business issues and implement organizational strategies that drive adoption of change.

As a Software Implementation Consultant what will I responsible for: 

• Provide pre-sales support as the technical specialist and trusted advisor for account managers and business development managers
• Work with other consultants to implement our range of solutions for clients and partners
• Facilitate workshops and gather functional/business requirements from client and partner organizations.
• Translate requirements into appropriate solution designs.
• Scoping, design, configuration, testing and successful delivery of reporting solutions for clients and stakeholders.
• Analysis, cleansing and manipulation of data sets, automating data loads and configuring our technology platform to support proper integration with other downstream/upstream systems.
• Ensure accurate documentation of and delivery to the project scope and timeline. Adherence to the Envizi implementation methodology.
• Providing technical expertise and best practice advice to clients post implementation to assist them in getting the most out of our technology solutions.
• Work with the Envizi product management and development teams to advocate, scope and test enhancements to the suite of Envizi products.
• Work with the services team to identify and implement processes and best practices that improve our agile workplace culture.
• Deliver partner and client training as required.
• Client management during implementation.
• Client advisory work to provide new value to existing clients.
• Providing work estimates to Account Managers and Project Managers for new work.
• Ensure all project artefacts are created in line with company best practices and are stored online in the relevant system.

What experience will I need?

• 3 or more years of analytical experience.
• 3 or more years of solution consulting or relevant industry experience.
• Experience in the delivery of training.
• Experience in any of the following domains will be highly regarded: Energy management, Utilities, Sustainability.
• Experience with or knowledge of any of the following will be highly regarded: energy services, energy tariff/billing and meter data processes such as NEM12, BMS or similar meter/sub-metering technologies.
• Experience in BI, data warehousing, statistical or reporting tools would be advantageous.
• Experience in Agile software environments is a plus.


What skills will I need?

• Ability to work in a high pressure environment, and to deadlines. Exceptional Client service skills
• Troubleshooting skills and logical thinking
• Ability to work with and analyse large volumes of data
• Advanced regular expression coding skills
• Strong data manipulation skills, including an advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel is essential (note - a test is conducted as part of the interview process).
• Ability to work autonomously and take accountability.
• Strong analytical and problem solving skills with excellent attention to detail.
• Dynamic team player who is comfortable working in a small, but rapidly evolving environment.
• A passion for making a difference in your profession and the environment.

This is an exciting opportunity to work with a dynamic, entrepreneurial team in one of the fastest growing sectors of the "green economy".

Offered on a permanent regular employment basis or on a fixed term hire 24 months basis

 To find out more and apply, please visit: 
 
 https://krb-jobs.brassring.com/1033/ASP/TG/cim_jobdetail.asp?partnerid=26059&siteid=5016&Areq=535624BR

Name: Software Implementation Consultant
Description:
You:

We are seeking individuals with business and technology consulting experience to configure and implement SaaS solutions for our customers. Consultants function as integrators between business needs and technology solutions. Your efforts will directly impact the value realized by the customer and the ultimate success of the relationship. This role will work closely with customers and the Apptio Field Delivery team to design and configure customer solutions. If you have the passion and energy to work in an entrepreneurial and fast-paced environment, you are the person we are looking for!

Us:

Apptio is the CIO’s business management system. We build advanced data and analytics applications that help all IT leaders understand and make informed decisions about their technology investments, capitalize on the cloud transformation and drive innovation within their organization. We call it Technology Business Management (TBM). Our TBM solution experts believe deeply in Apptio's potential to lead our market and disrupt the IT industry on a daily basis. We are passionate about what we do and are driven by a common mission to support and elevate the role of CIOs within their organization. We are team players with an entrepreneurial spirit and an eye on results. We work in a highly collaborative and agile environment where we strive to continuously improve.

What we want you to do:

• Gather functional and business requirements from client and translate into a functional hosted solution design, which meets customer needs and provides maximum value.
• Exhibit professional demeanor while communicating with customers and peers.
• Configure, test, & document Apptio dashboards, reports and underlying data models to meet functional design and specifications.
• Exhibit humility while interacting with team members in the organization. Show eagerness to contribute to organizational values.
• Demonstrate passion for continued success of our customers; fortitude and perseverance in challenging situations.
• Be a fast learner and take ownership of knowledge gaps.
• Actively contribute ideas based on previous experience, share perspectives relating to existing situations.
• Collaborate with other departments in the company to achieve customer satisfaction and resolve customer issues in a timely fashion.
• Work with product management and development organizations to channel client feedback and solutions into future releases of the Apptio product suite.
• Work with content management to channel commonalities across customers into best practices processes & product delivered templates.

Requirements:

Basic Qualifications:
• 4+ years of experience in as business analyst, consulting or technical analyst role
• Customer facing experience either
• Bachelor degree in Engineering, Computer Science, MIS, Finance or equivalent experience
• Ability to demonstrate experience with data analysis and data manipulation.

Preferred Qualifications:

General
• Self-starter – able to come up to speed on complex, difficult concepts with minimal assistance.
• Experience with Excel, SQL,
• Team player with solid communication and presentation skills.
• Competent with packaged and SaaS application software implementation practices.
• High-level knowledge of enterprise IT organizational, business and technical environments.
• Client-focused attitude – a customer advocate.
• Consulting experience in enterprise systems implementations
• Ability to breakdown complex information to simple solution requirements

Business Domain Focus
• Specific knowledge and application of IT services and financial management including budgeting cost allocations, capital & operating expense handling, program portfolio management, and application / infrastructure support.
• Operational knowledge of IT infrastructure domains including data centers, network / communications, server utilization, virtual environments, storage, and application development / support

Technical Domain Focus
• Experience with data analysis and relational databases.
• Skilled at working with large data sets, quickly detecting and resolving data-related issues.
• Skilled at completing technical design via iterative mockups.
• Basic programming skills and data analytics e.g. HTML, SQL, Excel, Access, Business Objects, etc.
• Executive report and dashboard design, SQL / SSRS, KPI’s, Tableau etc.
• Training / certification in ITIL or equivalent

Salary

AU$80,000 - AU$100,000 per annum (excl super)

The Company
Apptio is the business management system of record for hybrid IT. We transform the way IT runs its business and makes decisions. With our cloud-based applications, IT leaders manage, plan and optimize their technology investments across on-premises and cloud. With Apptio, IT leaders become strategic partners to the business by demonstrating value of IT investments, accelerate innovation and shift their technology investments from running the business to digital innovation. Hundreds of customers, including more than 40 percent of the Fortune 100, choose Apptio as their business system of record for hybrid IT.
Apptio Inc. is not open to 3rd party solicitation or resumes for our posted FTE positions. Resumes received from 3rdparty agencies that are unsolicited will be considered complimentary. Apptio, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Apptio, Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Apptio’s COVID-19 Vaccine-or-Testing Policy goes into effect on January 10, 2022. All employees, contractors, partners, customers, visitors and vendors who work in or visit an Apptio office or attend an Apptio event in the United States, India, Australia, Japan and Singapore must be either (a) fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or (b) have a negative COVID-19 test result prior to entering an Apptio office or event. This includes all co-working offices or serviced offices (WeWork, Regus, etc.). Please reach out to your recruiting contact throughout the interviewing process with any questions.

Name: Claims Consultant
Description:
Customer Service Role - 6 Month contract - Hybrid Work Arrangement - $31.25p/hr + Super - Full Time  Your new company  Are a highly established and well recognised insurance company who are looking to recruit a Claims Consultant to join their Brisbane team. The position they are looking for is on a 6 month temporary contract with the opportunity for permanency or extension. Our client is looking for someone who can work full time hours, Mon - Fri for a total of 37.5 hours per week with work from home flexibility.  Your new role Day to day you will report to the team lead and be responsible for: 

Taking inbound and outbound calls
Corresponding with relevant stakeholders to provide updates on claims progress
Update relevant CRM system
Gathering and documenting relevant information
Assist and support other team members

  What you'll need to succeed

Prior customer service preferred with call centre experience desirable
Be able to handle various systems and processes
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to manage customers over the phone
Ability to work in a team/ KPI environment

  What you'll get in return

Work from home flexibility

Name: HCM Sr Workforce Software Principal Consultant, Professional Services, AU
Description:
Description

Rizing HCM seeks an experienced WorkForce Software Lead for its Professional Services Team. The Principal Consultant will provide first class service and post-sales support to Rizing HCM's Professional Services customers with the ability to support Local and Global WFS projects as required. Additionally, the Principal Consultant will work closely with customers to deliver and support human resources systems that are based on industry best practices.

Essential Functions

• Functions as a subject matter expert to deliver Workforce Software Projects/ Time Management Suite.

• Creates and delivers high quality demonstrations and presentations.

• Gathers and analyses clients’ Payroll business requirements and objectives.

• Designs, configures, and provides support oversight of the multi-modules of the Workforce Software Suite.

• Delivers best practice and compliance consulting services to customer.

• Delivers workforce management functionality specifications for the technical team to build interfaces.

• Works with client to plan and organize QA testing.

• Facilitates knowledge transfer with clients via customer/administrator and end user training.

• Able to conduct and perform a workshop with customers to identify scope, requirements, and business outcomes.

Essential Functions (Continued)

• Strong documentation and knowledge capturing skills.

• Ability to articulate and transfer knowledge to others.

• Exceptional stakeholder engagement and influencing skills.

• Able to demonstrate rapport building skills with prospects and customers.

• Ability to work in a distributed workforce environment.

• Able to work individually as well as in a team.

• Mentors’ junior consultants by coaching and/or training to them on new systems, enhancements, and project deliverables; providing quality review of work.

• Completes continuing education activities to attain and maintain professional certifications, including continuous learning of new lines of HR business and Workforce Software products/technologies.

• Creates and delivers high quality demonstrations and presentations.

• Performs other duties as assigned.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems/Technology or Business, or equivalent experience in a relevant field.
At least 5 years of experience in implementing or providing support for workforce management systems. preferable in Workforce Management or SAP HCM Time and Attendance or Kronos Central/Dimensions.
Strong domain knowledge of time and attendance processes and workflows.
Up to date with Certifications and Accreditations (e.g., WFS).
Ability to understand and perform mapping, configurations, setups, pay rules, base extensions as well as other configs.
Experience in SQL or similar.
Advanced excel skills (e.g., pivot tables) or similar (e.g., Smartsheet, Anaplan).
Strong understanding of payroll legislation experience.
Ability to interpret employment instruments (e.g., EBAs, Awards, etc.) and configure into solution.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSAs)
• Advanced excel skills (e.g., pivot tables) or similar (e.g., Smartsheet, Anaplan).

• Strong understanding of payroll legislation experience.

• Ability to interpret employment instruments (e.g., EBAs, Awards, etc.) and configure into solution.

• Understand key industries and challenges (e.g., healthcare/aged care – royal commission’s recommendations)

• Understand key business drivers, KPIs and metrics for each organisation engaged

• Exceptional stakeholder engagement and influencing skills.

• Ability to translate, interpret long-term strategic objectives to quick tactical wins o E.g., Digital HR transformation (long-term), solving payroll challenges with payroll solution (tactical win)

• Capture and document business outcomes and objectives to help with Project Manager/Marketing/Sales build customer success stories / business cases.

• Ability to manage time and multiple projects with a high degree of attention to detail.

• Thought leadership.

Competencies

Excellence
Respect
Collaboration
Integrity
Courage

Name: Consultant
Description:
Consultant

About Consulting & Implementation Services

Consulting & Implementation Services Pty Ltd (CIS) is a mid-tier management consulting firm established in 1995. Our firm differentiates itself by providing clients with ‘results, not just reports’. This means we deliver solutions that are both insightful and practical to provide real value to our clients. Our commitment to ensuring that business solutions can be implemented by our clients has helped CIS solidify a loyal client base and fosters our continued growth across all service lines.

Our firm consults to a wide range of industry sectors both public and private with a particular focus on servicing the academic and research community, where the firm has become a market leader. CIS has now raised nearly $1 billion in funding from grants and other funding programs which makes us the dominant providers of support services to clients wishing to secure funding for innovative projects.

Our company’s core service lines include:

- Research Strategy, Business Planning, Organisation Reviews and Redesign
- Cooperative Research Centre (CRC) and grant application support
- Commercialisation, capital sourcing, company establishment and human resource management
- Intellectual Property (IP) audits and supporting identification of commercial and research project opportunities

The opportunity

CIS is seeking to expand its team with the appointment of 2 Consultants. In this role, you will work among a small but highly skilled and qualified team and be exposed to all facets of client projects.

Your application will highlight following qualification(s), skills and experience that will be used to support client engagements, complete desk-based research, conduct analysis of survey data, manage the collection and reporting of project information, and convert this work into components of reports and presentations. You will also be required to develop strategies and plans for clients, assess current shortcomings and provide recommendations to clients, prepare proposals, assist clients with implementation, ensuring that project objectives are met, prepare documentation, training etc. This role will be instrumental in assisting clients’ achieve efficiency and solve their organizational problems.

- A Bachelors and/or a Master’s degree in a relevant field such as business, management, finance and accounting.
- Outstanding writing skills and the ability to convey information with simplicity and clarity
- Strong numerical and analytical skills and demonstrated proficiency in interpreting, analysing and representing qualitative and quantitative data
- Capability and competence to work across a range of projects and the ability to adapt to the situation at hand
- Experience managing demands and expectations of both internal and client stakeholders
- Understanding of and networks with the Higher Education and Research sector
- Experience in supporting the development of major grant applications (such as the CRC program) would be ideal
- At least 2 years of relevant experience (preferrable but not mandatory)

The skills outlined above will be complemented by highly sought-after personal traits, including an ability to work independently, a positive disposition (even under pressure), an ability to take initiative, deal with ambiguity and juggle multiple deadlines. In addition, you will ideally possess diverse work experience and interests, as well as a strong academic background.

Why work with CIS?

This is a rare opportunity to join a successful, well established and growing management consulting firm who have become the market leader in their space. Our office is in a 5-star green rated premises in Collins Street, Docklands, directly opposite the ANZ head office.

Examples of major projects where CIS was involved include:

- Leading and acting as the CEO of the RACE for 2030 CRC, until the consortium had secured 79 partners and raised $322 million in funding.
- Facilitating a series of workshops at the University of Melbourne, which saw 15 projects identified as having commercial potential with over half now securing research funding.
- Developing a compelling business case for the University of the Sunshine Coast (USC). USC was successfully selected by the Moreton Bay Regional Council to be the Anchor Education Partner and have recently opened a new campus in the Moreton Bay area.
- Developing Strategic Investment Plans (SIP) for 32 horticulture sectors, which saw the allocations of scarce investment funds focused on areas of highest impact and priority.

This is an opportunity to work with one of the most highly regarded firms in its sector, with strong training and development opportunities provided, the opportunity for travel, and an excellent starting salary.

How to Apply

To apply for this role, please send your application to Euan Buxton at euanbuxton@consultingis.com.au
Applications should consist of a curriculum vitae, covering letter and an academic transcript.

Further further information, please visit the Consulting & Implementation Services website at https://consultingis.com.au/. The deadline for applications is 5:00 PM AEST, Friday, 8th July 2022.

Other information

Contract Type: Permanent

Contract Hours: Full Time

Remuneration: $80,000 - $120,000

ABN: 84 072 585 927

Name: Senior Consultant
Description:
Altman Solon Senior Consultant 

 Altman Solon is a 500-person strategy consulting group that focuses exclusively on the telecommunications, media and technology (TMT) related sectors.  

 The Senior Consultant role is a mid-level role and is open to professionals with an M.B.A. or equivalent work experience. As a Senior Consultant at Altman Solon, you will play a critical role in leading teams through project analyses, formulating recommendations, and presenting findings to clients. Responsibilities include: 

 
	 Guiding day-to-day activities of one or more project workstreams, typically owning a workstream while also managing teams of analysts and consultants across a variety of activities, including: 
	 Market sizing, business model development, and other quantitative analyses 
	 Development of original frameworks and strategies including customer segmentation, go-to-market strategies, churn reduction initiatives, etc. 
	 Assuming a key role with clients as day-to-day contact, ensuring we are providing innovative and actionable solutions to their most critical problems 
	 Leading deck development and presentation of key findings and recommendations to our clients 
	 Developing content-specific knowledge while supporting business development efforts and building client relationships 
 

  We are looking for a Senior Consultant who can: 

 Independently plan and execute on one or more research and/or analysis tasks. This includes: 

 
	 Creating workplans from the project’s high-level goals, setting efficient yet practical deadlines, and developing an approach to the research and/or analysis needed 
	 Leveraging problem solving skills to generate frameworks and structure the client’s business problem into logical manageable components that will guide their growth strategy 
	 Remaining flexible and adaptable when goals or deadlines shift, and being able to scale a workstream to meet the client’s needs 
	 Leading junior staff in designing financial and operational models and conducting secondary and primary research gathering activities, including surveys and expert interviews 
	 Synthesizing complex data and qualitative information into meaningful insights 
 

   Meaningfully contribute to the team’s efforts in achieving client goals. This includes: 

 
	 Confidently communicating complex ideas and concepts via verbal, written, and visual means 
	 Playing an active role in formulating the full storyline of the project, and being able to distil the key information into an executive narrative 
	 Establishing a viewpoint on what key questions should be prioritized beyond what’s articulated in the explicit agreement and developing hypotheses that address those questions 
 

   Effectively manage one to two Analysts. This includes: 

 
	 Delegating work effectively, offering clear goals for the output while leaving the Analyst or Consultant room to be creative and have ownership over their approach 
	 Proactively quality checking Analyst work, probing on methodology taken and results obtained 
 

 Please send your resume to: 

 recruiting-europe altmansolon.com
