Name: Security Governance Risk & Compliance Manager
Description:
Skills and Capabilities:
•Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Security, Information Systems, or related field
•Demonstrated experience with change management, problem solving and ‘business as usual’ operations activities
•Previous experience developing Information Security reports for senior leadership 
•Strong understanding of superannuation industry is highly desirable
•Proven background working in a Security GRC position within complex environment
•Being comfortable with a high degree of on-the-job learning
•An understanding of the world of Information Security and a keen sense to learn
•Understand the NIST Cyber Security Framework (CSF), business processes, security governance, audit compliance and risk assessment
•Be able to handle the challenges of a varied role in a dynamic organization
•Ability to identify tasks and activities required to meet project requirements and to set goals and priorities in line with business objectives
•Ability to contribute to short, medium- and long-term planning and effectively promote ideas
•Ability to define processes and document procedures (essential)
•A high standard of presentation, customer service and strong interpersonal skills
•The ability to effectively convey security risks to technical and non-technical stakeholders

Job description:
Have strong, open communication within the team. Must be most supportive of their peers, giving and taking advice and feedback in an honest, open environment and striving to improve knowledge and competency of self and team. Ensure delivery of Information Security Governance Risk & Compliance by-
•Assisting to maintain and improve the compliance of the NIST Cyber Security Framework (CSF).
•Performing security risk assessments and third-party security risk assessments
•Providing governance and oversight of the patch & vulnerability management process
•Facilitating workshops and review sessions with stakeholders and managing their feedback and expectations.
•Analysing and capturing requirements in collaboration with all stakeholders.
•Assisting to maintain and improve Information Security policies, standards, guidelines, and processes.
•Interpreting security controls with relevant compliance, legal and regulatory requirements especially APRA
•Assisting to prepare, maintain and improve security performance and operational reports.
•Assisting with timely and accurate tracking, maintaining, verifying and reporting non-conformance and corrective action/s
•Assist with annual security control testing, collate and report results against NIST Cyber Security Framework (CSF)
•Assisting with the annual internal and external audit program
 
Location: Melbourne
Permanent Full-time position

Name: Dynamics 365 F&O Senior / Principal Functional Consultant
Description:
F&O Functional Consultant / Senior Consultant / Principal Consultant
 

This role can be based anywhere in Australia

 
In this role you will be a part of large-scale, complex D365 implementations. You will be responsible for working with DXC customers and leading solution teams in planning, designing, building, testing, and maintaining Dynamics 365 implementations. 

Role Responsibilities
 

Work with the client to meet timelines, ensure quality and meet budget
Involved with the end-to end implementation, including scoping, design, configuration and testing
Analyse business processes and provide solutions
Continuously update business on implementation progress and problem resolution
Assist in system and business process re-engineering as required
Ensure technical design quality requirements are met

Experience Required
 

Extensive experience with Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations
Strong Consulting experience in the Microsoft eco-system including D365 F&O or AX 2012 R2, R3 full lifecycle implementations - specifically in Finance and/or Supply Chain and/or Retail
Experience with the Microsoft Power platform, specifically Power BI
Exceptional Consulting skills gained across multiple projects and industries
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage competing priorities in a complex environment
Ability to convey a strong presence, professional image, and deal confidently with complex technical problems
Client Centric attitude, with a sense of urgency, strong teamwork, flexible and positive ‘can do’ approach

Name: Human Factors Consultant
Description:
Ergonomie Australia Pty Ltd is looking for a motivated Human Factors Consultant to join the team to provide human factors advice to the Company’s clients across a broad range of industry, including transport, product design, built environment and organizational systems and safety management.

Daily Responsibilities include:
•	Conducting and analysing human factors research and producing human factors recommendations.
•	Preparing and delivering reports and presentation to key internal and external stakeholders, including industry groups
•	Facilitating and sharing expertise with team, where required
•	Escalating any client or project-related roadblocks or issues to management, including attending regular monthly operational meetings 
•	Keeping Ergonomie abreast of current development and trends in human factors and engage in continual learning in human factors and related disciplines. 

Required Skills:
•	A tertiary level degree in appropriate discipline, such as Human Factors, Psychology, Ergonomics, Human Kinetics
•	At least 2 years of work experience in similar role
•	Experience with working with virtual reality as an HF design tool
•	Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously
•	Ability to prioritise multiple tasks and deadlines
•	Clear communication skills 
•	Positive attitude and affable manners are an add on.

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
We are looking to hire an experienced consultant to join our high performing tech recruitment business. 

•	Structured training at every level and ongoing one on one career coaching 
•	Award winning brand of high performing recruiters
•	Lucrative commissions paying up to 50% of billings
•	Paying $80,000 – $110,000 base 
•	We take our job seriously, but not so much ourselves 


We are an award-winning IT and Accounting & Finance recruitment agency based in Sydney. Running for over 10 years, we have four hands-on directors who are highly experienced and passionate about recruitment. 

We are looking to hire experienced recruitment consultants from all sectors to join our award-winning brand. 

What do we offer you? 

SustainAbility Consulting is part of the SustainGroup, made up of four brands across Digital, Business Support and Health. We make up a group of 50+ consultants on the sales floor and cross-share clients across all brands. We have experienced YOY growth since inception, and are hiring across our technology and finance divisions as a result of growth, with more roles than we can currently handle. 

Work alongside our hands-on Directors, who each have 20+ years of experience in the recruitment space in Sydney. We emphasise personal development and learning, with internal and external trainers and guerrilla sessions on current trends. All new hires participate in our 12-week training program offered by Inspire Performance, which will allow you to make the most of your strengths and improve your recruitment skills. All consultants have one on one career coaching and goal setting with Inspire Performance to help you achieve personalised goals. You will have genuine opportunities for growth and development! 

We offer a culture that is fun, relaxed and allows you to be in charge of your own day. We take pride in our solid retention rates and highly successful consultants who offer our candidates and clients a first-class recruitment experience way beyond the market average. We have a buzzy office, with discounted gym memberships, weekly PT, Friday breakfasts and a social club organising monthly events! You will be able to join us on our quarterly incentive trips, some recent events have been Houseboats on the Hawkesbury River and a weekend in the Hunter Valley. 

You will also join us on our Charity Days. We partner with Stepping Stone House and are involved in Working Bee's, Charity Sail days and Sleep Under the Stars.

So, in short, some of the perks: 

-	Well established and reputable recruitment agency in Sydney, with a well-established database to get you up and running quickly 
-	Quarterly incentives trips for the whole team taking us across NSW, QLD, NZ and more 
-	60% of our annual business comes from repeat business, with a well-established client base 
-	Work alongside many of our $1M+ billers
-	Mentorship program
-	We promote retained and exclusive businesses as much as possible 
-	Uncapped commission structure paying up to 50% of billings 
-	Dress for your day 
-	Multiple charity days per year
-	One on one training with inspire performance 
-	12-week 360 recruitment training for every new hire run by Inspire Performance 
-	Cross sharing between all brands in the SustainGroup
-	Structured career progression with clear milestones up to Associate Director
-	Candidate managers working across the team 
-	Regular social events 
-	Work from home flexibility
-	Expensed phone plans up to $80 a month, standing desks & laptop set up for flexible working 
-	Friday PT, Friday breakfasts, Social sports teams, Bake offs, weekly yoga and so much more 


As a Recruitment Consultant, you will:

•	Have a full 360-degree focus, new business development, account management and candidate management 
•	Develop expert knowledge within your niche market vertical 
•	Offer your clients and candidates an exceptional service, always 
•	Attend and run networking events in your market vertical
•	Maintain and build our relationship with existing clients 
•	Maintain candidate and client satisfaction through our real-time surveys 
•	Utilise content marketing to attract candidates and clients and develop our brand

You will manage the entire life cycle of the recruitment process, focusing on a niche vertical market in the technology or finance space.

Name: Principal Consultant - .Net/Azure App Dev and Integration
Description:
Due to growth, we have a great opportunity for a Principal Consultant with solid .Net & Azure App Dev and/or Integration experience, to join our Professional Services team. This role can be based in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane or NZ.
 
#15 Best Place to Work in Australia
Opportunity to work for an innovative, award winning, global Microsoft partner
Great career opportunity
 
 
About us...
 
Insight is a Global Fortune 500 Microsoft Partner and end-to-end solutions provider. We've been in business since 1988 and have 11,500 staff across the globe. We were awarded #15 Best Place to Work in Australia for 2021.
 
 
About you…
 
We are seeking a Principal Consultant to join our Professional Services team. This role will suit a strategic thinker in the App Dev/Integration space with strong pre-sales experience and an outstanding client manner. You will be keen to mentor internal technical resources and aid in the ongoing development of the Practice through contribution to quality initiatives, standards and frameworks.
 
You will have mature technical architecture design skills, and a willingness to be ‘hands-on’.
 
 
Your background will include...
Experience leading technical delivery teams on client projects
Excellent client-facing manner and ability to liaise to C-level (role includes frequent presales)
Very strong written communication, including production of high-quality technical artefacts and presales contributions (proposals and presentations
Demonstrated hands on experience in designing, building and implementing Microsoft solutions based around Azure IaaS and PaaS.
Solid experience with Azure Integration Services including API Management, Logic Apps, Service Bus and Event Grid.
Deep knowledge of Enterprise Integration Patterns, Microservices, as well as Hybrid Cloud to On-Premises and Cloud to Cloud Integration Architectures.
Experience in DevOps practices including automated CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure-as-Code.
Experience in App Migration/ Modernisation / Lift and Shift
Experience with the Azure Data Platform including (Azure SQL, SQL Data Warehouse, Data Factory).

We enjoy...
Flexible work arrangements
Regular company sponsored social events
Paid training
A culture of innovation
Dedicated career pathways and development planning
Awards and incentives
Supportive and approachable management
Competitive salaries and benefits
Option to purchase annual leave
Fun, friendship and family

What now...
 
If you want to be part of a growing company where you can continue learning, add value and be appreciated for what you do then please apply to Lisa Armitage, Talent Acquisition Specialist.
 
Check out our website for more info and case studies
https://au.insight.com/en_AU/solve/digital-innovation.html

Name: Functional Consultant / Business Analyst -Australia Syd,Melb,Bris, Perth, Adelaide
Description:
This job can be remote from anywhere within Australia - Syd, Melb, Bris, Adelaide, Perth  

 The D365 Finance & Operations Functional Consultant / Business Analyst (Finance or T/L) will take on this client facing role with lead responsibility for the functional area, supporting our existing clients and implementing new client solutions. 
   
Responsibilities include: 

 
	 Lead the functional analysis and design workshops, advising clients on the use D365 F&O based on best practices and the customer’s business processes focusing on Financial and Supply Chain Consulting. 
	 Identify gaps between standard processes and customer's business processes and document functional design specifications, including modifications. 
	 Identify and recognise issues and risks and communicate to client and project team. 
	 Configure D365 F&O Finance Apps. 
	 Work with development team on testing and implementation of code modifications. 
	 Provide functional training and support for customers. 
 

 Skills & Experience 

 
	 Minimum 3 years’ functional consulting experience in the implementation of Dynamics AX / D365 F&O, Financial module and Trade / Logistics 
	 Previous experience in a Finance/Accounting position or Supply Chain 
	 Familiarity with business processes best practices for the Australian industries. 
	 Ability to understand, interpret client business processes and requirements and communicate at C level 
	 Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with a strong attention to detail. 
	 Excellent time management and planning skills and ability to work under minimal supervision, multi-task and prioritise work. 
	 Customer oriented and passionate about delivering exceptional outcomes. 
	 A background in the Professional Services/Technology Consulting industry is desirable. 
 

 Education 

 
	 Tertiary qualifications in Business, Accounting, Operations or MIS is preferable.

Name: Customer Service Consultant
Description:
A National organisation is seeking enthusiastic Customer Service Consultants to join their team.  Your new company This company aims to be the best company for ecological transformation. They are a growing brand and aim to provide amazing solutions that are practical and useful for management of waste, energy and water. They believe in the 3 R's - Reduce, Reuse and Recycle  Your new role Reporting to the Team Leader, you will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service to ensure highest level of customer satisfaction. You will also need to be proactively manage new leads, identify opportunities and upsell, conduct other necessary steps to ensure contracts meet requirements and also assist with other administrative tasks as outlined by your leader. Strong attention to detail and administrative skills
Excellent skills in data entry and being able to multi-task
Should be able to work well within a team and have the ability to work autonomously
Ability to confidently answer phones and work well within set targets and KPI's
Should be adaptable to changing environments and demonstrate resilience

Weekly pay cycles
Nominated choice of superannuation fund
Online timesheet submission and approval
No hidden fees or costs for our services
Regular contact with local Adelaide consultants throughout the duration of your assignment

 What you need to do now Submit your application using the Apply Now button. Please note, this online form should take no longer than 5 minutes to complete and is required for your application to be considered. Should you meet the requirements for one of these roles a Hays consultant will endeavour to contact you with relevant roles as they are released.  At Hays, we value diversity and are passionate about placing people in a role where they can flourish and succeed. We actively encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply.  If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. Name: Murex Front Office Consultant

Responsibilities

Skills
Must have

Name: Management Consultant
Description:
The Marlo Group are seeking highly experienced and passionate Management Consultant to join our growing team to work in Melbourne. The role is designed to work as an independent consultant providing professional expertise and advice relating to strategy, structure, management, and operations to Marlo and its clients with the aim of meeting the Marlo’s long-term purposes and objectives.

Location: Melbourne

The responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

•	Assisting and encouraging the development of objectives, strategies and plans aimed at achieving client customer satisfaction and the efficient use of Marlo’s resources
•	Discussing business and organisational shortcomings
•	Analysing and evaluating current systems and structures
•	Discussing current systems with staff and observing systems at all levels of Marlo
•	Directing Marlo management towards more efficient organisation and developing solutions to organisational problems

Skills & Experience

•	Strong Merger and Acquisition experience across different jurisdictions
•	Extensive experience in reviewing and interpreting a variety of complex contractual provisions and effectively communicating to stakeholders
•	Effective team player, excellent written and verbal communication skills
•	Strengths in planning and prioritising, problem solving and decision making
•	Effective internal/external stakeholder engagement skills, confident at interacting at all levels both within and outside of the organisation
•	Strong negotiation and contract drafting skills with an eye for detail
•	Self-starter who is action and impact oriented, possesses a strong sense of urgency and the ability to work independently or as part of a team, in an intensely deadline-oriented environment
•	Trustworthy, demonstrating experience working with confidential information and in confidential situations, high integrity, and an unyielding commitment to legal and regulatory compliance
•	Degree in Law, Business, Finance or Business Management
•	Language Skills: Proficient in English 
•	Minimum 3 years’ experience in a similar role.

Salary range $150,000 - $170,000

Name: Electronic Security Technician
Description:
About Element Security

Element Security is a rapidly expanding business with over 14 year’s operating in the industry. Our mission is to be the preferred electronic security provider across multiple sectors and industries. We are committed to being at the fore front of technology and new concept implementation.   

About the role 

We are looking for an experienced Security Technician to be a part of our dynamic team in South Sydney. In this exciting role you will be supported to stay up to date with emerging technology advances and trends through formal training and certifications. With your exceptional customer service skills and strong technical ability, you will be responsible for: installation, servicing and maintaining of security systems including but not limited to Security Alarms, CCTV, Intercoms, IP Surveillance & Access control; programming and commissioning of various types of control systems; back to base alarm monitoring configurations and setups; routine service and maintenance.
 
About you 

We are looking to hear from experienced security technicians. To be successful in this role you will need to address the following. 

Selection Criteria: 

	 Cabling, electronics or computer networking experience 
	 Knowledge of electronic systems repairs and/or installation 
	 Experience in areas such as CCTV, Alarms, Surveillance systems or Access control is a huge advantage 
	 Strong customer service skills 
	 Great communications skills 
	 A can-do attitude and willingness to learn 
	 Experience in the electronic security industry 
	 Drivers licence(manual) 
	 Security Licence 
	 Construction White card 
	 Cabling Licence 
 
Benefits and perks 

At Element Security we believe that loyalty is the key to any business relationship. Our employees are our most important asset and your hard work and commitment to the team will be rewarded with: 
 
	 An autonomous work environment 
	 Formal training and support 
	 Flexible hours with a focus on work-life balance 
	 Competitive remuneration package including company car, laptop and phone 
 
Please apply with an updated resume and cover letter addressing the selection criteria above. If you have any questions regarding the role please reach out to admin@elementsecurity.com.au  We will be shortlisting as applications are received so please don’t hesitate to apply now.

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
Why should I move into Recruitment?

As a Recruitment Consultant, you'll be playing a crucial role in helping people find a job they’ll love. You'll manage our client's open job positions utilizing new technology and your incredible people skills. Hudson will provide you with control over your days, yet, you also need to expect the unexpected because every day is different. Along the way, you will learn from various specialist industries and impact the future of your clients' organisations by finding them great talent. 

If you want a job where you can define your success, keep reading!

What a typical recruitment consultant's day looks like?

Stay energised because your typical day will consist of a lot of interactions:
•	Attend meetings about the latest client's assignment
•	Marketing and business development
•	Candidate interactions and post placement support 
•	Client communication & support
•	You might add some social events, networking and after-work drinks to your schedule when it suits!

What you'll need to succeed:

•	You aim high. You are resilient, tenacious and focused on outcomes. 
•	You have a healthy competitive spirit and a passion for achieving targets, leading to financial reward and personal satisfaction.
•	You have a passion for sales and customer success
•	You have other relatable experience from another industry such as Sales Representative, Account Executive, Account Manager or Business Development Manager
•	You are all about building long term relationships based on trust and honesty
•	You feel energised by people, are curious about them and enjoy delighting them with your service
•	You're not afraid of hard work to reach your goals, but you like to have a good time, too.
•	You are a permanent resident or Australian or New Zealand citizen. 

As a Recruitment Specialist, you'll build and nurture relationships with mostly top-tier SME clients and new clients coming from you!

What you'll get in return .... Where should we start?

•	Uncapped, transparent bonus scheme 
•	A choice of career path (individual or management) & progression criteria to get you promoted sooner 
•	Flexible working conditions, including work from home opportunities
•	On the job learning & development program
•	Ongoing support and coaching from your leadership group
•	Discounts including gym membership, health insurance, Apple store and more!
•	In addition to your annual leave, get 4 extra days off per year 
•	Generous parental leave policy
•	Employee Assistance Program and salary continuance insurance, because we will look after you when you're well and when you're not.

Remuneration
$90,000 -$100,000

Name: Showroom Sales Consultant

The role:

Strong negotiation skills with the ability to influence a positive outcome
Good negotiating and communication skills

Name: Senior Recruitment Consultant
Description:
Seeking an enthusiastic and client focused Recruitment Consultant to join our Energy team in the Brisbane office. 
 
This is a 360 degree role that will see you work at gaining new clients for the business while maintaining and supporting many established and repeat accounts. You will source and manage permanent and contract candidates offering workforce solutions to clients and supporting the careers of all candidates. You will be dedicated to providing a premium service and embrace technology software and best practice in order to do this. Your commercial mind will always be looking for ways to provide a superior service. 
 
Job Tasks and Responsibilities: 
• Complete all daily and weekly activities diligently 
• Interviewing, references and candidate calls 
• Post advertisements and maintain a social media presence 
• Undertake creative and innovative search techniques as part of your daily job 
• Complete compliance tasks and due diligence requirements 
• Effectively manage your job vacancies with an innovative approach and keep stakeholders informed of progress at all times 
• Ensure effective records keeping 
• Ensure awareness of risk and commercial issues are handled diligently and proactively. 
• Client service delivery 
• While our focus is on both permanent and contract recruitment, we go above and beyond with candidate and contractor care as well as client engagement initiatives. 
 
Key Criteria 
 
This role is business critical to the future growth of the organisation and Titan Recruitment will provide you with a well-developed database with excellent capability, high level recruitment tools, industry contacts and personal development. 
 
You will need to demonstrate understanding of the recruitment world from an agency perspective. We are looking for driven, fast paced and highly motivated individuals that want to work with proven processes and systems and support the existing framework of Titan. 
 
Determination, tenacity and an exceptional work ethic will be required to run alongside this high performing team. In return for your dedication, you will work with a supportive and inclusive team that will develop your skills and harness your craft. 
 
What's on Offer? 
 
• A Hot desk with established clients and large database of candidates 
• You will be rewarded with a competitive salary package and excellent Incentive Scheme. 
• We are committed to creating a comfortable working environment by providing modern offices in the CBD with great end of ride facilities. 
• The open plan office provides , coffee machine and fully stocked kitchen. 
• To ensure your success within recruitment, we arm you with a leading technology platforms from bespoke market mapping program, access to LinkedIn Recruiter, Seek advertising, and most importantly a high quality warm database of candidates and clients. All leaders within the business hold long and lasting relationship with key business figures and Titan has strong and collaborative partnerships that are shared with the team. 
• We have an active calendar which includes client and contractor events and sundowners, attending industry relevant luncheons/ webinars/ networking events, team celebrations for EOFY and the annual Christmas party. 
• We throw monthly team lunches for the office, WFH a day per week, enjoy casual attire on Fridays and share daily well intentioned banter! 
• Salary range $75,000 - $100,000 per annum based on experience + great commission. 
 
For more information and a confidential discussion please contact Kevin Warner on 0411 123 776 or click Apply Now'.

Name: Management Consultant
Description:
dandolopartners is seeking a Management Consultant to join their growing team in the role of Manager. This is an exceptional opportunity for a driven individual to join one of Australia’s leading public policy and strategy consultancies.
 
Based in Melbourne, the Management Consultant will work in the role of Manager with dandolopartners’ directors and external project partners, providing strategic advice to organisations in and around government and from a range of sectors - including education, health, justice, innovation and not-for-profit.

Name: Consultant Anaesthetist - WA - 6 months contract  - salaried role - start Dec
Description:
A regional hospital in WA requires the services of a 6 months salaried locum   Consultant Anaesthetist  
 
 Dates:                                    Commencing December 15th 2020 for  6 months 
 
 Hours:                                  80 hour fortnight  (including on-call) - 10 hour shifts
 Rate of pay:                        Depending on experience upto $2800 per day (inclusive of on-call)
 Inclusions:                          Travel expenses paid 
                                           Accommodation provided for duration of locum
                                           Vehicle provided for duration of stay including for limited private use
 Position:                                 The position is for an experienced Consultant Anaesthetist. Must be able to provide anaesthetics for a broad range of surgical  specialities such as orthopaedic, colorectal, urology, ECT, O &G,  plastics, dental, obstetrics, ENT and paediatric anaesthesia down to 15 kgs.
 Apply Now

Name: Recruitment Consultant VIC
Description:
Randstad are looking for experienced Recruitment Consultants to join our team. 

We are actively recruiting across the following specialisations: Banking, Finance and Accounting Digital, Sales, and Marketing Technologies HR Construction, Property and Engineering Education

You will be maintaining existing relationships whilst building your own network of clients and candidates, growing your brand in the market and becoming an expert in your industry sector. Here at Randstad, we offer long-term job security, purpose, strong connection to our values and mission, consistent learning and development and genuine career advancement opportunities. You will enjoy working with an extremely driven, positive and passionate team, who share common goals and work together to deliver successful outcomes.

Main Responsibilities: 

Full responsibility on the recruitment process
Candidate and client management
Maintain databases of Clients and Candidates
Utilising a variety of platforms including social media, LinkedIn and job boards to attract talent.
Preparing Contract and Onboarding Documentation
Undertaking negotiations on terms and conditions of employment, and examining and resolving disputes and grievances
Candidate sourcing and screening in line with job requirements and job briefs.
Guide candidates throughout the recruitment process
About you:

To be successful you will have previous recruitment agency experience locally or overseas, a minimum of two years. You will be passionate about providing HR/recruitment solutions for clients. You will have experience in business development as well as superior candidate management. You will be a positive person and a team-player with exceptional interpersonal skills to build and sustain strong internal and external business relationships. You are a high achiever with a competitive nature and a desire to succeed in a sales environment. In return we offer a fun, supportive environment, a culture of learning, trust and transparency, competitive salary and a healthy work-life balance. 

Salary: $95,000 - $115,000 + superannuation 

Please note only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Name: ICT Security Specialist
Description:
As ICT Security Specialist you will join ATNIS Group Technology unit based in Sydney providing design and implementation services

Key Responsibilities

Large-scale Security design skills, closely work with Engineering teams and Project Managers and customer technical authority and ensure smooth delivery of project deliverables
Security strategy and consultancy services. Collaborates proactively with other merchants and Partners to ensure design & implementation of suitable infrastructure.
Working as part of a project in a demanding environment where team work is key to delivering and meeting client commitments
Providing technical expertise and assistance to project managers and teams throughout the project lifecycle, particularly during the design and build phases.
Responsible for Security design and implementation using the Global Engineering specifications, methodology and practical application of ITIL practices and processes
Work with the team IT Architects Project Managers other professionals as appropriate to gather, review and analyze the customer's requirements
To lead the project implementation phase and be responsible for the delivery of projects on time and on budget. Conducting project kick-off meetings and engaging in detailed technical discussions
Active participant in virtual technology teams in Advanced Services.
Ensure the appropriate operational service documentation and handover is completed
Ability to interface with system integrator and outsourced partners to deliver technical solutions
Essential requirements

8-14 years of Security experience with managing, and designing solutions within an IP network with a 4-year experience in a Security architect role.
In depth knowledge of Checkpoint, Fortinet and AWS Security platforms.
Understanding of design and deployment of integrated technology solutions and multi-vendor platforms.
VPNs solutions including SSLVPN, IPSEC, GRE Tunnels, MPLS technologies, and applications (MPLS, VPLS, Multicast VPNs)
Proactive, flexible attitude to work with a willingness to constantly review and improve skills and processes
Demonstrated high-level conceptual, analytical, and problem-solving skills, and the ability to develop creative and innovative solutions to difficult and complex problems.
Good knowledge in the Security environments, such as Firewalls, Proxy servers, SSL offloading, VPNs etc.

Name: Senior insights consultant
Description:
As an Insights Consultant at Snooper you will be helping our clients improve their sales and marketing strategy and achieve greater efficiency on their in-store investments. Based on the data collected on our platform, you will be making recommendations and answer key business questions around promotional activities, assortment, category growth and pricing strategy. 

 You will manage multiple client missions in parallel and provide guidance to our team of associate consultants to ensure the successful delivery of actionable insights in line with client requirements. 

 You will report directly to our CEO, guaranteeing you exposure to our most strategic topics. You will play a central role in our company, working hand in hand with the sales, community management and tech teams. 

 As part of your key responsibilities , you will oversee our clients’ missions from start to end. 

 This notably includes: 

 
	 Discuss and understand clients’ needs and strategic challenges. 
	 Build and maintain positive working relationships with senior client stakeholders. 
	 Analyse clients’ KPIs performance to make actionable recommendations and help them drive sales for their brands. 
	 Provide advice on the integration of the Snooper platform as part their go-to-market strategy and help them leverage it as a field force effectiveness tool to drive increased efficiency and sales. 
	 Define KPI tracking methodologies and associated targets for each client’s mission. 
	 Define and execute the analytical work required to extract valuable insights to answer our clients’ strategic questions. 
	 Maintain the quality, accuracy and consistency of our data and analyses. 
	 Storyline and present mission results to make recommendations to C-Level audiences based on the insights extracted from our data. 
	 Advice clients on implementing recommendations and define next steps and goals for their in-store execution and go-to-market strategy programs. 
 

 Skills required 

 
	 Bachelor degree or higher qualification in relevant field. 
	 Excellent business sense and strong analytical skillset to help our clients extract the best insights from the data collected by our Snoopers. 
	 Knowledge and experience interpreting qualitative and quantitative data sets and deriving relevant insights to solve strategic problems. 
	 Excellent client management and presentation skills . 
	 Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and regularly changing environment, juggling multiple stakeholders and projects 
	 Very well structured , organized and ability to multitask as you will be responsible for multiple client missions running in parallel. 
	 Great sense of ownership , personal drive and autonomy. 
	 Caring deeply about people , team and culture .

Name: Retail Consultant
Description:
VeiraMal Consulting is seeking an experienced Retail Consultant for our client which is a renowned jewellery brand based in Melbourne CBD.

Do you have a passion for fine jewellery and a desire to create memories our customers will never forget? Do you enjoy working with beautiful products in a luxury environment? Do you have the ability to work autonomously and create your own lead driven customer base while supporting the boutique manager in day to day operations?

We have the perfect role for you-

We are a new brand in the luxury jewellery market in Melbourne with plans to expand and we are looking for a dynamic, skilled sales professional to join our team. With a history in mining and in-house manufacturing, we offer a rare mine-to-customer experience specializing in precious gemstones and diamonds. We seek an experienced jewellery or luxury goods professional with a history of exceeding results to be part of our growth journey. You will work alongside our boutique manager to ensure our customers have a one of a kind experience. We have a strong bespoke design focus so experience in custom made jewellery would be welcomed but not essential.

We are looking for-

*Experience in Fine Jewellery or luxury goods sales
*Strong customer experience focus
*Lead management and new business development ability
*A dynamic, passionate can-do outlook.
*An understanding of and desire to exceed budgets and KPIs while self-driving to ensure maximum results in a 
 sales-driven environment.

We are offering-

*Negotiable salary based on experience
*Bonus potential to reward and recognise performance
*Generous staff discount
*Growth and development opportunity as we grow the brand
*Strong sales and product training

We welcome applications from suitable candidates with availability across 7 days and evenings and will contact only the most suitable candidates to arrange an interview.

If you are interested and think you will be a good fit for this role, please apply.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $60,000.00 – $70,000.00 per year

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
SustainAbility Consulting is part of the SustainGroup, made up of four brands across Digital, Business Support and Health. We make up a group of 50+ consultants on the sales floor and cross-share clients across all brands. We have experienced YOY growth since inception, and are hiring across our technology and finance divisions as a result of growth, with more roles than we can currently handle. 

Work alongside our hands-on Directors, who each have 20+ years of experience in the recruitment space in Sydney. We emphasise personal development and learning, with internal and external trainers and guerrilla sessions on current trends. All new hires participate in our 12-week training program offered by Inspire Performance, which will allow you to make the most of your strengths and improve your recruitment skills. All consultants have one on one career coaching and goal setting with Inspire Performance to help you achieve personalised goals. You will have genuine opportunities for growth and development! 

We offer a culture that is fun, relaxed and allows you to be in charge of your own day. We take pride in our solid retention rates and highly successful consultants who offer our candidates and clients a first-class recruitment experience way beyond the market average. We have a buzzy office, with discounted gym memberships, weekly PT, Friday breakfasts and a social club organising monthly events! You will be able to join us on our quarterly incentive trips, some recent events have been Houseboats on the Hawkesbury River and a weekend in the Hunter Valley. 

You will also join us on our Charity Days. We partner with Stepping Stone House and are involved in Working Bee's, Charity Sail days and Sleep Under the Stars.

So, in short, some of the perks: 
-	Well established and reputable recruitment agency in Sydney, with a well-established database to get you up and running quickly 
-	Quarterly incentives trips for the whole team taking us across NSW, QLD, NZ and more 
-	60% of our annual business comes from repeat business, with a well-established client base 
-	Work alongside many of our $1M+ billers
-	Mentorship program
-	We promote retained and exclusive businesses as much as possible 
-	Uncapped commission structure paying up to 50% of billings 
-	Dress for your day 
-	Multiple charity days per year
-	One on one training with inspire performance 
-	12-week 360 recruitment training for every new hire run by Inspire Performance 
-	Cross sharing between all brands in the SustainGroup
-	Structured career progression with clear milestones up to Associate Director
-	Candidate managers working across the team 
-	Regular social events 
-	Work from home flexibility
-	Expensed phone plans up to $80 a month, standing desks & laptop set up for flexible working 
-	Friday PT, Friday breakfasts, Social sports teams, Bake offs, weekly yoga and so much more 


As a Recruitment Consultant, you will:
•	Have a full 360-degree focus, new business development, account management and candidate management 
•	Develop expert knowledge within your niche market vertical 
•	Offer your clients and candidates an exceptional service, always 
•	Attend and run networking events in your market vertical
•	Maintain and build our relationship with existing clients 
•	Maintain candidate and client satisfaction through our real-time surveys 
•	Utilise content marketing to attract candidates and clients and develop our brand

You will manage the entire life cycle of the recruitment process, focusing on a niche vertical market in the technology or finance space.

Name: Security Engineer, IR
Description:
Amazon is seeking qualified Security Engineers to join our innovative, high energy Information Security team and work within the Security Incident Response Team (SIRT) in Sydney.

SIRT Security Engineers respond to security events, conduct analysis of threats such as malware and intrusion attempts, and provide security services to safeguard highly sensitive data.

They work hands-on with detection systems and vulnerability analysis tools to respond to potential threats to Amazon systems. Security Engineers are unique individuals prepared to relentlessly resolve security issues by gathering and analyzing event data and conducting root-cause analysis.

With your technical expertise, you will be solving security challenges at scale, working to protect the applications powering the most sophisticated e-commerce platform ever built.

We value broad and deep technical knowledge, specifically in the fields of forensics, malware analysis, network security, application security, cryptography, and security intelligence.

Responsibilities:


 Responding to security incidents, and coordinating a cohesive response involving multiple teams across Amazon.

 Providing security engineering solutions and support during customer-facing incidents, proactively considering the prevention of similar incidents from occurring in the future.

 Assisting in the development of pragmatic solutions that achieve business requirements while maintaining an acceptable level of risk.

 Identifying and recommending solutions that improve or expand Amazon’s incident response capabilities.

 Working alongside and mentoring Information Security engineers to improve security, reduce and quickly address risk.

 Evaluating the impact of current security trends, advisories, publications, and academic research to Amazon, coordinating response as necessary across affected teams.

 Keeping your knowledge and skills current with the rapidly changing threat landscape.

 Participating in a follow-the-sun on-call rotation.

Basic qualifications

 BS in Computer Science, Information Security, or equivalent professional experience.
 5 years of demonstrated experience in areas such as incident response, systems security, network, and/or application security.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to adapt messaging to executive, technical, and non-technical audiences.
 Understanding of best practices in security engineering, including secure development, cryptography, network security, security operations, systems security, policy, and incident response.
 Technical depth in one or more specialties including: application security, infrastructure security, digital forensics, malware analysis, or some combination thereof.
 Understanding of security vulnerabilities, attacker exploit techniques, and methods for their remediation.
 The capacity and tolerance for context switching and interruptions while remaining productive and providing effective, safe guidance.
 Experience with common security monitoring, log analysis and forensic tools.
 Ability to work with a high degree of autonomy.
 Scripting skills (E.g: Python, Perl, Bash, PowerShell, etc.)

Preferred qualifications

 Experience triaging and developing security alerts and response automation, conducting front-line analysis, and providing escalation support.
 7+ years of information security experience.
 Relevant industry certifications from SANS, ISC2, etc.
 Strong demonstrated knowledge of Unix tools and architecture.
 Experience working as part of a Computer Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT) or Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT).
 Familiarity/experience with AWS services and security concepts.

Name: Manager, Cyber Security
Description:
Manager – Cyber Security 
 
elevenM is a specialist digital risk consultancy helping our clients holistically manage the full spectrum of digital risks: cyber, privacy and data governance. 
We currently have an opportunity for someone with 3+ years of experience in Cyber Security who is looking to grow with a business that is expanding rapidly. 

“Why elevenM?” 
Our clients are market leading organisations with complex problems to solve. 
Our team is made up of subject matter experts with a proven track record of delivering practical outcomes, not theoretical papers. 
Our culture is more than just a tagline. We value everyone’s opinion and embrace difference. 

“What will I be doing?” 
Your work will vary according to our client/s requirements and may involve: 
Working with IT, Cyber or Risk teams to design and manage the implementation of pragmatic cyber security risk mitigation strategies and operational plans. 
Co-designing operation artefacts including policies, procedures and controls. 
Keeping abreast with everything related to cyber and data risk. Applying this knowledge in the provision of astute advice regarding cyber risk mitigation. 

What will I need to have? 
A good sense of humor and enjoy being part of a fun team. 
Exceptional communication skills and ability to engage and influence stakeholders. 
Experience (3+ years) in cyber security consulting. 

“What next?” 
If you would like to find out more, please don’t hesitate to call or text Margaret Carter on 0419 490 771. 
Applications close on Friday 27 June 2022.

Name: Managemant Consultant
Description:
Oishi Group Pty Ltd located in Minchinbury, NSW is looking for an experienced Management Consultant to work for their company. The Management Consultant is required to expertly and efficient provide advise to help improve the company’s day to day operations. The successful applicant must be motivated, hardworking, and reliable.
Main Duties:
•	Review historical sales trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, develop statistical forecasts models, and evaluate forecast results.
•	Reporting and analysing internal/ external data, based on current trends and patterns.
•	Provide effective leadership and coaching to team members in alignment with the values and strategic objectives.
•	Manage the competency of team members to drive performance and continuous improvement.
•	Creation of purchase orders for inventory in a timely and efficient manner
•	Identify new business opportunities to improve operating procedures and processes, with a focus on safety, quality, and housekeeping to best practice standards.
•	Communicating with suppliers and contract negotiations, developing a strategic relationship with key suppliers, and ensuring procurement procedures are adhered to.
•	Leading tender processes with supplies
•	Being a point of contact for related issues with the logistics of materials and aligning expectations between internal and external supply chain 
•	Liaise with internal and external customers regarding shipping and delivery of products
•	Adhere to workplace health and safety practices

Skills Required:
•	Good communication and presentation skills
•	Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment
•	Have a good attention to detail
•	At least bachelor level qualification
•	At least 2 years relevant work experience

To apply for this position, please reply to this post with a recent resume and cover letter outlining your skills and qualifications as well as your suitability for the position. 
Job type: Full-time
Required experience: at least 2 years in a similar field
Salary: $80,000

Name: Dynamics 365 for Finance & Operations Consultants (all disciplines)
Description:
Looking for a challenge and change - join us at Fusion5!

We’re looking for passionate, enthusiastic Dynamics 365 for Finance & Operations Consultants, who want to be part of something exciting based in Brisbane, Sydney, and Melbourne. Someone who wants to be part of the team, having a heavy focus on strong customer relationships and be flexible and agile in your approach to delivery. 

Our friendly and incredibly supportive environment is celebrated with regular events, user groups, knowledge sharing, personal development and a company-wide spirit that makes Fusion5 a great workplace! 

The role is for a capable, strong, and experienced Dynamics 365 for Finance & Operations Consultant who has a track record of implementing successful Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations/Dynamics AX solutions. 
 
What you need to bring: 
•	Involved in multiple end-to-end implementations.
•	Forges strong and lasting relationships with their customers.
•	Broad set of functional skills.
•	Excellent business analysis and workshop facilitation skills.
•	Understands how businesses work and can back this up with industry experience.
•	Can be a chameleon, able to change modes from hands-on functional configuration running strategic workshops or getting stuck in with technical discussions. 
•	Can provide informative, business-ready training for client stakeholders. 
•	Demonstrates experience in writing functional documentation. 
•	Has energy, enthusiasm and is driven, with the natural desire to achieve. 
 
If you are energetic and actively seeking that next all-important opportunity and have the following: 
•	5 years’ minimum in a consulting role. 
•	The ability to communicate effectively at all levels. 
•	The ability to be self-driven and seek out opportunities in all situations. 
•	The ability to perform business analyst functions including developing functional and technical specifications. 
•	Strong customer service focus with a penchant for learning. 
•	Ability to travel on a regular basis. 
 

If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been waiting for and you would like to become a Fusion5er, we would love to hear from you! 

#makingpotentialreality isn't just a hashtag - it's our mantra!

Name: Cyber Security Analyst
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Cyber Security Analyst for managing cyber and security capabilities for QAL.
 
Who Are We?
Queensland Airports Limited (QAL) is an accomplished airport operator that owns and operates Gold Coast, Townsville, Longreach and Mount Isa airports. We welcomed about 6.3 million passengers in FY20, connecting the Gold Coast and northern NSW, along with regional Queensland, to the rest of the country and beyond. An Australian-owned company, we are committed to delivering for the communities where we operate.
 
Key Responsibilities Include:
•	Provide installation, configuration, and security application maintenance to ensure the environment is not vulnerable to any potential threats
•	Introduce, implement, and maintain security policies, controls, standards, guidelines, patches, and other technical changes 
•	Monitor, identify, and rectify any security related issues or challenges with software applications at QAL
•	Develop relationships and collaborate with the system's developers, internal and external stakeholders, and/or with other SME’s in QAL Technology around security 
•	Analyse, review, and monitor security solutions and ensure security changes are planned strategically
•	Provide recommendations and guidance on the technology choices required to manage, report, and protect QAL from security issues 
•	Take responsibility for standards, procedures, and operational management of information security
•	Demonstrate ownership for problems, issues, and other security challenges within domain 
•	Manage cyber security incidents, coordinate timely responses to incident reports, monitor resolution activity, and keep the stakeholders aware of progress towards service restoration 
•	Investigate and troubleshoot reported IT security incidents and track them to closure
•	Maintain technical documentation for information security related issues and solutions
•	Provide expertise and knowledge to projects, service issues and other technical requirements to the wider QAL Technology as required
 
Requirements, Skills, and Qualifications: 
•	Degree in Information Technology or related discipline 
•	Applicable industry qualifications desirable (e.g. Splunk, CISSP certification etc.) 
•	Minimum 2 years’ experience in the information security domain
•	Excellent time management and prioritisation skills 
•	Customer focused and desire to own problem and resolve 
•	Microsoft excel, word, outlook experience and skills 
•	Quick learner who can work independently 
 
What We Offer you?
This is an opportunity to be part of a progressive organisation with a great culture and assist in the transformation and growth of the business. Flexible working options are available for all employees. At QAL, we uphold the philosophy that the smooth integration of life and work benefits all. We call it Living Well.
QAL supports an inclusive approach and values diversity within the workplace. We aim to provide opportunities that allow individuals to reach their full potential regardless of their background, gender, age, work status, religious or cultural identity. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.

Salary Range: $53,900 - 69,863 per annum

Name: Locksmith / Security Technician
Description:
For more than 35 years ESL Lock Professionals has been one of the leading providers of lock, safe and security services in southeast Queensland.

With a fleet of service vehicles we look after clients in Brisbane, Ipswich and the northern Gold Coast every day.

We currently have a vacancy for a Senior Locksmith in our service department. The person we are looking for is a trade qualified locksmith with a solid background in dealing with commercial and contract customers who can deliver quality workmanship and superior customer service.

Ideally you will have previously worked previously in a busy mobile service environment and be used to traveling varying distances to numerous sites every day.

In addition to a fully equipped service vehicle with GPS navigation, all uniforms, a mobile phone and a weekly Equipment Allowance will be provided.

A current manual Drivers License and Class 2 Queensland Security License (Security Advisor and Security Equipment Installer) are essential requirements of the role.


Applications and enquiries to: 

projects@esllock.com.au

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
We are looking for a Recruitment Consultant to join Our Team. Located in Footscray, with NO EXPERIENCE needed.

-	Must speak English fluently, MUST be comfortable on the phone, you will be speaking to clients and candidates daily.
-	Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office Skills

Name: Agricultural Consultant
SEO Consultant
Description:
Description
Are you an experienced SEO Consultant looking for a step up?

Want to join Australia’s largest and fastest growing independent agency, where your success and achievements will be recognised and rewarded?

This is your chance to be part of an award winning agency, where everything you do will impact the growth and success of the business, locally and globally.

Due to our exponential growth, we are looking for an experienced SEO Consultant to be an integral part of our SEO team.

We're going to show you how to be exceptional with SEO, where you will handle all types of clients, Local, Lead Generation, E-commerce and Enterprise level accounts. You will become proficient in technical implementation and web analytics packages to manage and deliver SEO campaigns for Online Marketing Gurus SME clients.


As an SEO Consultant, you will be responsible for:

- Managing clients and plan, create and execute SEO campaigns
- Ongoing website link analysis, market research competitor link analysis to outline ongoing promotional opportunities
- Understand – CMS, FTP, server-side, analytics tracking and content related recommendations
- Help Formulate 6-12 month SEO campaign plans
- Innovate ongoing technical tactics through ongoing industry research and execution
- Conducting Keyword Research & Keyword Mapping, Technical audits, Backlink Analysis
- Work with a team of SEO Consultants to achieve success on campaigns.

Requirements
- You have SEO experience, minimum 2 years
- You have creative solutions to problems
- You have worked in an agency
- You are prepared to change the way we do things because you can make it better
- Things like ROI, CTR, HREFLANG, JS, CSS are used by you daily
- You want to work around a team of highly driven SEO specialists
- You have strong organisational and time management skills as well as Administration/Project Management skills.


About OMG:
- Largest independent agency in Australia, with the highest growth and customer retention rates in the industry - doubled revenue year on year since 2013
- 110 employees in Sydney HQ, plus international expansion
- R&D investment, forefront of digital marketing, innovation
- We ‘Share evidence, not opinion’, ‘Find solutions, not problems’, ‘Make customers love you’, ‘Own it and get it done’ , living and breathing our values
- Strong focus on employee satisfaction, reward and recognition, and peer nominated awards.

Benefits
- Work flexibility
- Volunteer leave
- Birthday leave
- Additional annual leave
- Global career progression opportunities
- Employee development, engagement & growth opportunities
- Gourmet lunches on the house
- Dog friendly and vibrant office.

Name: Software Engineering Consultant
Description:
Servian is an award-winning, people-focused, global tech consultancy with a rich heritage in Data, DevOps/Cloud, Digital, Machine Learning and Cyber Security. We embrace innovation, change, and the positive impact it has on us and our clients. As a Servianite you will have the opportunity to work on a wide range of interesting projects, using a variety of emerging technologies. We aim to build an employee experience where you will grow more with us, not be drowned out by the loudest voice, and hence we strive to set you up for a career that will have a greater impact.



Our business is focused on developing our people and offerings across the following:

Cloud & Technology - Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform), DevOps and Automation inc HashiCorp

Data & Analytics - BI/DWH, Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science and Advanced Analytics (Snowflake)

Digital - Full stack Development, UI/UX Design, Mobile Development

Customer Engagement - Marketing Campaigns, Campaign Analysis, Customer Insights

Artificial Intelligence - Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning

Cyber Security - DevSecOps, Penetration Testing, Multi-Cloud Security, Security Posture Analysis



What are we looking for?

Developed skills with a range of programming languages and libraries (Python, Java, Scala, Golang, .NET Core, NodeJS, etc.)
Extensive experience working in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Consultative mindset with strong stakeholder management and communication skills
Expertise in the design, development and delivery of data or automation solutions
Experience in CI/CD, TDD and secure coding practices
Experience integrating web-based applications with backend API services
Knowledge of common data structures and algorithmic solutions
Passion for teaching, coaching or mentoring team members
Love working in an Agile environment


We hire for mindset! If you don’t possess all of the above skills we can teach you what’s missing. So if this role resonates with you then hit that apply button!

Who are you?

Curious and eager to learn: you are a curious individual who is eager to develop their skills and progress their career at every opportunity in a consulting environment.
Team player: you thrive as a part of high performing teams and love sharing your knowledge with your peers and clients. We win together.
Proactive: you seize opportunities when you see them. Every day at Servian presents broad opportunities for personal, professional and business growth.
Passionate: you are excited by tech. Our team constantly innovate and implement new technologies and methodologies for themselves, our vendors and our clients.


Why join Servian?

Our career pathways are not a one-size fits all, we help you identify your personal and professional goals through our mentorship program. Helping you put together an action plan and keep you accountable.
Growth through unlimited L&D and goal-based learning - free access to Udemy, you pass we pay model for courses and certifications, internal run boot camps and communities of practice (Machine Learning, DevOps, WebDev, Agile/Scrum Guilds)
Flat Structure - No silos or departments; have the opportunity to work across various tech stacks, industries and projects. We value trust and transparency, that’s why we have an open-door policy across the business.
Create your own destiny - We support our consultant’s creativity. If you have an idea, turn it into an initiative!
Flexible WFH policy - We value work-life balance, accountability and autonomy.


Wellbeing & Benefits

We provide employees with Life Insurance, Income Protection Insurance and access to an Employee Assistance Program.
Generous Parental leave.
Substantial Referral fee. We value your opinion and want our employees to contribute to the success of Servian!
Wellbeing and mental health initiatives - Yoga, Meditation, Steptember, Around the Bay.
We are proud to have a sociable workplace that values diversity and celebrates achievements with quarterly company-wide events, social events and more. Think VR laser tag, wine tours and cooking classes.
Monthly in-person team lunches/dinners so you can connect with your colleagues outside of work!
Consultant-led initiatives to get everyone excited, which include social and tech clubs (gaming, IoT, badminton, wellbeing, whisky and wine, etc.), meetups, and cloud vendor hackathons.


Servian recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at Servian.

Come to the tech side… we have cookies!

APPLY NOW!



Posted on 27/05/2022

Salary will be in line with your experience however for a junior-mid level consultant, the range will be from $80k - $100k

Name: Cyber Security SIEM Analyst
Description:
This opportunity:

The Cyber Security SIEM Analyst is responsible for providing support and assistance for all Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) related activities, including onboarding of new technologies and development of scenarios to assist the Cyber Defence & Response Centre (CDRC) in the monitoring and alerting of current and future security threats for the full TPG Telecom environment.

The successful candidate will be working on industry-leading Cyber Security tools, techniques and best practice to navigate the continuously evolving threat landscape.

Responsibilities:

Identification and mitigation of cyber security threats
Support the development and testing of security event correlation content and threat-based use cases using SIEM technologies
Support and develop SIEM platform continuous improvement efforts and navigate the continuously evolving threat landscape with a focus on bringing that information into the platform
Maintain strong relationships with team members, organisational stakeholders, and partners to build a thorough understanding of the technical environment by identifying risks, articulating threats and assisting incident response efforts
Assist with Technology Security sponsored or led security assessments, audits and reviews
Promote security awareness and policy advocacy by supporting various internal and external stakeholders as required
Develop, test and maintain SIEM integrations, event aggregation and correlation content to allow analysts to actively monitor security tools for potential threats and prioritise threat response efforts
Maintain up-to-date and thorough understanding of various critical log event sources in various formats including network devices, security platforms, operating systems, applications, and log management platforms like Splunk and ArcSight SIEM
Help in the implementation and development of SIEM content to support CDRC Use Cases and Playbooks
Assist with the implementation, development, automation and maintenance of Technology Security dashboards and reports for peer and executive audience
Author and maintain documentation of SIEM integrations, correlation content development and implementation
Assist forensic investigation efforts in response to security incidents by providing evidence from the SIEM
Support efforts to author incident reports for peer and senior audiences
Support the continuous improvement of data provided to third parties that provide additional services to the CDRC.

Knowledge and experience:

Tertiary qualifications in IT or Engineering, or related discipline
In-depth knowledge of information security concepts and technologies
2-3 years of in-depth technical SIEM integration, administration and security event correlation use case development experience 
ArcSight experience would be desirable but not essential
Information Security related experience, in areas such as: security operations, incident analysis, incident handling, and vulnerability management or testing, system patching, log analysis, intrusion detection, or firewall administration
Extensive understanding of cyber security hygiene benchmarks and industry frameworks applicable to VHA’s complex hybrid (on-premise, private and public cloud) environment
In depth technical skills, includes TCP/IP knowledge, networking and security product experience
Good understanding of Telecommunications would be desirable but not essential
A passion for learning and a desire to succeed
Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to communicate technical information and ideas clearly and concisely in a business context
Strong desire to build and tinker with tools to solve problems
Good interpersonal and consultative skills.

If you think the power of people and collaboration can make a meaningful difference in the world, then APPLY NOW to help us build a better future.

At TPG Telecom we take all reasonably practicable steps to protect the health and safety of our people. The successful candidate is required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, due to the increased risk of infection and nature of the work. Please let our team know if there is anything you need to discuss about your individual circumstances.

The role will be open from the 27th May 2022 to the 28th June 2022.

Name: Recruitment Consultant - Logistics
Description:
We're are looking for a recruitment consultant in our Logistics team in Newcastle!  Your new company At Hays, we are globally recognised as the industry's leading recruitment agency due to our authentic and passionate approach to changing the lives of our clients and candidates. Recruitment is an industry that is continuously growing and presenting exciting career opportunities to ambitious individuals. We are looking for a driven individual to join Hays in our Logistics team based in Newcastle!  Your new role

Engage regularly with your current clients to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders and further develop your understanding of their business needs
Build you client portfolio by making new business development calls and establishing new relationships, identify business opportunities and take a genuine interest in managing a solution for them
Source candidate talent using our "find & engage" methodology and tools and active networking in your industry as well as advertise your current and upcoming job vacancies to attract candidates within your specialist industry
Pre-screen candidates via phone and conduct thorough interviews face to face, understand your candidates' goals and career aspirations
Skill match candidates to the relevant job vacancies and create a specific candidate short list to present to your clients
Manage candidate and client interviews, conduct references on your clients' behalf as well as negotiate salary and start dates for your candidate
Continue to develop your industry knowledge, make expert recommendations for both your clients and candidates alike, work collaboratively with your team and adhere to your set targets and KPI's

 What you'll need to succeed

Experience in recruitment is advantageous but not essential, but an understanding or interest in the logistics industry would set you up for success!
You have a passion for sales, are highly motivated and results driven
Passionate about people, inquisitive and curious and want to impact lives and livelihoods
Have confidence to establish quality relationships and the ability to identify opportunities

 What you'll get in return

Specialist ongoing training and development programs throughout your Hays career
Regular one on one coaching as well as industry expert workshops
Global career opportunities
Internal referral bonus scheme
Flexible working arrangements and additional leave, including wellness and volunteering days
Success celebrations and annual conferences
Health, leisure and lifestyle rewards

 What you need to do now 
 If you are interested click the apply now button, or to find out more about this opportunity please call Henny on 02 8113 6479 or reach out via email on henrikke.finstad@hays.com.au.  At Hays, we value equity, diversity and inclusion and are committed to creating a work environment where all people regardless of background feel a sense of belonging. By joining Hays you'll be part of an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity, recognising every individual for their unique differences. We invite people from all backgrounds to apply. Name: Principal Consultant - Leadership Development
Description:
Principal Consultant | Leadership Development 

 Who is Maximus? 

 Maximus is one of the top leadership consultancies specialising in transforming organisations from the inside out. For over a decade we have been busy redefining the way leaders think, feel and act in medium and large enterprise. 

 We exist to move minds, transform businesses and leave a legacy of proven value. We go above and beyond to ensure that every organisation, and leader within, evolves and becomes better as a result of our connection. We are seeking exceptional individuals where your personal values and standards align with our truths. 

 The Opportunity: 

 We are seeking an experienced Principal Consultant to be based in Sydney to proactively manage and grow our business nationally by generating and following up on opportunities while focusing on extending and deepening our established  accounts. Your role will consist of enhancing Maximus’ reputation through ensuring successful scope, design and delivery of high quality, innovative solutions whilst contributing to Maximus’ thought leadership and overall success and growth of the firm. 

 Responsibilities include: 

 
	 Account management and ownership of a client portfolio that contributes to a larger commercial portfolio 
	 Collaborate with the team to focus on national portfolio growth while identifying and developing new  accounts 
	 Designing experiential solution architectures that shifts mindset, builds capability, and creates value by addressing the needs of our clients and the leaders within  
	 Project governance – scope, design and delivery. Executing on projects we are proud of and that deliver beyond the expectations of our clients 
	 Engaging solution delivery, facilitation and coaching  
	 Being recognised for contributing to the firm’s growth through thought leadership and building capability internally 
 

 Requirements: 

 
	 Relevant Psychology degree or post graduate qualification 
	 Minimum 5 years’ experience in a similar role  
	 Ability to analyse, understand and articulate our client’s needs 
	 Enablement and embedding (culture formation, change navigation, talent and succession management) 
	 Measurement (organisational performance; performance management; ROI methodology) 
	 Advanced account management experience that leads to extending and deepening of services 
	 Strong client focus, confident with generating opportunities and stakeholder management skills 
	 Excellent written and spoken communication skills including the ability to influence and have impact  
	 Outcomes obsessed, strong attention to detail and quality execution  
	 Resilient, adaptable and comfortable with ambiguity  
	 Effective people management skills 
	 Core consulting skills: problem solving, visualisation of information
