Name: Implementation Consultant
Description:
Due to continued growth, we are looking or a passionate and enthusiastic Implementation Consultant to join our Client Services team.


Our Client Services team is committed to inspiring customers towards the path of success for our HR solutions. In this role, you would own the entire life cycle of the solution from Kick off, configuration, testing, right through to project finalisation.


You will also be working on exciting projects with customers that are very diverse from small and medium businesses to Enterprise level gaining the opportunity to understand the HR practices from diverse industries.


What we would like to see you bring to the team:

* Strong multi-tasker who is comfortable working across multiple projects at once
* Demonstrated Project Management skills
* Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) to suit a wide range of people and contexts
* A strong systems mindset, capable of working closely with databases
* Customer service ethic and focus; client-driven
* Dedicated team player, with an ability to work autonomously

More about our team & benefits/ Why ELMO?

* Flexible, family friendly environment
* Wellbeing initiatives: virtual yoga and meditation classes
* Focus on tech: Innovation Days, R&D Summit, Hackathons, Monthly Product Showcase, weekly tech workshops, BA Community of Practice, Agile coaching team
Inhouse Learning and Development initiatives
* ELMO Social clubs (movies, books, Green team) and Communities of Interest (cooking, pets, gardening)
* Monthly Employee rewards
* Mental Health programs

Where it all began..

Founded in 2002, ELMO Software is one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Australia and New Zealand, with offices both locally and abroad in the UK. ELMO is a cloud-based solution that helps thousands of organisations across Australia, New Zealand and the United Kingdom to effectively manage their people, process and pay.


Since listing on the ASX in 2017, we have grown our annualised recurring revenue (ARR) from $19 million in FY17 to a forecast of $107 - $113 million in FY22, growing our people from 92 employees to over 600. What’s truly exciting is that this is what we achieved in just five years.


We're at a whole new level of scale and still growing rapidly. Imagine what the next four years could bring for ELMO - and you. Be part of the ELMO journey!


ELMO Software Limited is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds to join our team. Key to this role is an awareness of data privacy and security as you will be dealing with sensitive employee data in accordance with ELMO ISO 27001 Certified security policies.

Name: Consultant
Description:
Altman Solon Consultant 

 Altman Solon is a 500-person strategy consulting group that focuses exclusively on the telecommunications, media and technology (TMT) related sectors. As the largest global TMT strategy firm, we assist clients in fast, high-impact, confident decision making. We enable clients to seize new opportunities, improve performance, and increase shareholder value within complex and converging industries. 

 The Consultant role is a mid-level role and is open to professionals with 2 to 4 years of work experience. As a Consultant at Altman Solon, you will be involved in every aspect of our consulting practice. While a Consultant’s specific role will vary from project to project, responsibilities include: 

 
	 Developing novel, data-driven methodologies and owning execution of solving complex client problems 
	 Building a variety of rigorous quantitative tools leveraging Excel and Tableau to be delivered to (and used by) clients on an on-going basis. This may include: 
	 Market Sizings: Identify, measure, and quantify marketplace issues and opportunities including market size, share, and growth potential for the client’s business 
	 Go-to-Market Plans: Identify, develop, and evaluate strategies based on company objectives, market characteristics, customer demographics, economic conditions, and geographic particularities 
	 Financial Analyses: Analyze financial statements and annual reports of the client and competitors to inform financial stability and project the best financial course of action to grow the business 
	 Business Plan Assessments: Create business plans, business cases, and financial models to help the client understand their revenue and profitability, and paths to achieve overall business growth 
	 Conducting research to understand market demand drivers, technology trends, and competitive landscapes; methods include state-of-the-art survey design & analysis and as well as primary interviews with subject matter experts 
	 Synthesizing and presenting key findings and recommendations to our clients 
	 Developing content-specific knowledge that will continue to expand and evolve through your time at Altman Solon 
	 Supporting ongoing internal firm-building initiatives including recruiting, mentoring interns and Analysts, diversity and inclusion initiatives, community service, and other special projects 
 

  We are looking for: 

   Problem solvers with analytical minds and strong communication 

 
	 Strong quantitative backgrounds with proven experience building excel-based financial and operational models 
	 Sound business intuition and understanding of key performance drivers 
	 Ability to translate complex problems into structured, manageable concepts and approaches 
	 Ability to effectively communicate complex ideas and concepts via verbal, written, and visual means in a manner 
 

   Team  playe rs with leadership skills and a commitment to producing outstanding work 

 
	 Enjoy working with teams and working independently as required, and able to effectively lead junior staff 
	 Dedication to producing high-quality output with integrity and exceptional attention to detail 
	 Enjoy contributing to internal firm life and culture, including recruiting, diversity and inclusion initiatives, and special projects 
	 Passion for learning and interest in TMT industry, with ability to absorb information quickly and effectively and a growth mindset – experience working in a consulting environment and/or TMT industry preferred 
 

   Please send your resume to: 

 recruiting-europe altmansolon.com

Name: Consultant/Senior Consultant - Digital & Emerging Technologies - Consulting
Description:
The opportunity 

 

We are looking for a Technical Consultant within the Core Consulting, Digital and Emerging Technologies team.

 
Your key responsibilities

- Demonstrating capability to determine and analyse business requirements then translating 
 them into specifications for technology deliverables.
- Ability to work with multiple stakeholders such as business users, Quality Assurance teams, 
 project manager and technical team.
- Ability to accurately document business processes and map them to the end state.
- Ability to develop and configure software packages with different tech stacks and concepts 
 such as AWS or Azure (Cloud).
- Demonstrating knowledge of and experience with business processes, process re- 
 engineering, Agile ways of working and systems development lifecycle.
- Act as a critical contributor on project teams of clients and EY consultants, and possibly third 
 parties.
- Continuously developing your skills to remain current in the market.
- Being a reliable go-to person and working with EY’s key stakeholders to consult to clients 
 about what is happening in the market and helping to solve the issues relevant to them
 
Skills and attributes for success

- 2+ years work experience as a Technical Consultant
- Experience in data and integration projects
- Ability to effectively work across all phases of the project lifecycle.
- Experience in performing analysis, consulting, and providing recommendations to clients.
- Good knowledge of relevant technology concepts (e.g. cloud, databases, Business 
 Intelligence, software development, integration and customer experience platforms.
- Strong communication skills, including prioritising, problem-solving and interpersonal 
 relationship building
 
Ideally, you’ll also have

- Strong people and project delivery experience, including working in teams
- Excellent communication skills, both oral and written
- Annual Salary: AUD75K

EY | Building a better working world 
 
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. 
 
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate. 
 
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Name: Lead Salesforce Functional Consultant
Description:
Role: Lead Salesforce Functional Consultant
Salary: $125k + Super
 
Silver lining Cloud Solutions are a Salesforce Implementation partner based in Perth, Western Australia. Due to ongoing growth of our Salesforce practice, we are recruiting a Lead Salesforce Functional Consultant to work on projects with our clients in Western Australia.
 
Role
The role of Lead Salesforce Functional Consultant is to lead the Salesforce solution design in supporting Customers and Silver Linings project teams in the implementation of Salesforce solutions across a range of industries. The roles will require working and collaborating with Customers, Business Analysts, Solution Architects and Project Managers - providing Functional and solution advice; and designing and architecting solutions aligning to the Customers business requirements. The role will require continual learning and upskilling in the form of attaining additional Salesforce Certifications and renewing existing Certifications.
 
Experience Requirements
8+ years post-graduate experience in Salesforce Consulting including:
•	Implementation of Salesforce Sales Cloud
•	Implementation of Service Cloud
•	Implementation of Salesforce Communities
•	Web Services Integration
•	Data Migration
•	Apex
•	VisualForce
 
Skills Experience
Skills in implementing the following Salesforce products and clouds including:
•	Gathering requirements from multiple key stakeholders in order to configure and customise Salesforce to meet business needs.
•	Managing business analysts and technical teams to deliver client solutions.
•	Hands-on technical and functional aspects of the existing Salesforce platform to gain a strong understanding of client priorities.
•	Designing client roadmaps and ensuring Salesforce solutions align.
•	Delivering projects and working with Agile methodologies
•	Pre-sales and demonstration experience.
•	Leading requirements gathering and Solution Design in cross-functional Agile project teams.
 
Certifications
Currently holding a number of Salesforce Certifications including:
•	Salesforce.com Certified Administrator
•	Salesforce Certified Application Architect
•	Salesforce Certified Data Architect
•	Salesforce.com Certified Sales Cloud Consultant
•	Salesforce.com Certified Service Cloud Consultant
 
Other Desirable Experience
•	Proficiency in spoken English and good customer facing skills.
•	To be able to work autonomously with limited supervision, or as part of small and large project teams
•	Experience of working with implementing Salesforce Managed Packages AppExchange products
•	ERP Integration Experience - experience of implemeting integrations between Salesforce and ERP's which may include Oracle e-Business Suite, SAP, NetSuite
•	Lead Functional requirements with Silver Linings Business Analysts, Functional Consultants and Project Managers
•	Experience implementing Salesforce utilising Agile (SCRUM) methodologies and tools eg Jira

Name: Senior Consultant (IT & Digital), Audit, Digital Assurance
Description:
Senior Consultant (IT & Digital) Audit, Digital Assurance 

  
EY is a global professional services organisation providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction services. We are committed to doing our part in building a better working world, to help create wider economic and social benefits today, and a strong legacy for a better tomorrow. 

Our Digital Assurance team is looking to hire two Senior Consultants (IT & Digital) Audit to be based in the Sydney and Brisbane office. Other locations will be considered. 

   
 Key duties of the role are: 
 
	- As part of the Digital Assurance team, deliver IT-related audit procedures for the audits of financial statements for small- to mid-sized companies and other organisations.  Collaborate with Assurance professionals to design and deliver high quality, integrated, repeatable, efficient IT audit services. 
 
	- Evaluate the effectiveness of IT application controls, IT general controls and system-generated reports across a range of client industries and technology platforms. Consistently apply EY’s Global Audit Methodology and professional standards to deliver high-quality IT audit services. 

	- Assist in building the IT audit capability in Oceania Core Assurance to support the efficient and consistent IT audit service delivery, identify IT controls and help Assurance professionals plan responsive audit strategies. 

	- Working with our Digital Assurance Specialists, support the delivery of technology assurance services including Cybersecurity assessments and other emerging technologies, such as Blockchain and AI.  
 

 Essential skills for the role are: 

 
	- Proven experience as an Auditor delivering IT audit and/or technology risk engagements 

	- Experience in IT risk and controls, data analytics and common ERP systems 

	- Experience leading the planning, execution and reporting on audits 

	- Proven track record with developing and maintaining client relationships 

	- Excellent communication, project management, and teaming skills 
 


 The sponsored approver for this role is Ernst & Young Services Trust Ltd

Name: IT Recruitment Consultant / Account Manager
Description:
IT Recruitment Consultant 

 
	 CBD | Strathfield location, flexible work arrangements 
	 Market leading commission structure 
	 Warm desk, verticals suited to your specialisation 
 

   
 The Role 
 
As the IT Recruitment Consultant, you will manage a desk with a split of existing clients along with the freedom to create a brand-new portfolio of clients. The market has shifted showing positive signs of significant growth within the IT & Digital space so now is the time to start building a strong foundation and using a strong database of active candidates to fill multiple existing roles. 
 
Your experience and skills will include: 

 
	 Proven experience in developing a successful sales strategy from lead generation through to targeted placements 
	 Proven record of achieving and exceeding activity and sales targets 
	 Demonstrated ability to build your personal brand and leverage that to develop relationships with clients and candidates 
	 Knowledge of the IT & Digital market 
	 Resilient, positive and a drive to succeed 
	 The ability to work with and contribute to a successful team 
	 Enjoy the thrill of chasing and securing new business opportunities. 
 

   
 The Benefits 
 
You will receive training support from Team Leaders and General Managers who have operated in this space for over a decade and you will have access to a myriad of opportunities for career progression. Enjoy a fantastic work/life balance, we want to celebrate your wins especially with a lucrative industry leading commission structure. You will have access to active clients to ensure you start building a billing desk as soon as possible.  
 
 Our Business 
 
Ignite operates across 3 divisions: People Services, Specialist Recruitment and On-Demand IT Services. Our passion has been, and always will be, people. With the completion of our business transformation, plus the recent appointment of a new CEO and industry leader, we are extremely well positioned to now take advantage of an ever-improving market to really drive significant growth. 
 
We have been an advocate and partner to our clients for over 30 years as we have continued to develop and adapt our methodologies to a new world market creating solutions for their success. As a result of our long-term operations in the industry, we are the preferred advisor to some of Australia’s biggest corporations, which means a career with us has truly unlimited potential. 
 
If you are looking to be part of a business where your contribution directly impacts the future successes of each and every employee, then now is the time to join us! We look forward to hearing about your career progression plans. Apply now.

Name: Internal Audit Senior Consultant
Description:
The Senior Consultant has primary responsibility for direct supervision of Consultants in executing Internal Audit work. The Senior Consultant has direct, client-facing engagement responsibilities. Serving as both role model and trainer, the Senior Consultant demonstrates both excellent client service, and assists team members in developing technical and professional competency. The Senior Consultant learns to identify areas of risk and opportunities to improve business processes.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES
- Reviewing, documenting, evaluating and testing operational and financial controls
- Communicating control strengths and weaknesses to the client or internal audit engagement team and developing effective solutions to identified weaknesses
- Ensuring timely completion of assigned project phases
- Developing and maintaining effective client relationships
- Applying understanding of Protiviti policies and proficiency in Protiviti methodologies
- Applying understanding of business processes and technical skills to successful completion of project assignments
- Developing understanding of project requirements and client’s business
- Supervising and training Consultants
- Preparing audit reports on findings and recommendations and presenting to senior management

EDUCATIONAL & PROFESSIONAL CREDENTIALS
- Bachelor’s degree in relevant discipline (e.g. Accounting, Finance or Business-Related field) required
- 3+ years in a related field preferably in professional services (e.g. with a “Big 4” firm or equivalent).
- Professional certification such as CA, CPA or CIA strongly preferred (or in-progress).

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS
- Interpersonal skills to interact in team environment and foster client relationships
- Demonstrated understanding of the importance of business ethics.
- Must be able to handle highly confidential information in a strictly professional manner
- Strong time management and analytical skills
- Above average written communication skills including documentation of findings and recommendations
- Must be able to maintain professional demeanor in times of high stress

REQUIRED TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS
- Internal audit technical skills including conducting stakeholder interviews, preparing internal audit scopes, work programs, reports and flowcharts
- Risk management technical skills including conducting risk assessments, developing risk registers and risk reporting
- Knowledge of core business processes (e.g. accounting, accounts receivable, accounts payable, procurement, inventory, contract management, human resources and payroll)
- Understanding of internal audit and internal control industry frameworks (e.g. COSO, COBIT) and risk management standards (e.g. ISO 31000)
- Proficient in Microsoft Office

Salary starts from $80,000 base + Super.

Name: MFM Consultant
Description:
About the Role

An exciting opportunity exists for an appropriately skilled MFM Consultant to join the dynamic multidisciplinary Maternal Fetal Medicine Unit at Joan Kirner Women’s & Children’s at Sunshine Hospital. The MFM Obstetrician will provide high risk pregnancy care for women with complex pregnancies including those with maternal medical disorders, pregnancy specific disordersor fetal complications including management of fetal anomalies and fetal growth restriction.

About the Unit

The Western Health Maternal Fetal Medicine service also provides tertiary level consultation for patients with pregnancy disorders within our catchment area, including referrals from PIPER. The JKWC Maternal Fetal Medicine Unit actively participates in a range of national and international multicentred trials and has ample research opportunities to support the career of a consultant within MFM. “It is the vision of the Women’s and Children’s Division of Western Health to become the best training centre for obstetrics and gynaecology in Australia”.

To be successful in this role you

Current or eligible for registration with AHPRA as a Medical Specialist
Hold Fellowship with RANZCOG or equivalent Specialist qualification
Hold a subspecialist qualification in Maternal Fetal Medicine as recognised by RANZCOG (or have at least 3 years’ experience as a RANZCOG accredited Maternal Fetal Medicine fellow)
Have an interest in teaching and oversight of junior medical staff
Have an interest in research and are committed to CPD/CME

Name: Principal/Senior Systems Assurance Consultant - Melbourne
Description:
Principal and Senior Consultants – System Safety or Reliability 

 
	 Play a key role in exciting rail, transportation & other engineering projects 
	 Friendly, dynamic engineering and management consultancy 
	 Great opportunities to play a part in technical and process innovation          
	 Attractive remuneration package 
 

 About Acmena 
  
The Acmena team is a unique combination of systems engineering, human factors, systems assurance, and engineering management specialists. We help clients deliver critical complex systems in less time and with greater certainty. Our clients include government agencies and key project delivery organisations and we specialise in the rail and transportation industries. 

 As a consequence of successful delivery to clients, we are experiencing an increased demand in systems assurance services and are looking for experienced consultants in each of the 3 states in which we are based. 

 About the role :  
You will: 

 
	 develop, manage and deliver services to clients using advanced and efficient systems engineering and assurance practice, particularly in the rail industry 
	 provide technical leadership, mentorship and advice to other engineers in the company and to client staff 
	 will be involved in developing safety assurance and reliability engineering strategies, plans and analysis in order to ensure safe and reliable operations and meet regulatory requirements 
	 perform, review or assess hazard analysis, stakeholder workshops, safety case development, hazard log management, risk management, reliability modelling and prediction, requirements analysis, auditing, software assurance, verification and validation activities 
	 develop and deliver training courses in system and functional safety and/or RAM 
	 support business development and marketing activities through technical presentations in a variety of forums and through the development of relationships with clients as a trusted advisor. 
 

 Desirable Skills and Experience :  

 
	 Bachelor level qualifications in a relevant Engineering field or related discipline. 
	 High level of knowledge and understanding of systems, safety and reliability engineering and assurance processes and standards, such as, CENELEC EN50126, EN50128 & EN50129, IEC 61508, IEC 15288, the INCOSE handbook, the iESM handbook, CSM or equivalent 
	 Highly developed analytical skills for understanding complex socio-technical systems 
	 Demonstrated ability to exercise a high degree of independence in approach, considerable originality, ingenuity and judgement in formulating solutions or resolving complex problems and issues. 
	 Experience in any of the following
	 
		 The development of Safety and Assurance Cases, and the Goal Structured Notation 
		 The ASCE (Assurance and Safety Case Environment) software 
		 Use of reliability engineering techniques and software 
		 Hazard Analysis and risk assessment techniques and tools 
		 Systems engineering methodologies and tools 
		 Development and delivery of system safety or RAM training 
	 
	 
	 Highly developed interpersonal and communications skills 
	 Experience in rail and transport projects 
	 Commercial acumen and previous experience in consultant organisations

Name: Principal / Senior Systems Engineering Consultant - Sydney
Description:
Principal / Senior Systems Engineering Consultant 

 
	 Deliver complex rail consulting projects across Australia 
	 Specialist System Engineering & Management Consultancy 
	 Attractive remuneration package, and great opportunities for career growth 
 

 About the Company 

 A system engineering and management consultancy working heavily across transportation and other safety-critical systems sectors. Specialists in the integration of systems and software engineering methodologies, including human factors and system safety, with practical program delivery. 

 Proven experience in delivering, installing and commissioning high integrity systems for the railway sector in NSW, QLD and VIC. 

 About the Role 

 You will be work on the efficient delivery of high quality systems engineering services to clients, particularly in the area of requirements management processes and the use of IBM Rational DOORS. You will elicit requirements, and develop systems engineering plans, requirements documentation and V&V specifications. 

 Duties 

 
	 Document user, business, system and design requirements, options analysis and decisions made in progressing to recommended solutions 
	 Develop systems engineering, requirements management, V&V and configuration management plans and any supporting processes and document 
	 Implement and co-ordinates requirements management, traceability and change control management 
	 Coordinate technical reviews 
 

 Skills & Experience 

 
	 Degree in Electrical/ Electro-mechanical Engineering, or Electronics or Communication , or similar technical disciplines 
	 Five or more years of systems engineering consulting 
	 Experience interpreting and applying relevant standards in engineering delivery projects (e.g., AREMA, CENELEC, ISO/IEC, IEEE) 
	 Experience of DOORS or other requirements management tools 
	 Experience in engineering of Mainline or Mass transit systems 
	 Working experience across the full systems engineering lifecycle 
 

 Company Culture and Benefits 

 
	 Friendly, highly experienced team of consultants that specialise across human factors, technical management, systems engineering and assurance 
	 People enjoy working here due to the culture and the opportunity to work in a group that are genuinely passionate about these core areas 
	 Great opportunities for career growth and to learn from industry experts

Name: Consultant Psychiatrist
Description:
The Position
You will provide diagnostic assessment of, and treatment planning for, patients within the health service. As a Consultant Psychiatrist, you will provide clinical supervision to medical officers and the group of motivated registrars working with you. Working in close partnership with the manager of the mental health team you will ensure the functioning of the team is optimal. The service is well structured and provides a supportive environment that balances reasonable work responsibilities with support for professional development, and opportunities to lead service improvement. Participation in the after-hours, on-call roster is required.

The Hospital
The health service is a 700-bed service that provides services in emergency, maternity, women’s health, medical imaging, pathology, rehabilitation, community services, hospice/palliative care, cardiology, and psychiatry. The mental health service provides psychiatric care and treatment across a large catchment area in Victoria and supports patients to pursue their own wellbeing by respecting their wishes as much as possible.

Essential Criteria
Australia/NZ: Must hold FRANZCP and be eligible for Specialist registration with AHPRA (or close too)
UK/Ireland: Must hold MRCPsych / FRCPsych plus UK Certificate of Completion of Training (CCT/CCST) and have been practicing as a Consultant for 3 years or more.
USA: Must hold Certificate of the American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology and have been practicing as a Consultant for 3 years or more.

Name: Advanced Analytics Consultant
Description:
We are looking for an Advanced Analytics Consultant who will support our clients in the product, sales, leadership, and marketing domains with insights gained from analysing data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find product and process optimisation opportunities and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have previous commercial experience using various data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building, and implementing models, using/creating algorithms, and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will be passionate about discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.



Responsibilities:

Work with business stakeholders throughout the organisation to identify opportunities for leveraging the client’s data to drive business solutions.
Mine and analyse data from the client’s databases to optimise product development, marketing techniques, and business strategies.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modelling to increase and optimise customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
Develop A/B testing frameworks and test model quality.
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyse model performance and data accuracy.


Required:

Knowledge of various machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, and proper usage, etc.) and experience with their applications.
Experience using statistical computer languages and packages (R or Python) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Proficiency in RDBMS with advanced SQL query skills.
Experience working with and creating data architectures.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Experience working directly with technical and business teams.
Strong written and verbal communication skills to present results and recommendations.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
Must have experience with Agile development methodologies.
3+ years of experience in the field.

About One51

One51 Consulting is home to the collective knowledge and experience of diverse backgrounds but like-minded individuals. 

At the core of our culture, we value:

A passion for what we do: "We believe in the positive impact data and analytics can have in the data-driven organisation and individual".
Trust goes a long way: This starts with our employees and extends by nature to our clients. We are committed to building long-term partnerships based on trust, clear communication, and understanding.
Creativity and curiosity: Simple solutions to complex problems are possible when the solution design focuses on solving problems and is supported by the correct use of previous experiences and the appetite to keep learning every day.

At One51, you will have the opportunity to work with companies in different business sectors in a relaxed and supportive environment.

One51 uses a hybrid working arrangement – primarily working from home, with optional office days scheduled 1-2 days per week at our Sydney office.

Name: Customer Enablement Consultant
Description:
Your main responsibility will be to demonstrate the value of the Planday product to Australian prospects and enable small local customers (1-50 users) to buy and engage with Planday.
You can expect to work with the following:
•	Steer our beta customers through their first Planday experience
•	Bring excellent product knowledge to highlight key Planday features and manage customer expectations
•	Growing and maintaining relationships with new and existing partners in a given territory
•	Engaging with and developing our new and existing customer accounts
•	Getting to know our partners’ businesses, creating tailored implementation and training plans for their unique needs.
•	Building the relationships with new clients to ensure they understand and utilize, the key features and benefits of the Planday platform.
•	Onboard customers, providing a ‘white-glove’ experience
If you see yourself in some of the points below, we’re excited to learn more about you!
•	Relevant qualifications or at least 5 year relevant experience
•	In-depth knowledge of the Planday platform
•	Solid understanding of our value propositions and how they solve customer business problems
•	The ability to manage a customer base of SMB businesses, up to 20-30 accounts at one time
•	Excellent knowledge of internal Customer Success and Product systems, to be able to manage client feedback back into the business (and customer)

Pay: 75,000 to 80,000 AUD / year

Hours: 38 pr. Week

Name: Data Consultant
Description:
Who are we?

Servian is the largest privately owned data consultancy in Australia. We embrace innovation and change, and the positive impact it has for us and our clients. All roles at Servian involve personal and technical development and career growth, so speak to us about how we can work together.

Our business focuses on Data and Automation across the following pillars:

Cloud & Technology - Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform), HashiCorp
Data & Analytics - BI/DWH, Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science and Advanced Analytics
Digital - Full stack Development, UI/UX Design, Mobile Development
Customer Engagement - Marketing Campaigns, Campaign Analysis, Customer Insights
Artificial Intelligence - Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning
Cyber Security - DevSecOps, Penetration Testing, Multi-Cloud Security, Security Posture Analysis

About the Role

Senior Data Consultants at Servian are responsible for bringing experience and thought-leadership in all areas of data. Your skills will be leveraged by our tier-1 clients across all industries and technologies. Your expertise will support in leading their overall strategy and vision for data, and delivering on cutting-edge data projects.

Typical Responsibilities

Advise on data strategy.
Architect solutions for the establishment of data capabilities including data models, database and data storage infrastructure, master and metadata management, data quality, data integration, data warehousing, data transformation, data analysis and data governance.
Manage the delivery of programs to execute the data strategy.
Collaborate with executives, managers, system owners, data providers, analysts, and various other stakeholders to data projects, to deliver on the data strategy.
Support pre-sales activity to promote Servian, our capabilities and value to current and prospective clients.

Capabilities & Experience

Strong strategic thinker, influencer and problem solver, with technical competency and commercial awareness.
Strong knowledge of all data concepts, technologies, approaches and trends.
Solid practical capability with SQL, P/SQL, databases, integration, master data management, quality assurance, data wrangling and data governance technologies.
Ability to articulate highly technical architectures, concepts, use-cases, designs and approaches, in a way that can be understood by stakeholders of varying degrees of technical literacy.
Knowledge of Cloud environments are desirable, including Google, AWS and Azure.
Knowledge of AI and ML technologies and principles are desirable.

Wellbeing & Benefits

Access to a wide range of internal training sessions, across both technical and consulting skills.
Sponsored certifications across all our partner technology vendors. 
We provide employees with Life, Salary Insurance and access to an Employee Assistance Program. 
We are proud to have a sociable workplace that values diversity and celebrates achievement with multiple company-wide, social, and family events throughout the year. Due to Covid-19, all social events are currently virtual.

Inclusion & Diversity

Servian recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at Servian.

What’s Next?

If this sounds like you, please send us your CV!

Name:
Consultant

Description:
Sagent Pty Ltd provides highly regarded professional consulting services in project, development management and land development, corporate advisory and governance at both a project and Board levels to corporate, institution, government and private sector clients across Australia and internationally.

We are seeking an experienced land economist with 15-20 years of relevant experience and excellent professional qualifications able to:

• Advise on valuation methods for leasing, sale and other land and property investment strategies and stand-alone transactions.

• Select and use methods of valuation and write assessments for use by development clients.
• Pre-project advice and commentary on land for purposes of project and development financing to assist planning clients.
• Review current and predict future market demand, trends and property market conditions and advise on possible land and property best use from panning and investment perspectives.

The capacity to effectively communicate and present results of work and professional advice to the highest decision-making bodies and executives is critical for a successful candidate.

The position will require long-term commitment as well as devotion, passion and the ability to sustain in delivering highly professional services.

Candidates with international experience would be highly regarded.

Salary up to $140,000 will be offered to the right candidate.

Only eligible candidates will be shortlisted.

Name:
Development | Software Developers | Consultants | All levels
                                New listing
Description:
Hi! We're Telstra Purple!  We're more than just tech and innovation. We're a collection of passionate people who give purpose to technology. These are the most important aspects of our business - in fact, so important that we've used them to literally inspire our name. We're a technology services organisation focused on transforming businesses, from the network to digital experience and we do it all with a purpose in mind.
About the role  Consultants at Telstra Purple are known for discovering the latest and greatest in technologies, mastering their nuances, and influencing our clients and our community with their potential.  As a Consultant, you will help to deliver innovative solutions for our clients, improving existing coding practices and educating teams in all aspects of software delivery. We encourage you to use a multitude of approaches to make impactful contributions to our clients, including pair programming, workshops/training, and one-on-one mentoring. You'll grow into a subject matter expert at an accelerated pace, and be part of a community where continuous learning and improvement isn't just enabled, but expected.  None of our roles are "just developer" roles - they're all client-facing. Our consultants aren't just productive team members - they are influencers, coaches, mentors, teachers and business partners. Great people skills are key. You will be able to apply your passion for technology and problem solving, using the latest, cutting edge technologies whilst working alongside and learning from talented, knowledgeable and experienced software development consultants..  We're currently looking for talented consultants against each level of our career framework. Reach out if you want to more details but hopefully this rundown on our roles gives an idea of what we look for.  About our Squad  Quokka Squad - Geographically diverse covering WA, SA and the NT... The Quokka Squad is packed with talented technologists who are passionate about solving real problems for our clients. A curious 'shaka' (collective noun for quokkas) that love to learn, grow and share both internally and with our community.  Technical Skills  Ideally, you have: 

An insatiable passion for development 
Development experience in C#, JavaScript, TypeScript, Kotlin and/or Swift or similar language(s), with an understanding of the core language, tools, frameworks, and libraries that allow you to deliver effectively in your chosen stack 
Confidence in applying Agile software delivery principles and Continuous Delivery practices 
Some experience in constructing automation solutions for build and deployment 
Experience engaging with a variety of stakeholders 
Advantageous to have: 
Some front-end web development experience with a framework such as Angular or React 
Working knowledge of cloud-based infrastructure from providers such as Azure or AWS

We're after the right blend of experience and enthusiasm, and look for cultural add, rather than cultural fit! We look forward to learning about you.  This role requires the successful candidate to be vaccinated against Covid-19, to ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people and customers. However, please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances.  Applications Open - 24 June 2022  Applications Close - 24 July 2022 Please click here to apply.

Name:
274708WD Transaction Services - Senior Consultant
                                New listing
Description:
With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)

What will you create? 

You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.

Deals bring this to life by helping a diverse range of domestic and overseas businesses from deal-concept to deal-close. Made up of Transactions Value Advisory, Corporate Finance Restructuring and Food & Agribusiness Advisory, each team offers data driven insights that enable clients to move in the right direction, ensuring maximum value for their company.

As a Transaction Services - Senior Consultant in our Private Clients team your impact will be seen by:

Detailing data collection, analysis and modelling
Identifying key value drivers and deal breakers
Completing buy and sell side financial due diligence reports
Completing pre-lend reviews for Financiers
Contributing to investigating accountant work on Initial Public Offerings
Working directly with other 3rd party advisor teams
About you 

You have a background in or are passionate about providing financial due diligence services supporting companies acquiring or divesting businesses or raising expansion capital projects, you will have the opportunity to work with and assist our leaders with all facets of transactions, participate in a collaborative team, with a focus on knowledge sharing and thought leadership, and focus on building lasting relationships as a trusted advisor to world-class clients.

You have a commercial and analytical focus in influencing and advising clients, strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills, a team focused style with strong organisational and project management skills, self motivated, confident and proactive, strong focus on building client relationships - internal and external. Tertiary qualified in Accounting/Commerce/Business or related qualification and studies undertaken in CA, CFA, Master of Finance, FINSIA or similar discipline are highly advantageous.

Life at PwC

Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.

We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.

We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.

Bhadz Layosa is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experiences high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

We welcome the opportunity to speak to candidates about our value proposition and recognition and reward approach. The minimum full time salary for this role is $81,000 including 10% Superannuation, however will be determined based on the skills and experience that the candidate brings. #LI-PWCLMT 

PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.

PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html

Name:
AEM Developer/Consultant
