Name: Procurement Consultant
Description:
Who we are
OneCare is a not-for-profit aged care organization, founded on the principles of compassion, respect and dignity for the individual. We take a holistic approach to the provision of our services, treating each resident and consumer as a ‘whole person’ with regard to the design and delivery of their individual care and well-being. We have a rich history and have been providing residential aged care for more than 40 years.

What we need
A highly skilled and motivated Procurement Consultant to join our Finance and Administration Team Full Time.

What will you do?
Reporting to the Manager Finance and Administration, you will have the opportunity to:
•	Negotiate with external vendors to secure advantageous terms
•	Develop and maintain statewide procurement processes and other relevant business operational needs in collaboration with internal stakeholders
•	Collaborate with key persons to ensure their product and service needs, and provide procurement, contracts and tendering advice to stakeholders across OneCare Limited
•	Assist with the creation of an end to end purchasing process and product catalogue to drive ordering efficiency and cost effectiveness
•	-Compile and manage existing and ongoing supplier contracts
•	Assist with the negotiation of new contracts with suppliers
•	Track and report key functional metrics to reduce expenses and improve effectiveness
•	Perform risk management for supply contracts and agreements
•	Identify areas of improvement to continually drive performance and business results
•	Work collaboratively and keep informed the larger Finance/Property teams on the procurement process and progress of procurement projects.
•	Assist in managing the vehicle fleet and associated costs
•	Provide end-to-end delivery of the procurement, process applying and adapting established procedures to suit the required context while ensuring compliance with applicable legislation, codes of practice and policies.
•	Develop and maintain systems that support procurement and contracts information to be relevant and up-to-date at all times. The system must support early identification of expiring contracts and any other relevant requirements.
•	Liaise with Finance to monitor and forecast appropriate budget figures for the facilities and expenditure
 

 What you bring to the role
•	Proven working experience as a Procurement Consultant or Procurement Officer
•	Knowledge of sourcing and procurement techniques and strategies
•	Talent in negotiations and networking
•	Good knowledge of supplier or third party management software
•	Aptitude in decision-making and working with numbers
•	Experience in collecting and analyzing data
•	Strong leadership capabilities
•	High-Level of attention to detail and problem solving skills
•	Ability to communicate at all levels
•	Professional verbal and written communication skills
•	A desire to work in the Not-For-Profit Industry

What you get in return 
At OneCare, we care deeply about our residents, our staff and the jobs we do each day. Our workplace is caring, supportive and down to earth. As a values-led consumer focused business, OneCare offers a rewarding work environment where you will be able to contribute meaningfully and will see the results of your efforts. 
We offer a competitive remuneration package with access to not-for-profit salary packaging.

How to apply
Please provide your resume and a cover letter outlining why you would be suitable for this position and how you meet the selection criteria by 10am Friday 30 July 2022.

For further information about this role or a copy of the position description, please contact Natalie Neilson, Executive Manager People & Systems, on 6220 1214.

Registration to work with vulnerable people with an NDIS endorsement and Covid-19 vaccination are essential requirements to work at OneCare.

Name: Management Consultant
Description:
Do you want to crack complex problems?
Are you after variety across clients, projects and industries?

Look no further. At Innovior, you’ll receive the support you need to excel – and the freedom to make your mark.

Based in Melbourne, Sydney and the Philippines, Innovior are a boutique Digital Transformation Consultancy, working with clients who don’t settle for standard solutions. First we discover, diagnosing concerns, uncovering business process optimisation opportunities and then create actionable strategies. And then we deliver applying our business experience and technical expertise to deliver deep change. True transformation starts when discovery and delivery are integrated as one.

Our services include Management Consulting, Digital transformation, Experience design, Supply chain optimisation and Workforce planning. We are technology agnostic however have deep expertise in UiPath, BluePrism, Microsoft Stack, AWS, Salesforce, ServiceNow and Anaplan.


What will be your focus?

As a Management Consultant you will help organisations to solve issues, create value, maximise growth and improve business performance. You will provide objective advice and expertise and help an organisation to explore growth opportunities in operations, finance, and management by:

- Conducting workshops and meetings with senior management and stakeholders to assess organisational problems
- Conducting workshops with subject matter experts and developing current state (AS-IS) and future state (TO-BE) business process maps
- Identifying efficiency issues, root causes for issues and opportunities for improvement and optimisation
- Developing business cases for transformation, improvement and automation projects
- Engaging senior management and key stakeholders for transformation and automation initiatives and projects
- Designing operating and governance models, change management processes for transformation and automation projects
- Problem identification through management consultations, team meetings, case framework analysis, and Lean Six sigma tools
- Providing strategic and operational advisory and help the management of the business implement the most cost-effective methods to drive operational excellence
- Analysing business processes, identify opportunities, define RPA value proposition, reengineer process to improve automation potential and recommend business improvement strategies


What you will bring

- Undergraduate degree with strong academic record and/or master, MBA
- Deep expertise in key industries such as resources, retail, health, higher education, engineering, banking & finance
- Exceptional problem solving skills and the ability to break part ambiguous problems
- Solid functional knowledge such as strategy, business development, manufacturing, supply chain, change management
- Strong logical reasoning and solutions ideation skills
- Quantitative aptitude


Our commitment to you

Technology and tools matter. But our people remain our most important asset. Collaboration is at our core and we remain laser-focused on supporting you to succeed. Alongside a hybrid work place, here’s how.

Leave for life - On top of 12 weeks paid parental leave, you’ll receive loyalty leave for every year of service.

Proactive professional development - Excel with learning leave, career roadmaps, tailored development plans and active mentoring.

Feedback for success - Shape your career through our triannual feedback conversations and quarterly satisfaction surveys.

Diversity and inclusion - Workplaces should reflect and embrace the world around us. In fact, it’s one of our cornerstone values.

Want to be part of our exciting story? And help make our next chapter even better than the last? Connect with us for a discussion around the opportunities at Innovior for you.

Name: Business Consultant
Description:
On behalf of our client, we are looking for an ICT Business Analyst. 

This role is a core member of a layered, multi-disciplinary team responsible for designing, developing, testing and implementing a business solution. Your responsibility will be to support a client's product proposition and operating model throughout the implementation of the Sonata software package within Wealth Management clients.
 
The daily duties and responsibilities include: 

•	Collaborate with client staff to define how an in-scope business process will be fulfilled through the alignment of people, process, and technology.
•	Document what the technology platform needs to achieve to support the client's operating model, organisation structure and ways of working.
•	Identify how the client's technology requirements can be best supported within the Sonata platform through configuration or new development.
•	Participate in the configuration of the Sonata application.
•	Develop the criteria that engineering staff will use to ensure that any development work has been successfully completed.
•	Analyse incidents arising from user test to determine whether the Sonata application is working as expected.
•	Plan and account for all implementation effort expended.
•	Build and maintain stakeholder relationships
 
Education – Educated to degree level in a science, engineering or mathematical subject. 
 
Experience & Skills 
•	A minimum of 1 year's experience in a business or technology consulting company or as part of a Change/Technology team in retail financial services
•	Experience of working within successful technology implementation programmes
•	Operations team leadership within financial services
•	Strong analytical skills including knowledge of UML or other structured analysis method
•	Organised with the ability to plan and achieve outcomes
•	Clear communication style, whether written or oral, effective in presentations
•	Thorough knowledge of technology and the opportunities afforded by digital working methods
•	Consultative and an effective influencer
•	Ability to apply analytical skill and conceptual thinking to operations and system planning
•	Ability to collaborate with clients
•	Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation and facilitation skills
•	Resilience including the ability to work effectively under time pressure
•	Ability to work in a team environment
•	Proactive approach to work
•	Proven eagerness for continual personal development
•	Commercial awareness
•	Capable of working on-site at client offices

Name: Indirect Tax/GST - Senior Consultant
Description:
To solve important problems we need diverse talent. Our people use their creativity, authenticity and human differences to be champions of change. When people from diverse backgrounds, with different points of view, work together, we create incredible value - for our clients, our people and our society. If you don’t think you quite meet all of the qualifications, we’d still love to hear from you. 

About Us

Life isn’t simple.The challenges facing us all are complex, chewy and carry real risk. So at PwC, we’ve created ‘The New Equation’, a global strategy to tackle the challenges facing businesses and society. We’re coming together in new, creative ways to blend our experiences and uncover new, unexpected solutions. We focus on building trust, delivering sustained outcomes and helping our clients solve their most important problems.

Today’s challenges need a fresh angle. Your ingenuity, passion and experience, combined with the latest technology, can provide the answers we need. Together, we are a passionate community of solvers coming together in unexpected ways, creating new solutions for a new day.

We’re in the transformation business - for our clients and our people. We're a diverse, ambitious team who hunt for imaginative ways to solve our clients' most important challenges. You'll get to work with the latest technologies, in an environment that empowers you to think differently.

Indirect Tax brings this to life by offering clients tailored solutions from helping them meet compliance and risk management obligations, through to strategic tax planning, structuring and transactional and technology solutions.

We’re reimagining the possible, about what we can do, and how we can do it. And it all adds up to The New Equation.

Responsibilities

Performing a key role in the indirect tax go to market strategy

Managing complex indirect tax projects giving you exposure to indirect taxes broadly including indirect taxes in other countries

Taking responsibility for preparing clients for ATO Justified Trust GST reviews giving you an understanding of the client’s systems, processes and controls to manage GST 

Building relationships with clients as a valuable step to further developing your career 

Working collaboratively within the indirect tax team and across PwC to deliver solutions to clients

Coaching others, recognising their strengths and encouraging them to take ownership of their personal development 

Managing multiple tasks with competing priorities. 

Simplifying complex messages and communicating them to clients who may not be tax people

Showing a keen interest in technology and an understanding of the benefits of automation.

Demonstrating the PwC's values of act with integrity, make a difference, reimagine the possible, work together and care 

Upholding PwC’s code of ethics and business conduct.

Requirements

You have a background in indirect tax with 4-6 years experience

You are skilled in interpreting tax law and applying it to the factual circumstances

You delegate work and act as coach / mentor to team members.

Benefits

Working here carries prestige, but that’s not the only benefit. We want you to be at your best here, and we’re focused on helping you do it, your way. Here are some of the ways we create balance between your work life and non-work life. 

Flexible daily working hours - we value work-life balance

Work overseas or interstate - we know how precious time is with your family and friends

Paid study (and leave!) - we’ll pay all the costs and give you time off to study

Dress for your day - we trust you to choose what works best for you

Yearly bonuses - get rewarded for great performance!

Health & fitness perks, like a wellness stipend and discounted memberships

Generous parental leave policy for mums, dads and foster carers

Our purpose is to solve the world’s most important problems together. Join our community of solvers, and bring your experience, passion and expertise to our world. 

We believe the best work is human-led and tech-powered.. If you’re keen to apply and need reasonable adjustments or would like to note which pronouns you use at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know. 

Camille Roasa is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experiences high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

We welcome the opportunity to speak to candidates about our value proposition and recognition and reward approach. The minimum full time salary for this role is $79,900 including 10% Superannuation, however will be determined based on the skills and experience that the candidate brings. #LI-PWCLMT

PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events. 

PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html'

Name: Senior or Principal Recruitment Consultant
Description:
About You and The Role:
* 0-4 years in a sales role, preference is Recruitment, Real estate, Retail, Tech Sales or an attitude that has a winning mindset.
* A genuine interest in Technology, Products, Innovation, Venture building and change
* An interest in innovation and HR tech
* The attributes of going above and beyond to help build and shape careers.
* Driven in becoming an SME in your vertical of choice and becoming a thought leader in your space.
* Ability to drive ideas to ensure you are the go-to in your field
* Must be charismatic and a true leader at heart - you are someone that leads through your actions and outcomes.
* Relationship driven, both internally and externally
* You are a natural collaborator and know how to prioritise requirements
* You have a can-do attitude that can listen and retain information
* You are proactive in your approach and are innovative with best practices in tech to find and engage talent
* Passionate and interested in Business, IT, Start-ups and hitting targets
* Common roles you will be placing; Exec Search, Project Managers & BA's, PMO, PM Coordinator, Process, Change Manager, Trainers / Cloud Engineers, Cloud Arch, DevOps, Integration, Delivery managers / Product Managers, Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Visual Design, UI, IxD, Product Designers, UXD's, Service Design Strategic Design, Venture Architects / Open source engineering stacks / Business Systems (ERP) / Sales and Marketing
* With a curiosity to learn about people, technology and business, backed by a growth mindset will have you set for this exciting opportunity, both financially & professionally

We offer:
* PSA clients ASX 20 & Startup in technology, digital across contract, perm & exec search!
* Placement Bonuses plus quarterly and annual bonuses
* Team Incentives & Bonus 
* Various Management incentive schemes 
* Dual Desk - Perm & Contract
* Dedicated resourcer 
* Great comms structure (up to 50%)
* Flexible working - 5 days a week
* Maternity & Paternity leave
* Monthly Team events/drinks
* Professional development
* A tech-driven business that is constantly evolving 
* Opportunities to lead new and exciting ventures that are currently in the pipeline or be instrumental in bringing ideas to the table.

Name: Consultant Anesthetist
Description:
About Monash Health

Monash Health is Victoria’s largest public health service. We are proud to provide healthcare to one quarter of Melbourne’s population, across the entire life-span from newborn and children, to adults, the elderly, their families and carers. More than 22,000 employees work at over 40 care locations across south eastern Melbourne, including Monash Medical Centre, Monash Children’s Hospital, Moorabbin Hospital, Dandenong Hospital, Casey Hospital, Kingston Centre, Cranbourne Centre, and an extensive network of rehabilitation, aged care, community health and mental health facilities. For more information please visit www.monashhealth.org.

About Monash Doctors

There are more than 1,300 Junior Medical staff positions at Monash Health in over 200 medical specialties, to help grow your career. We offer unparalleled opportunities in Victoria's largest & most clinically diverse teaching health service.About Monash Doctors

Monash Anaesthesia

Providing anaesthetic support to 7 Monash Health facilities, Monash Health currently employs over 150 Specialist Anaesthetists and supports the Monash/Southern Anaesthetic training program, with over 80 trainees. We cover an extensive range of tertiary surgical disciplines.

Monash Health is looking for General Specialist, Paediatric Specialist Anaesthetists and Anaesthetists holding an FPM

Anaesthetists to work within Monash Health alongside other anaesthetists working at Dandenong and Cranbourne ICC, Casey, Clayton, Moorabbin and Monash Children’s hospitals.

A significant eft is available, with a combination of Fractional/VMO and Full time positions, some 6 - 12 month fixed term and some ongoing/3 years maximum, with the positions requiring a minimum commitment to Monash Health of 20 hours per week. All start dates will be in 2022, with some flexibility available for individuals. Please email Mark Adams for further details. Mark.Adams@monashhealth.org.

About the Role

To support and assist the Service and Site Directors of Anaesthesia in the provision of high quality anaesthetic services across Monash health sites, consistent with Monash Health values.

Provide clinical leadership through active involvement in patient care.
Be available to medical colleagues for consultation and liaison as appropriate regarding patient care.
Support academic, research, education, training & supervision (both undergraduate and postgraduate) roles in the Department of Anaesthesia and Perioperative Medicine, Monash Health.
Contribute to the professional and corporate life in Victoria's largest public health service by participation in appropriate committees and educational platforms.
Contribute to ongoing service improvement and clinical and workforce innovation to ensure Monash Health provides high quality accessible anaesthetic services
What we offer:

Salary packaging
Onsite discounted staff parking Discounted banking (BankVic)
Onsite Gym
Access to professional development courses and seminar
What you need:

Specialist registration with the Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (AHPRA)
Fellowship of the Australian & New Zealand College of Anaesthetists.
For full Paediatric scope of practice recognition, a 12 month fellowship, in a recognised tertiary Paediatric hospital, is required
A valid Employee Victorian Working with Children Check (WWCC) is required for all medical staff at Monash Health. Do you have a WWCC card? If so please list the number and expiry date.
Statutory Declaration
How to Apply
Candidates who are not Monash Health staff are required to complete Fit to Work consent along with 100 points of certified ID. Please respond 'YES' to confirm your acknowledgment of this requirement or N/A if you are a current employee or an International Medical Graduate As part of your application please attach a copy of both your Primary and Specialist (if applicable) medical qualification in the Supporting Documents section. Respond YES to confirm acknowledgment. If successful you will be required to present the original or a certified copy to MDW.

Monash Health recognises the value of equal employment opportunity and is committed to patient safety and promoting fairness, equity and diversity in the workplace. At Monash Health we are relentless in our pursuit of excellence and work to our six guiding principles.

Applications will only be accepted via the Monash Health online Mercury System only. Email applications will not be considered.

Offers of employment can only be made once all required probity checks have been completed. These include:

reference checks;
a clear Police Check conducted within the last three months;
a current Victorian Employee Working with Children’s Check (or proof of payment for same);and
proof of immunisation.
A request to conduct probity checks does not guarantee that an offer of employment will be made.

As part of our selection process, you may be invited by email to participate in an on-camera video interview.

To comply with Victorian Public Health directions, all employees working in the Public Health system must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and are required to provide acceptable evidence of their vaccination status. To support your application, and to be compliant with any public health orders in place at the time of, and during, your employment, you will be required to upload evidence of full vaccination against COVID-19. Acceptable evidence is a copy of a Government Official Immunisation History Statement or Digital Certificate showing all vaccination dates. It is a requirement of Monash Health to collect, record and hold vaccination information. Offers of employment will only be made to candidates who can provide acceptable evidence that they meet full vaccination status.

Name: *Tech Arch Consultant*
Description:
Job Profile Summary

Sell, assess, define, implement and/or support world-class information technology architectures, for Accenture or our clients, spanning simple IT projects to large-scale, enterprise-level change programs. Provide consultative Technology Architecture solutions to help implement the client's required architecture. Conduct architecture assessments and define solutions to produce a detailed technical design document for custom development and integration requirements. Provide client training.

Skills:

- Intermediate Technological Innovation
- Intermediate Technology Architecture Assessment
- Intermediate Technology Architecture Blueprint & Roadmap Definition
- Intermediate Technology Architecture Sales
- Intermediate Technology Assessment
- Advanced Technology Architecture Estimation
- Advanced Technology Architecture Implementation

About Accenture

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com. 

At Accenture, our philosophy is anchored in recognising that our people are multi-dimensional. We take an intersectional human approach to create a work environment where all people feel like they can bring their authentic selves to work, every day.

We believe that equality drives innovation. Our commitment to accelerating equality starts at the top with our board and CEO and extends across every part of the company. This comes to life when our people own the equality agenda, making it part of their jobs – every decision, every day – and feel free to speak up and to act.

We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation. We want a workplace that is inclusive and diverse to that end we are setting bold goals and taking comprehensive action. To achieve these goals, we collect information that allows us to track the effectiveness of our Inclusion and Diversity programs.

Learn how Accenture protects your personal data and know your rights in relation to your personal data. Read more about our Privacy Statement.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

At Accenture, our philosophy is anchored in recognising that our people are multi-dimensional. We take an intersectional human approach to create a work environment where all people feel like they can bring their authentic selves to work, every day.

We believe that equality drives innovation. Our commitment to accelerating equality starts at the top with our board and CEO and extends across every part of the company. This comes to life when our people own the equality agenda, making it part of their jobs – every decision, every day – and feel free to speak up and to act.

We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation. We want a workplace that is inclusive and diverse to that end we are setting bold goals and taking comprehensive action. To achieve these goals, we collect information that allows us to track the effectiveness of our Inclusion and Diversity programs.

To apply for this role, please use the following link:
https://accenture.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/AccentureCareers/job/Melbourne/XMLNAME--Tech-Arch-Consultant-_R00106995

Name: ERP Service Desk Consultant
Description:
Who We Are
Atturra is an ASX listed technology services consultancy, focused on providing end-to-end transformation services to our clients. Atturra is technologically competent and empathetically human. Ensuring our clients work with the right people, to solve the right challenges.

Our successful ERP consulting business based in Toowong has generated clients throughout Australia, New Zealand and Fiji, with team members across Australia and New Zealand.

We are passionate about local manufacturing and strive to ensure our clients remain successful through IT and Business solutions. With a very strong culture and set of values that set us apart from other companies, we are an employer of choice.

For wherever you need to go next. For wherever the future is going.

Atturra, we’ll lead you there.


About The Role
Due to continued growth, we are seeking a capable and energetic professional to join our Service Desk team, who will assist in providing our clients with application support and customer service for QAD. As a key member of the Service Desk team, you will contribute to a variety of client support tasks, ranging from ticket logging and management, support analysis, software testing, advice on best practices, development documentation, administration tasks, and continuous improvement activities. This role requires a good level of QAD application knowledge as well as technology skills across a broad range of IT functions.

This is a permanent full-time role, preferably based in our Toowong office, but also open to candidates based in other states, as well as New Zealand and outside Australia.
-Embrace our company values
-Maintaining core systems in the business by monitoring Service Desk SLAs to ensure all tickets are responded to promptly and regularly
-Providing application and system operational support to users; investigating, and resolving problems, escalating to senior Support Team members where additional expertise is required
-Contribute to authoring technical documentation
-Contribute to root cause analysis as required to address recurring incidents
-Work with other senior consultants and managers to facilitate the overall happiness of clients
-This role does include a rotating after hours on call component for which an allowance is paid. Average call volume less than one per week, usually after 6am.


About You
We are in the lookout for an ‘all-rounder’, capable of multi-tasking and setting priorities with their assigned task. You will also be very flexible and adaptable, willing, and able to work on a diverse range of tasks. You will have strong “trouble shooting” skills, and while you are able to work with minimal supervision, you enjoy being part of a close team.

Mandatory Sills & Requirements
-Must have a minimum of 2 years’ experience with QAD ERP systems and 3+ years’ experience with a manufacturing ERP system
-An alignment with our company values
-Demonstrated ability to be self-motivated, highly organised, and effectively solve problems
-Confident and professional verbal and written communications skills, including updating knowledgebase articles and wikis
-A passion and drive for continuous learning and self-improvement
-A strong desire to exceed customer expectations
-Valid Australian working rights
-Must agree to complete a full background check, including police check

Preferred Skills & Requirements
-Previous experience working in a Help Desk environment
-Knowledge of and experience supporting a medium to large ERP system (for example SAP, Oracle, MS Dynamics, Pronto, NetSuite)


What Makes Us Different
Our collective capabilities and breadth of experience set us apart. We offer unprecedented scale with industry capabilities and strong relationships with technology partners that are category leaders. The unique approach of Atturra combined with our cross skills and strong IP has delivered success and transformation for over 600 clients in dozens of industries.

We are recognised in the industry, with Atturra Data & Integration recently winning Boomi Partner of the Year!

This is a unique opportunity to create and shape your future with a growing business. You will be joining a talented, close-knit team who work in a digital, agile and creative environment.

If you are looking for your next challenge and to be a part of our growing company - apply here and we will call you for a confidential discussion.

Please note only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.


Atturra is passionate about playing an active role in addressing the digital skills gap and being an advocate for Diversity and Inclusion, and welcomes applications from all irrespective of their gender, LGBTQI identity, ethnicity, religion, physical ability or age.

Name: Motor Claims Consultants
Description:
Boutique Underwriting Agency looking to expand their small claims team that specialise in Motor Claims  Please only apply if you are in Australia  Your new company Our client is a Sydney based Underwriting Agency that specialise in High-End Motor Vehicle Insurance services. Due to an increasing workload they are looking to add an additional member to their very relaxed and fun loving team.  Your new role Working as a Motor Claims Officer you will be;

Handling end to end claims
Liaising with Internal & External stakeholders to investigate and settle claims, i.e. - Broker, Solicitors, Claimants
Determining what information is needed to repair or settle claim
Providing updates on Claims progress
Liaising with 3rd parties to attempt to recover  What you'll need to succeed To be successful as a Motor Vehicles officer, you will have; 
At least 2 years Motor Claims experience
Competency in Excel and Microsoft office products is essential
Have a solid knowledge of general Insurance legislation and statutory framework
Proven high level communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills  What you'll get in return If you are successful, you will be receiving;
An above market rate of $90,000 (Full Package)
A role working a minimum 38hrs a week, working Monday to Friday standard business hours
An opportunity that is both work from home and the office, based in Sydney CBD -The opportunity to work in a dynamic and supportive environment
Hybrid working environment (3 in Office, 2 from home)  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.  SA Licence number : LHS 297508
Please click here to apply.

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
Over the last 8 years, Academy HR has built a reputation for delivering first-class results across our client base within the Warehousing, 3PL and Cold Storage sectors.

Our vision is to be the most trusted recruitment & labour hire agency in Australia. We'll achieve this mission by doing right by client, candidate, and colleague. We value focus, care, honest communication, and feedback.

If the above meets what you're looking for then we have an opportunity available for a Recruitment Consultant across our Warehousing, 3PL, Transport & Logistics and Cold Storage Support team!

Duties
•	Preparing and advertising of job vacancies and interviewing staff
•	Ensuring all inductions and personal records of all staff are current and entered into the companies software program
•	Monitoring workplace relations policies and procedures as well as conducting staff performance reviews and disciplinary matters
•	Working with clients in the receiving and recording of job vacancies that are required to be filled.
•	Negotiate salary packages and terms and conditions of employment with successful candidates.
•	Staying up to date with current government legislation, awards, collective agreements and employment contracts.


We can offer:

A leadership team with over 30 year's experience in high-performing recruitment teams
•	A training & development program that can launch new starters into recruitment, elevate experienced consultants or develop future leaders.
•	One-on-one coaching when required
•	Competitive Salary and Benefits
•	Systems and processes that are ahead of industry standards
•	A brand that outreaches any other agency in Victoria that specialise within Warehousing, 3PL, Transport & Logistics and Cold Storage sectors

Skills & Traits that we are looking for in our team:

•	Drive and passion to succeed.
•	An ability to forward think and meet the challenges we face
•	Relationship building and time management skills
•	Digital natives, are you socially aware and across multiple platforms promoting your skills?
•	Values - Our business is focused on building trust with our clients and candidates. We are looking for people to hold this value!
•	Fluent in Spanish to manage our student visa placement division

Competencies Required

•	Working with people: Understanding others, adapting to others, rewarding others, listening, consulting, supporting, caring.
•	Persuading and influencing: Making an impact, gaining agreement, negotiating, persuading, convincing, promoting ideas, managing conflict.
•	Relating and networking: Building relationships, networking, relating to all levels.
•	Planning and organising: Setting objectives, planning, establishing contingencies, managing time, resources and people, monitoring progress.
•	Delivering results and meeting customer expectations: Focusing on customer needs and satisfaction, setting high quality and quantity standards, working systematically, achieving project goals.
•	Entrepreneurial and commercial thinking: Keeping up to date with competitor information and market trends, identifying business opportunities, showing financial awareness, controlling costs.


Formal Qualifications / Certificates Required and or Relevant tertiary education desirable 

Due to the high number of applicant only shortlisted candidates contacted at this stage.

Name: Consultant Psychiatrist
Description:
For more information regarding this position or to apply, please visit https://medjobswa.mercury.com.au and search Pool Ref #11496

MP Year 1-9 $355,172 - $452,806 p.a. (inclusive of base salary, 10% superannuation and applicable allowances)

This is a Fixed Term Full Time appointment for 5 years with the possibility of extension(s)

Position Profile: The Consultant Psychiatrist delivers specialist mental health services within campus. This role provides clinical leadership, coordination and direction for the multidisciplinary team responsible for delivering evidenced based best practice treatment, and evaluates the provision of consumer centred care within a recovery- based framework. The successful candidate for this role will provide leadership, orientation, training, supervision and education, where relevant, for doctors in training, Health Service Medical Practitioners and other health workers, and in collaboration with the Service Director, Head of Department and other Consultants will work to achieve national, state and EMHS performance standards and targets.
 
Area Profile: Armadale Health Service (AHS) is a general hospital focused on providing a range of high quality health care services in the community. The hospital, which is part of the Armadale Kalamunda Group, is equipped with an Emergency Department and Intensive Care Unit and provides high-quality general medical and surgery services, rehabilitation, maternity, paediatric and neonatal, mental health, renal medicine and dialysis services and ambulatory care.

Direct link to apply:
https://medjobswa.mercury.com.au/ViewPosition.aspx?id=LFtGV47x7B0=&jbc=ere

Name: Cyber Response - Senior Consultant
Description:
Hi, we're Telstra Purple.   We are Australia's largest owned technology services business, focused on outcome-based, transformative tech solutions that help our customers cut through IT complexity to achieve their bespoke goals, faster. If solving unique problems sparks your interest to help change a business, a community or the environment for the better - we're in sync.  The opportunity  Cyber Response provides a timely response to any event that harms or threatens to cause harm to the confidentiality, integrity or availability of our customers networks, Telstra's network, and related services. This role will provide a response to network and information security incidents such as malicious code, unauthorised access, information disclosure, inappropriate usage and, system compromise. This role requires an inquisitive nature and deep knowledge and ability to analyse both network and host based data for evidence of unauthorised or unwanted activity. This role is designed to ensure that Information and Network Security incidents are handled with urgency and attention to detail to provide assurance that the confidentiality and privacy of Telstra Purple and customer data is maintained.  About you

Coordinate responses to security incidents in a timely manner.
Identify areas of gap and recommend appropriate security controls \ solutions to implement.
Work with various teams across the organisation to improve security posture.
Follow and contribute to the maintenance of incident response plans
Ensuring data gathered and reported is accurate and legally admissible from an evidence collection standpoint.
Maintain a network of similarly minded and skilled professionals
Perform on call duties as per the team roster.
Contribute to knowledge sharing within the team via documentation of processes.

Note: We will consider VISA Sponsorship and covering relocation costs from overseas for the right eligible candidate  To be successful in this role you will need to have extensive experience in security incident response and a strong knowledge and competence with Linux command line. As a specialist in this field you will contribute to developing strategy and engaging and influencing stakeholders. Your knowledge of Web application security practices and familiarity with incident response tools will hold you in good stead for this role.  What we offer

Access to professional development
16 weeks paid parental leave for both primary and secondary carers
Laptop/ Device & 20gb Hotspot, to enable you to work from anywhere

Work/life enablement; so you can balance work + life's other responsibilities
An epic (free) Telstra mobile phone and plan
Purchased Annual Leave scheme
Salary sacrifice / packaging. Set aside part of your salary to pay for things like extra toolkit, short term incentive-to-Super
25% discount on Telstra products and services
An additional Telstra day off and a volunteer day off
Opportunity to earn points through our internal recognition program

The current version of this advert will run from 23rd June to July 22nd. Name: Recruitment Consultant - Accounting Support
Description:
Join Australia's leading recruitment agency | Uncapped earning potential | Parramatta  Your new company We're looking for a motivated and driven person to join our Accounting Support team at Hays in Parramatta. At Hays, we are globally recognised as the industry's leading recruitment agency due to our authentic and passionate approach to changing the lives of our clients and candidates. Recruitment is an industry that is continuously growing and presenting exciting career opportunities to ambitious individuals.  Your new role

Engage regularly with your current clients to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders and further develop your understanding of their business needs
Build you client portfolio by making new business development calls and establishing new relationships, identify business opportunities and take a genuine interest in managing a solution for them
Source candidate talent using our "find & engage" methodology and tools and active networking in your industry as well as advertise your current and upcoming job vacancies to attract candidates within your specialist industry
Pre-screen candidates via phone and conduct thorough interviews face to face, understand your candidates' goals and career aspirations
Skill match candidates to the relevant job vacancies and create a specific candidate short list to present to your clients
Manage candidate and client interviews, conduct references on your clients' behalf as well as negotiate salary and start dates for your candidate
Continue to develop your industry knowledge, make expert recommendations for both your clients and candidates alike, work collaboratively with your team and adhere to your set targets and KPI's

What you'll need to succeed

Experience in recruitment is advantageous but not essential!
You have a passion for sales, are highly motivated and results driven
Passionate about people, inquisitive and curious and want to impact lives and livelihoods
Have confidence to establish quality relationships and the ability to identify opportunities

What you'll get in return

Specialist ongoing training and development programs throughout your Hays career
Regular one on one coaching as well as industry expert workshops
Global career opportunities
Internal referral bonus scheme
Flexible working arrangements and additional leave, including wellness and volunteering days
Success celebrations and annual conferences
Health, leisure and lifestyle rewards

What you need to do now
To find out more APPLY NOW or contact Sandy Luhr at sandy.luhr@hays.com.au
At Hays, we value equity, diversity and inclusion and are committed to creating a work environment where all people regardless of background feel a sense of belonging. By joining Hays you'll be part of an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity, recognising every individual for their unique differences. We invite people from all backgrounds to apply.

Name: Customer Enablement Consultant (Planday from Xero)
Description:
Planday from Xero

Planday has recently joined the Xero family! Find out more about that here:
https://www.planday.com/uk/integrations/xero/

At Planday, our vision is to power the global workforce marketplace by connecting people to relevant and meaningful work, and to help businesses build an engaged, high performing and flexible workforce through our shift-scheduling platform. We’re all about meaningful work for customers, users and employees.

What's the role?
We're growing fast and looking for a new colleague to join as Customer Enablement Consultant in ourMelbourne office.
Your main responsibility will be to demonstrate the value of the Planday product to Australian prospects and enable small local customers (1-50 users) to buy and engage with Planday.

You can expect to work with the following:
Steer our beta customers through their first Planday experience
Bring excellent product knowledge to highlight key Planday features and manage customer expectations
Growing and maintaining relationships with new and existing partners in a given territory
Engaging with and developing our new and existing customer accounts
Getting to know our partners’ businesses, creating tailored implementation and training plans for their unique needs.
Building the relationships with new clients to ensure they understand and utilize, the key features and benefits of the Planday platform.
Onboard customers, providing a ‘white-glove’ experience

If you see yourself in some of the points below, we’re excited to learn more about you!
Relevant qualifications or at least 5 year relevant experience
In-depth knowledge of the Planday platform
Solid understanding of our value propositions and how they solve customer business problems
The ability to manage a customer base of SMB businesses, up to 20-30 accounts at one time
Excellent knowledge of internal Customer Success and Product systems, to be able to manage client feedback back into the business (and customer)

Salary range: 75,000 to 80,000 AUD / year

Office location: Suite 4 Level 1, 6-12 Elizabeth Street, Hawthorn VIC 3122
Full time

Apply at https://jobs.lever.co/xero/628c7149-0b26-4f18-9a37-69669de24d7a

Name: Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) Consultant
Description:
The Team

For 45 years, Cundall has continued to evolve to become agents of change for a sustainable world, thought leaders in the built environment and the best place for talent to grow and flourish. Cundall’s sustainability team’s mission is to play a leading role in making the built environment a positive contributor to our social, environmental, and economic needs.
Cundall Johnston & Partners Pty Ltd (Cundall) brings an informed approach to helping businesses respond to increasing legislation, reporting requirements, stakeholder expectations as well as businesses that want to have sustainability principles at their core.
We have been practicing what we preach, and we are the first consultancy to be endorsed as a One Planet Living company and the first to be certified Carbon Neutral. We also have a 2025 Roadmap in order to strategically increase the positive impact we have as sustainable designers and operators of 20 offices globally.
We have established a strong reputation built on providing excellent service and high-quality sustainability solutions. We work closely with clients to create the sustainability strategies they want, ensuring they are always prepared to the highest standards and incorporate creative design solutions.

We recognise that the ESG and decarbonisation imperatives are central to a sustainable future and are committed to supporting our clients and communities in being a driver of the transition. 

If creating net zero carbon pathways, preparing clients for risks from climate change and working closely with organisations to develop and meet their ESG aspirations appeal to you, join us! 

The Role

This is an exciting opportunity for a talented and motivated Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) consultant to join our Cundall Johnston & Partners Pty Ltd in Brisbane. You will be supporting and assisting clients in the preparation of their ESG, sustainability strategy, risk governance, target setting and engagement and green building projects.

You will join a small, friendly, and growing team of ESG sustainability and climate change specialists, which functions as part of a broader national team. We focus on helping organisations look deeper and see further, considering ESG to develop strategies and reports to address their material ESG risks and opportunities.

As part of a national team within our Sustainability team your impact will be seen by:
•	Working closely with clients and engagement teams to report in accordance with a wide range of ESG frameworks and schemes including GRESB, Science Based Targets (SBTi), TCFD, GHG Protocol, Climate Active, NGERS, UN SDGs, etc.
•	Developing an understanding of client operations, strategic objectives and ESG context.
•	Assisting clients in assessing material ESG issues, risk governance and strategy.
•	Assisting with data analysis and synthesis to support our review of client corporate governance practices across companies, councils, government organisations, and asset portfolios.
•	Identifying appropriate objectives, targets, KPIs, and metrics to measure performance.
•	Supporting the organisation to embed ESG strategies and manage associated changes.
•	Building strong relationships with clients.
•	Joining a small and fast-growing team, with opportunities to be part of our growth from early on and be rewarded through career development opportunities.
•	Working on projects across Australia and Asia.


The Skills
•	Tertiary qualification, such as in engineering or environmental sciences, economics, social sciences, law, organisational development.
•	At least 2 years of experience assisting clients in assessing material ESG issues, risk governance and strategy.
•	A proven track record in the preparation and implementation of corporate strategy or transformation projects.
•	Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic team and environment.
•	Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently, effectively resourcing to meet client deadlines.
•	Strong interpersonal and presentation skills.
•	Excellent verbal and written communication skills. 
•	Client liaison and relationship management throughout various stages of a project.
•	Strong technical analytical skills.
•	Highly organised, detail-oriented, and proactive.
•	High proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint
•	Experience providing strategic consulting advice in a professional services environment.

What We Offer
We provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many benefits to ensure your professional development while maintaining a healthy work-life balance such as flexible start and finish times, working from home, diverse and exciting engineering projects, paid parental leave, paid purchase leave, professional memberships, birthday day off, amongst others.

Salary on offer is $85,000 plus superannuation


Cundall values equality and diversity and welcomes applications from candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
Build Teams, Change Lives! If this resonates with you, get in touch with Ivory Group today and explore opportunities to join our growing Sydney team!

ABOUT THE COMPANY.

Established since 2011, Ivory Group is an Award-Winning Recruitment Agency that has been awarded, BRW Fast 100 Australia via AFR, and Best Medium Size Recruitment Agency Australia via Seek SARA. Ivory Group specialises in the sectors of Government, Construction, Architecture and Engineering. Across our offices in Sydney, Canberra and Melbourne, we are known for our high level of customer service, the meticulous care we take in executing our recruitment process, and our ethical business practice. 

ABOUT THE POSITION.

Immediate opportunity for a Recruitment Consultant to join our growing Sydney team with Ivory Group. You will join an established team or recruitment professionals and be responsible for executing the 360 degree recruitment process, liaising with our current portfolio of candidates and clients, as well as continuing to build new industry relationships.

DUTIES.

- Execute the 360 degree recruitment process
- Manage Candidate and Client portfolios
- Business development
- Contractor management
- Permanent and Temp placements

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE.

- Proven experience recruiting within a relevant Ivory Group specialist sector
- Established relationships and networks across your specialist industry
- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
- Ability to work well autonomously, as well as in a collaborative team

CULTURE.

Our team is a positive mix, stemming from veteran recruitment to modern day recruitment styles. Our shared value of collaboration and development supports a motivated and hard working environment, highlighted through our high levels of employee satisfaction and our open plan office. We love what we do and use our occupation to build teams and change lives. Open door policy applies here, no micromanagement with an opportunity to implement your flare and style towards your recruitment desk.

BENEFITS.

- A tailored career development plan
- Generous and uncapped commission structure
- Opportunities to travel and collaborate across Ivory Group offices
- Flexible start and finish times (7:30am to 9am and 4:30pm to 6pm)
- WFH system in place for all employees
- Business mobile and business laptop
- Internal and external training sessions from industry specialists 

HOW TO APPLY.

Click "Apply for this job", or contact Timothy Signo on (02) 9231 4999 for a confidential discussion.

Name: Microsoft Dynamics CRM Consultants
Description:
Permanent full-time roles 
	 Major projects 
	 Brisbane-based 
 

 As Australia’s largest privately owned IT Services Company conducting business Australia wide and in the Asia Pacific region,  Dialog ’s key focus is on delivering outstanding results to its many corporate and government clients using leading tools, technologies and methodologies.  Dialog  is a dynamic organisation which offers attractive career development to its people through diverse projects, training and mentoring in a collaborative atmosphere. 
 
 Dialog  enjoys long-term relationships with Australia’s Peak Government and Corporate organisations. 

 Dialog  requires  Microsoft Dynamics CRM Functionalists and Developers  with demonstrated experience with large and complex development projects using Microsoft Dynamics 365 (CRM) and demonstrated experience of integrating Dynamics 365 (CRM) with other software solutions. 
 
 Dialog  seeks people who have skills and experience in the implementation of enterprise CRM solutions with : 

 
Microsoft Dynamics 365/CRM 2015/2011 
ASP.NET, C#, Web Services, JavaScript, JQuery, CSS/CSS3, XML, XSLT, HTML5, WepAPI, Visual Studio 
Microsoft Dynamics Portals (ADX Studio) and Field Services 
Dynamics CRM custom workflows, plug-in creation, and creation of custom integration solutions with third-party vendors 
Relational databases specifically SQL Server including SSRS and SSIS as well as data migration concepts 
 
Established in 1979,  Dialog  employs over 1,200 people throughout Australia, and provides a wide range of information technology solutions to government and corporate clients. 
 
At  Dialog , our whole approach is based on four key values:  Involved, Committed, Can Do, Always . 
 
It's these values, applied to every project, which stand behind our success and ensure we are always client focused. These same four values underpin the relationship we enjoy with our people. 
 
 Join our team  of professional, enthusiastic and experienced consultants, where communication, learning and knowledge sharing are prized. We offer an excellent benefits package. 
 
 Dialog  is an equal opportunity employer. 
 
Visit our company careers site to apply for this role - https://careers.dialog.com.au/vacancies/ 

 PEOPLE, TECHNOLOGY, RETHINK EVERYTHING

Name: Occupational Therapist - Rehabilitation Consultant
Description:
APM Workcare understands that prevention and proactive management of injuries in the workplace is critically important, and we work with employers and their people to minimise the personal and business impact of injuries, illness and disability through prevention, rehabilitation, and training. 

 The role 

 Working full-time as an Occupational Therapist – Rehabilitation Consultant, you will be using your clinical expertise and skills to support and own your client’s journey as they return to work and return to life after physical or psychological injury. You will influence and guide your clients to achieve the results that they have identified through a whole-of-person approach to rehabilitation. 

 In this role, you’ll be…. 

 
	 Utilise your clinical skills in a variety of ways across icare, CTP, non-comp Corporate and Govt functional education and training and ADLs across multiple schemes 
	 Work collaboratively with CTP insurers on complex injuries, discharge planning and RTW 
	 Using award winning psychosocial risk tools to achieve great RTW outcomes 
	 Providing preventative support to large corporate and Govt customers in the corporate wellbeing space 
	 Spend 50% of your work week out and about meeting medical and treating parties, employers and clients 
 

 What’s in it for you? 

 You will have the FLEXIBILITY and AUTONOMY to set your own hours, your own work location and have control over your own diary. Your focus is on achieving effective outcomes for your clients which can be achieved through teleconference, employer visits, worksite meetings, client visits or over the phone. 

 Joining a COLLEGIATE and SUPPORTIVE team environment, you will be provided with individualised in-house training and development to support you to achieve realistic daily targets. You will step into a strong culture of motivation and drive to reach client goals. 

 You will also have access to cars for travel, a salary ranging from $70,000 to $90,000 + super, an incentive scheme, laptop, mobile phone, the opportunity to purchase additional leave and salary sacrificing. 

 What we are looking for: 

 
	 Professional Registration with AHPRA 
	 Strong client focus and the ability to build relationships with a range of people 
	 A current, or ability to hold a Working with Children Check 
 

 Ready to Join? 

 Click  APPLY  now and complete your application through our online recruitment platform. 

 For a confidential discussion, please call  Ben  on  0477 079 973 

 We're committed to Equality, Diversity and Inclusivity 
We welcome all people to join our team, including people from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities, living with disability, all gender identities, LGBTQIA+, people of any socioeconomic status, of any age, race, national origin or ethnicity. We believe each person’s uniqueness makes us even better at the work we do.

Name: Environmental Consultant
Description:
Why SALT

At SALT we offer rewarding careers, ongoing development opportunities and flexible working arrangements. We place high priority on an enjoyable and engaging work environment offering career development and mentoring as well as social and wellbeing opportunities. SALT provides expert advice to clients in local government, state government and the private sector throughout Australia. You will be working with driven professionals who are passionate, smart, creative, curious and quirky but proud to be part of a company that is dedicated to creating safer, sustainable cities. 

With an uncompromising commitment to customer satisfaction and service, you will be an experienced candidate (minimum 3 years experience) who will manage several projects simultaneously. You will oversee and prepare reports and liaise with local government, state government and the private sector. You will also co-ordinate fee proposals and tenders for both government and private sector projects.

The type of work you will project manage/undertake will include:

Waste Management Plans
Environmentally Sustainable Design (ESD) Reports
Council waste management guidelines and strategies 
Small to large strategic projects, such as Waste Management feasibility studies, master planning and business cases
Operational waste management reviews for commercial developments
Environmental Impact Assessments 
You will join our close-knit team environment at our Queen Street Melbourne office (7-minute walk from Flinders Street station) - hybrid working from home arrangements are also available.

Requirements

Consulting experience in Victoria 
Minimum of 3 years working experience 
Values exceptional client service above all and has an unwavering ability to deliver
Technical experience in waste management 
An understanding of the Victorian development/planning processes, knowledge of the NSW system would be advantageous
Proven project management experience
Ability to develop relationships and identify new business opportunities
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Mentoring capabilities 
Experience in preparing environmental impact assessments for a wide range of development projects is preferred
 

Responsibilities 

Manage small to large projects from beginning to end
Propose waste and ESD solutions to address and prevent negative environmental impacts 
Implement policies and propose design measures in designated parks and other areas to conserve and protect natural and cultural heritage
Participate in the planning of new developments and sites by providing relevant information and recommendations to minimise impacts on plants and wildlife
Advise on best practice waste management and ESD requirements/operations to guide the design and/or modification of developments
Prepare reports for planning application submissions including Waste Management Plans and Sustainable Management Plans
Build a strong profile internally and establish/maintain relationships with current and prospective clients
Advise clients on commercially sound, cost effective and innovative contemporary solutions 
Ensure regular communication with clients 
Mentor and train junior staff members
Tertiary Qualifications

Minimum requirement is a bachelor degree in environmental engineering or science.

Salary will be commensurate based on experience and skill level ($80-$140k).

Name: Executive Recruitment Consultant
Description:
Market Leading Remuneration
Competitive UNCAPPED Commission
Long Term Career Opportunity
Client Details

As a result of continuing growth, FutureYou are looking for highly motivated Recruitment Specialists to be part of an exciting business. With a fantastic centrally located office, we have fostered a unique team orientated culture where success is celebrated and career development opportunities are unlimited.

Description
As a Recruitment Specialist within FutureYou Executive Recruitment, your role will be to manage a portfolio of accounts generating revenue from those accounts as well as all associated activities for the company's clients under the guidance of your manager. You will manage existing relationships as well as being tasked with generating new relationships in order to grow your portfolio, supported by experts who we have hand selected based on their track record and industry knowledge.

Profile
To be considered for this role you will be degree qualified with a proven track record of delivery in a 360 Degree Agency Recruitment environment where you have had to generate revenue from your designated clients. You will be a self-starter who is motivated by success and enjoys working as part of a team and will be looking for a long term career opportunity.

Job Offer
At FutureYou we live and breathe our values and our brand; to support and nurture the very best future for you. To do this, we offer:

A thought-provoking, collaborative and forward thinking culture
Flexibility and diversity
Leading technology solutions

 For more information please contact Corin Roberts on 0457 676 048.

Name: Rehabilitation Consultant - Occupational Therapist
Description:
Altius Group is Australia’s leading allied health provider to workplaces and team members, offering end-to-end support and guidance to those that need help to realise their health potential and to ensure an inclusive and diverse workforce. We employ over 400 health professionals, in 45 different offices nationally and are continuing to grow.  
Our commitment is to be the benchmark in professional health services, whilst giving our team members space for personal growth, opportunities to continue learning and showing real appreciation for their work. 
Our team members love the meaningful work they do (yes we’ve asked!). And our leadership team injects a culture of compassion and understanding into the company which resonates in everything we do. 
In joining our team, you will be welcomed into a caring and nurturing community and work within a supportive team and environment, you’ll also be offered the flexibility you need to balance work /home life. 
If this sounds like an environment where you would thrive, we can’t wait to meet you! 
 
 Your new team: 
 
You will work within a multi-disciplinary team and our number one priority is a team that works well together and supports each other. 
   
The Altius journey continues to be one of growth, opportunity and sustained excellence. We pride ourselves in our work environment that is centred around collaboration and fun. We have fun, we develop each other, and we strive to exceed expectations. 
 
 Your new role: 
 
You will provide holistic support for our clients through relevant assessments (Functional, Activities of Daily Living, Ergonomic and Workplace assessments) and return to work case management of Workers Compensation, Comcare, CTP & Life Insurance referrals, to help restore an individual's highest level of functional performance and deliver a successful return to work. 
   
Your new benefits: 
 
Be warmly welcomed into your new team with a 3-month tailored Induction Program 
Development opportunities to grow across the Group with secondments and transfers across different locations 
Professional Development Support 
Coaching & Mentoring from Industry Leaders and Allied Health Professionals 
Be rewarded with an above market salary package, including a great bonus system 
Latest technology including a Surface Pro and a smart phone 
Flexible Work Arrangements – start early, finish early and work from home 
Genuine support for your personal wellbeing including access to our AltiusLife in-house wellness app, regular wellness seminars, access to Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and the ability to purchase additional leave 
 
About you: 

Full Australian working rights 
 Tertiary qualifications in Occupational Therapy 
 Registration or membership with AHPRA  
 Current driver’s licence and car 
 Genuine interest in working within Occupational Rehabilitation. 
 
 Salary ranges from $60,000 - $90,000 + super 
 
If you have any questions, please contact Emily Norton on 0413 414 597 or connect on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/emily-norton-aa678994/ 
   
Altius Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer and an inclusive workforce. Research has shown that, in Australia, women, people living with disability, LGBTQIA+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, and those from minority groups are less likely to apply for a role because they feel they will not be successful. We believe in the strength of diversity and inclusion, and we would like to strongly encourage those who identify with any of these groups to apply for a role with us.

Name: Senior Recruitment Consultant
