Name: OpenText Senior xECM Consultant
Description:
Chrome Consulting Pty Ltd is Australia’s most dedicated high quality SAP based OpenText ECM Solutions team solving complex customer problems in areas such as Finance and Procurement, Asset Management, Controlled Document Management, Employee Management, Human Resources, EH&S and Mobility across a diverse range of industries.

Due to significant growth in our business, we are looking for a Senior Consultant skills to join our team to provide a high level of expertise and strategy around our SAP OpenText ECM & P2P practices.

About the Role

The SAP OpenText xECM Consultant will use their extensive knowledge of the SAP OpenText xECM product design and implement best-practice Enterprise Content Management (ECM) solutions for Chrome Consulting customers, working closely with them to formulate and document their requirements and to deliver effective and efficient business solutions. 

 

They will provide solution and technical design as well as functional support across multiple projects, leading internal teams by providing expertise in solution designs using SAP applications and Enterprise Content Management solutions. 

 

The successful candidate will be based in NSW or VIC and be expected to work remotely and travel to the client site.
This role is a full-time permanent position that will enable you to lead a variety of Chrome Consulting projects. 

 

About you:

?Bachelor’s degree or Graduate Diploma in Business Information Management Systems or equivalent education or experience

Minimum 10 years’ experience in a customer-facing consulting role within an SAP environment
Excellent understanding of the ECM domain. Experience in developing Information Management Frameworks and Strategies including Information Architecture and business process optimisation will be well-regarded
High-level experience around core aspects of an ECM including the development and implementation of: Core Document Management (BCS/taxonomies, metadata, security model, workflows, user experience, reporting); Records Management (Retention and Disposition Authorities)
Ability to plan for and deliver effective requirements gathering activities and workshops.
Demonstrated practical experience in the implementation of ECM solutions from a business perspective through requirements, design, implementation, change management, data migration, training, support, and ongoing improvement
In-depth practical experience in the following products is required: OpenText Extended ECM (xECM) for SAP; SAP DMS (SAP Document Management System); SAP PM (SAP Plant Maintenance)
Successful candidates are required to contribute to pre-sales planning and Account Management 
This is a customer-facing role, and all consultants are expected to have excellent oral, written and presentation communication skills (English)
Working rights in Australia (Permanent Resident/Citizen)
 

Other facets we would consider advantageous:

Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritise work
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
Highly proactive and results orientated
Understanding of training, change and release management
 

What we offer:

A great working environment with like-minded professionals
Interesting and challenging projects
Competitive salaries
Flexible working arrangements including working from home
Training and growth opportunities

Name: Quantity Surveyor - Consultant
Description:
Global cutting-edge projects, established project delivery services, forensic and quantum claims analysis and so much more are only the beginning at TBH. We are celebrating over 55 years as Australia’s most reputable and largest privately owned project advisory firm with a growing international footprint.

At TBH, our Values are at the centre of everything we do:
•	As industry leaders, we strive for excellence and set the bar high
•	We respect and celebrate our people, family and communities
•	We are better-together by realising the power of diversity
•	Our people are solution-driven and bring fresh perspectives to our clients
•	By being future-focused, we are shaping a better world

TBH invests in the career development of our people and therefore we aim to create a working environment that facilitates flexibility and inclusivity in order to accommodate the different needs of our people, so that they can truly thrive and reach their full potential.

TBH is expanding its Sydney operations and we have an exciting opportunity for a Quantity Surveyor – Consultant to join our team. 

The role will involve conducting forensic investigations to provide and maintain accurate cost estimates and reporting throughout the project lifecycle.

In order to be considered for this position, you will need to demonstrate the following skills and expertise:
•	Quantity Surveyor, Civil, Mechanical or related Engineering Degree; or Degree(s) or tertiary qualification(s) relevant to the services provided by TBH. 
•	Analysing, preparing and implementing construction staging plans
•	Reviewing construction plans and preparing quantity requirements.
•	Preparing pre-construction management plan reports
•	Preparing building construction methodology reports
•	Preparing complex construction programmes
•	Reviewing tenderer submissions for large construction projects
•	Monitoring changes to designs, assessing effects on cost, measuring, estimating and negotiating variations to designs
•	Experience with delay claims and quantum claims analysis
•	Primavera P6 and or MS Project
•	Excellent analytical skills
•	Excellent communication skills including report writing

Visit our website at tbhconsultancy.com to gain insight on the type of work we do and the projects we have worked on.

Application process

We are excited about our continuous growth and invite you to be involved. 

If you are an Australian Citizen or permanent resident, please submit your application via LinkedIn.

TBH is an equal opportunity employer, committed to developing a diverse workforce where individuals are treated with dignity and respect.

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
•	Sydney, Brisbane, and Perth
•	High commission structure
•	Warm desks in multiple verticals including Healthcare and IT

The Role

We are looking for a motivated, self starter who is keen to grow what is now a warm desk and make the most of the opportunity to grow it further. You will be working with experienced industry leaders who can provide support by way of mentoring and practical support to introduce you to many clients and get your portfolio growing as soon as possible. This is a 360 role in either perm or contract recruitment - whichever you prefer, with the opportunity to develop a team around you if that is what you desire. 

Your experience will include:

•	Demonstrated exceptional interpersonal and relationship building skills with a strong customer service orientation in recruitment
•	Knowledge of the sector in which you recruit and we will support you with the local knowledge
•	Proactive and self-motivated to achieve and exceed agreed targets
•	The drive and passion to contribute towards building a high-performance, ethical culture
•	The desire to work with an ambitious team that’s one of the best in the market
The Benefits
•	An industry leading commission structure - they all say that but ours really is! 
•	You will also have the support of a team who have longevity in the Australian market and experience in building highly successful teams
•	Internal training program complimented using the industry’s best external trainers
•	A friendly office full of like minded recruiters who enjoy working hard, achieving goals, and supporting each other to reach theirs’
•	Useful recruitment tools and technologies

Our Business is privately owned with two decades success in delivering quality services around Australia, New Zealand and Asia. We have dedicated teams responsible for a range of industries. 
AustCorp works across Executive and Board level recruitment, Professional recruitment, Contract, Permanent and Temporary and Skilled labour hire in diverse industries including Medical Devices and Healthcare, FM & CRE, Industrial & Manufacturing ,Engineering & Construction and IT&C. 
If you’re looking to be part of a business where your contribution is acknowledged and rewarded, then now is the time to join us. Apply now!

Name: Field Development Consultant (Education)
Description:
Support learning centre's, specializing in after school math and reading programs for students | Hybrid WFH  Your new company This global private tutoring organisation caters for students from primary and secondary age groups. They are an international brand with a long-standing record of success and an established educational methodology that allows students to build confidence and solve problems on their own. This role offers a hybrid work arrangement with the organisations office in South Melbourne.  Your new role As an Educational Field Consultant you will be responsible for providing support to franchise operators in the delivery of high quality educational outcomes for students. You will provide both educational and operational support ensuring both the business success and students' educational success. Full job description will be provided prior to interview.  What you'll need to succeed To succeed in this role you will: 

You will have strong Mathematics and/or English literacy skills, allowing you to support tutors right up to advanced high school levels in English and/or Mathematics. Qualifications or experience in Education is highly desirable however qualification backgrounds in marketing, business, commerce, or training could also be applicable.
Hold a full driving license and your own car as this role requires you to visit franchise operators across Melbourne.
Have excellent relationship development skills, forming strong and influential relationships with franchise owners.
Enjoy solving problems and challenges, analysis of business and educational outcomes.
Engage effectively with a wide range of stakeholders including children, teachers, tutors, prospective students and families/parents.
Be a consultative communicator with a strong commercial acumen and a passion for education and impacting on young lives.
Be a collaborative team player that can effectively share ideas, solutions and challenges with a team of field development consultants.
Work with franchise operators on strategies to rebuild enrolment numbers impacted by the COVID pandemic of the last 2 years.

  What you'll get in return You will get training and the opportunity to work as part of a collaborative team of consultants, sharing ideas, and resolutions to issues faced by students and franchise operators. This is a permanent full time commencing ASAP. There are also excellent benefits in place to support professional development and academic learning of relevance. You will enjoy working for this international company because of their excellent values and commitment to quality educational outcomes. This role offers a hybrid working model allowing some flexible to work from home 2 or 3 days per week with fixed team days in the office to allow for collaboration, support, strategy and training. Mileage, registration and insurance subsidies, tolls and parking costs are covered in addition to salary and bonus incentive.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call Gerard Murphy on (03) 8346 7071. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.  SA Licence number : LHS 297508Please click here to apply.

Name: Senior Consultant - Data Intelligence
Description:
Dynamic organisation with exciting new projects 
	 Full Time Permanent opportunity 
 

 As Australia’s largest privately owned IT Services Company conducting business Australia wide,  Dialog ’s key focus is on delivering outstanding results to its many corporate and government clients using leading tools, technologies, and methodologies.  Dialog  is a dynamic organisation which offers attractive career development to its people through diverse projects, training and mentoring in a collaborative atmosphere. 

 As a  Dialog  consultant engaging with these clients, you will: 

 
	 Work with key stakeholders to achieve world’s best practice processes in major projects 
	 Work with colleagues in partnership with clients who are committed to achieving their business objectives 
	 Enjoy salary above industry standard in a working environment in which effort, creativity and a positive attitude are highly valued 
	 Have extensive training opportunities through the Dialog Academy, which offers a wide range of ICT and Business skills courses 
 

 Dialog  requires a  Senior Consultant – Data Intelligence  with the following professional experience: 

 
	 Undertake client engagements by providing expert advice in the field of Data Management and Analytics 
	 Lead client engagements by providing expert advice in the field of Data Management and Analytics 
	 Data management, security, and quality, data analytics, reporting and diagnostic practices. 
	 Proven track record of turning operational data into outcomes that drive business opportunity (additional profit or contained costs) 
	 Data warehouse and data lake solutions 
	 Management of best-practice solutions and advisory services in Data Governance, Data Quality and Master Data Management. 
	 All phases of the project lifecycle – from scoping and planning, requirements, design, development, testing and deployment. 
	 Project management methodologies, including Agile 
	 Data integration with a range of data sources and tools to extract, transform and load data (SSIS, Informatica, SAP Data Services) 
	 Demonstrated application of best practice principles utilising current professional knowledge 
	 Demonstrated ability to deliver new capability to a business or client that makes economical business sense 
 

 Tasks and Responsibilities 

 
	 Data solution Architecture design & review 
	 Data Storage design & Data Warehousing

	 Data Governance and Master Data Management 
	 Data Integration & migration 
	 Data Quality Management

  Visit our website  www.dialog.com.au  for more information. 

  Please use the following link to apply:  Vacancies - Dialog Information Technology 

 PEOPLE, TECHNOLOGY, RETHINK EVERYTHING

Name: Senior Recruitment Consultant
Description:
Fast paced, digitally focused and seriously the best environment around 

 Recruitment role specialising in digital. 

 $80000 - $90 000 plus Super plus Comms plus an $8000 annual learning fund and many other cool benefits 

 
	 A warm hybrid desk is not something we ever talk about, but after seven years our very talented senior recruiter is leaving for new beginnings 
 

 
	 Rich in both perm and temp opportunities with existing clients and Talent relationships this role needs someone with passion, drive and charisma to ensure it will not only reach but exceed its full potential… (the desk has billed well over $600 000) 
 

   

 ·      Work-Life balance with mostly work from home 

 ·      Additional annual leave, birthday leave and a host of special benefits. 

 ·      $8000 EMPLOYEE LEARNING FUND to use on your career growth. 

 ·      Our culture is one of the best around - Just ask any of our employees! 

 ·      Competitive remuneration with a very lucrative uncapped bonus plan 

   

 Aquent is a cutting-edge and innovative worldwide recruitment leader specialising in Marketing, Creative and Digital recruitment. We exist to place talented specialists in permanent and temporary roles they love, and to help companies find, attract and retain the most outstanding talent in the marketplace. We know there’s nothing more important than a healthy, inspiring workplace, which is why we focus on teamwork, culture, personal development and continual growth. We walk the talk when it comes to our four values: We Before me; Make it matter; Own it; and Keep growing. It’s our DNA and our footprint. 

 Based in our Melbourne office, you will work closely with an experienced team, responsible for juggling both Talent and Client management, sourcing, building a key network of awesome talent and clients, interviewing and proactively taking Talent to market to generate new job opportunities. Thriving on client meetings and introducing yourself to warm clients, you will manage the full recruitment cycle on behalf of your clients. 

 We need someone who is passionate about the digital industry, specifically digital creative as well as having the sales skills, essential in growing market share. You will have the opportunity to develop a thorough understanding of our areas of specialisation through extensive internal training. 

 Collaborative, positive, self motivated and tenacious are some words used to describe yourself. Mostly you are customer focussed, self aware and healthy dose of grit!  

 Interested in a confidential chat? Please email Jen Gottlieb, HR Director, Aquent on jgottlieb aquent.com or text/call her your name on 0411 721 383 and she will return your message 

   

 For more information about Aquent Careers 

 https://aquentcareers.com.au/ 

 https://aquent.com.au/

Name: Technical Software Engineer Consultant
Description:
About Our Business:

Quest Construction Software is a well-established firm dedicated to construction industry software’s since 2002, located in Mornington Victoria. We are authorized resellers of the Vista ERP system (Trimble), ProEst estimating software (Autodesk), Powerproject (Elecosoft UK), and much more construction-related software. Quest offers a complete range of solutions which includes implementation, technical services, management, and optimising the solution using the best industry practices. With over 20 years of combined experience, Quest has been assisting clients within Australia and New Zealand construction industries.

We are currently offering a permanent position for a technical software engineer consultant who has proven industry work experience.

Whilst it is our preference to employ from the local labour market, we will consider applicants already in Australia who hold a visa with work rights. We will also provide a pathway to permanent residency for the right applicants.

Key Responsibilities:

· Deliver major technological enhancements to the Vista ERP system by designing, coding, testing, and delivering SQL scripts that meet the requirements.

· Technical Leadership to Integrate ERP systems with other construction industry applications.

· BI, Crystal, and SSR business reports development using SQL server report builder and Power BI

· Working with clients and business analysts to provide a technical perspective on product decisions.

· Demonstrating and presenting to internal and external stakeholders.

· You will be contributing to a collaborative, inclusive, open, and safe culture.

About Candidate:

A qualified full-time technical software engineer consultant holding at least a bachelor’s degree qualification. Duties to be performed (but not limited to) are as below:

· Excellent understanding of Microsoft SQL servers including stored procedures, SQL trigger, views, etc/, Must be able to write complex data queries

· Build and support the integration of Vista (ERP) system using SQL programming language

· Knowledge of software development tools like Visual Basics

· Hands-on experience with C# programming language for integrated products.

· Experience with Power-BI reports

· Basic knowledge of Windows Servers

· Software consultation knowledge would be a bonus

· API knowledge to support third-party integrations around Vista and other construction software

· Testing and evaluation of new programs

· Analyse information to identify areas of modification

· Ability to closely work with clients and understand the requirements

· Writing and implementation of efficient tools

· Deploy software tools and processes

· Researching, design, and implementation of integration solutions

Benefits and perks

· Family-friendly team which focuses on healthy work-life balance

· Flexible working environment with options to work from home if required

· Opportunities to learn and upskill your knowledge in the construction and software industry

· Social team gatherings

· Multicultural environment

· Internal collaboration tools to interact and work within teams

Name: Axiom Consultant
Description:
Project Description
Migration of EFS Axiom version from V9 to V10 for an Australian Bank. Includes migration of APRA EFS reports/MS reports.

Responsibilities
Role expectation is to work on the technical aspect of the project, perform coding, UT, SIT, UAT, OAT, SAT Etc.
a) Coding and Unit Testing in Axiom application.
b) Working with Business and technology stakeholders, supporting SIT, UAT and Production implementation.
c) Support the production rollout and help support team during warranty.
d) Develop application (source code) based on specifications
e) Debug/modify the source code based on specifications
f) Provide inputs to the documentation team and review the changes in the user manuals for accuracy.
g) Performs thorough and comprehensive peer reviews on the output of other team members in a way that identifies to the maximum extent possible issues/errors in the output.
h) Provide support during high Severity and production DR process
i) Ensure SDLC process compliance

Skills
Must have

Knowledge and Skills Required:
a) At least 8 Years of overall experience in Finance industry out of which minimum 4 years in Axiom Controller View
b) Good understanding of axiom objects / functionalities - Data Sources, Data Models, Shorthand's, Portfolios, Aggregations, Fee Form, Tabular Report, workflow, sign-off, freezing etc.
c) Good exposure to taxonomy
d) Exposure to APRA EFS reports preferred
e) Strong knowledge of SQL, understanding of relational data modelling
f) Experience with any major relational database (Oracle, MSSQL, MySQL, SYBASE)
g) Familiarity with Linux, shell scripting
h) Good understanding and experience in client-server applications development
i) Good understanding of OOP and design patterns
j) Familiarity with Agile process

Nice to have

Capital Markets experience

Name: Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
The Company

Tridant Pty Ltd is one of Australia’s largest specialist consulting firms focused on designing and implementing Data solutions that create competitive advantage, across Information Management, Business Intelligence, Data Visualisation, Financial Performance Management, Data Science, and AI lenses, for a range of organisations across both public and private sectors. Tridant partners with multiple market leading technology vendors to deliver the best solution to our clients, along with embracing the benefits of Open Source.

Tridant's expertise spans several market sectors including but not limited to: Financial Services, Mining, Pharmaceuticals, Manufacturing & Distribution, Retail, Education, Media & Entertainment, Oil and Gas, Government, and Communications. Our collegiate culture sets us apart from others in our industry, as does the diversity, inclusiveness, and quality of our people.

Since our founding in 2007, Tridant has earned an enviable reputation for delivering some of the largest and most successful Data and Analytics projects in Asia Pacific.


The Role

Tridant is seeking an energetic Data Analytics Consultant to fill a full-time role within our Data and Analytics team. This is a hybrid work arrangement where work will be undertaken both from home and our modern offices across the country including Sydney CBD and/or Melbourne CBD offices.

This is an excellent opportunity to work with the team to take our vast range of client organisations further up the Data and Analytics maturity ladder. 

This role will be responsible for employing industry best practice project methodologies to achieve project success as agreed with customers; technical, functional, and business outcomes of a project, and maintaining high standards of professional communication. 

Accountabilities include, but are not limited to:
•	Working in conjunction with internal senior stakeholders in new and existing client opportunities.
•	Work within a team environment, as well as independently depending on the nature of the client engagement.
•	Participate in workshops with client business and technical stakeholders.
•	Participate in defining the solution scope, timelines, and risk by translating business requirements into a set of functional and non-functional deliverables.
•	Evaluate, train, and certify in new and emerging technologies.
•	Manage stakeholder expectations.
•	Communicate with stakeholders, business, and technical project teams to ensure the roles and responsibilities for the solution delivered are understood.


Desired Skills and Experience

Essential

• Greater than 3 years’ experience in implementing at least 2 of the leading data foundation, visualisation, and reporting platforms such as PowerBI, Tableau, SQL Server/Azure, or Snowflake. 
• Be able to show evidence of certification in the Microsoft Power Platform. 
• Development experience in Power Apps or Power Automate.
• Capable SQL skills for data manipulation and wrangling. 
• An eye for and skill in developing aesthetically pleasing dashboard and report designs. 
• Minimum education level of bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant domain – Mathematics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, IT, or Statistics. 
• Relevant Enterprise experience.
• Proven experience and history in the design and development of solutions using project management methodologies.
• A genuine talent for grasping complex business problems and engineering effective solutions.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
• Team player with a professional, pro-active approach.

Highly Regarded

• Masters in information technology specialising in Data Analytics.
• Certified credentials in Tableau, Qlik, Cognos, Snowflake, Microsoft Azure, or AWS.
• Experience working under Agile methodologies.
• Well-developed skills/ability researching, designing, and implementing customer solutions and programs.
• Strong relationship management.
• Ability to identify opportunities and taking action to help achieve business goals.
• Ability to identify process improvement opportunities.
• An interest in the productisation of solution ideas.
• Awareness of Diversity and Inclusiveness principles.

Why Tridant

Our company offers a unique culture second to none; our ethos is that we are professional, but we make work an enjoyable experience. Tridant offer a collegiate team environment that embraces diversity and allows our staff the opportunity to gain experience independently in a supportive environment. 

Our team are offered a flexible working environment, ongoing learning, and development opportunities, as well as access to an Employee Assistance Program.

What makes Tridant different? Our culture; our people; access to the leadership team; and the ability to make an impact. 

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a reputable, fast-growing company where there is a wealth of opportunity for the right candidate. 

Salary range for this role is $70,000 - $80,000 (plus Super) commensurate with experience and includes other employment benefits such as on-site gym and excellent end-of-trip facilities.

For further information on Tridant, please see our website www.tridant.com.

If you fill the required selection criteria and hold appropriate work rights, we invite you to apply for this role*. 

*Recruitment agency contact is not welcome

What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating many opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative, and successful. Moreover, this is your chance to be part of the success story.

Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Name: Senior Engineering Manager - Security Development
Description:
Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.

With a sufficient timezone overlap with the team, we're able to hire eligible candidates for this role from any location in Australia and New Zealand. If this sparks your interest, apply today and chat with our friendly Recruitment team further.

We're looking for an experienced Senior Engineering Manager to lead a group of teams in our new Security Development team within the Sydney timezone. This team is responsible for building and operating mature software systems to improve the entire company's security posture. You'll also use your analytical skills to make sure we're solving the right problems, partnering with technical, design, and product leaders to influence the direction and plan the steps to get there.

You're a leader of leaders, coaching engineering managers and architects that report to you, supporting them in their professional development to unlock their potential, and encouraging them to step outside their comfort zone to grow and excel. You'll also play a critical role in the org's leadership team, working with other engineering managers, architects, product managers, and program managers to steer the organisation by contributing to the strategy and helping determine the right problems for the teams to invest in solving.

On your first day, we'll expect you to have:
- Experience managing & growing engineering managers and technical leaders
- A passion for driving cultural change in technical excellence, quality and efficiency
- Experience supporting teams in driving large projects with complex dependencies and multiple stakeholders
- A drive for operational excellence and experience with teams responsible for running mission-critical production services
- Familiarity with agile software development methodologies and engineering experience, not necessarily writing code

Experience in the following is preferred:
- Familiarity with security systems
- Strong understanding of how to use metrics to guide technical decisions
- A demonstrated ability to foster an innovation culture in your teams
- Experience balancing Ops and Development investment

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. To learn more about our culture and hiring process, explore our Candidate Resource Hub: https://www.atlassian.com/company/careers/resources.

Name: Clinical Nurse Consultant - Apheresis
Description: Outstanding candidates are encouraged to apply for positions now open at Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre – a place where our normal days are extraordinary; as are the people we care for. Peter Mac is one of a handful of integrated cancer research, education and treatment centres in the world. Each day our team strives to provide the very best in cancer care, even better treatments and potential cancer cures for all people affected by cancer. Globally, we are facing one of the most pivotal times in the pursuit of cancer cures, and Peter Mac stands at its forefront. Together, we aim to lead a new era of cancer prevention, care and discovery, supported by state-of-the-art facilities at our new home within the Victorian Comprehensive Cancer Centre building. Your role in our future. We are seeking a highly motivated nurse to join the Apheresis team as a clinical nurse consultant. The primary purpose of this position is to be accountable for the provision of evidence based clinical nursing care of Haematology/Oncology patients in apheresis, act as an expert clinical resource for precinct staff and external clients and provide visible clinical leadership across the Parkville precinct. The role will lead, support and ensure evidence based nursing care that meets professional, organisational, legal and ethical standards in order to optimise health outcomes for patients and their families. This position also liaises between clinical areas in a multidisciplinary framework, plays a pivotal role in supporting Quality Assurance programs and in developing and delivering clinical research and commercial outcomes in conjunction with commercial partners. The position will hold an education and project portfolio that will be developed with the apheresis leadership team and is in accordance with the haematology and apheresis service delivery plan. This is an ongoing position 1.0 EFT (80.00 hours per fortnight). Successful Applicants will possess: Division 1 Nurse Registration with a minimum of 5 years’ acute oncology experience predominantly in Apheresis/Haematology Expertise in a broad range of apheresis procedures Post Graduate Qualifications in a specialty nursing field Evidence of commitment to evidence based practice and ongoing quality improvement in oncology/haematology nursing Proven clinical leadership and experience relevant to the role Excellent communication, interpersonal and team building skills Experience in GMP, FACT or NATA quality systems For further information about this opportunity, please review the position description or contact us for a confidential discussion. Peter Mac requires its staff to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please contact us if you would like to discuss this requirement. Salary Remuneration in line with Nurses and Midwives (Victorian Public Sector) (Single Interest Employers) Enterprise Agreement 2020-2024. Classification: ZJ4 $110,333.60 Why work for Peter Mac: Peter Mac offer a range of benefits which support our people both personally and professionally. Our staff benefits include award winning facilities, professional development and events, a health and wellbeing program, flexible work practices and policies and financial benefits such as salary packaging. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, all members of the LGBTQI community and people with a disability. For further information about this opportunity, and to apply, please visit the Peter Mac Recruitment Site https://petermac.mercury.com.au/ViewPosition.aspx?id=tv840OT2BAU=&jbc=ere

Name: Recruitment Consultant (Entry Level)
Description:
Seeking someone that can join a fast paced role, and hit the ground running immediately. 

Your role will comprise of:
 - Seeking candidates
 - Matching candidates with suitable roles
 - Assisting the placements team 
 - General Admin
 - Build client relationships

Some of your skills:
 * Rapport building

 * Excellent communication skills
 * Team work

Benefits 
 - Paid day off on your birthday
 - Leading company
 - Career progression 
 - WFH 3 days a week
 - Uncapped Commission!! 


Experience is not necessary as full training will be provided. 
We will only be contacting shortlisted candidates.

Name: Security Specialist
Description:
Responsibilities:

-Act as an interface between Business and Technology to ensure that desired outcomes are achieved
-Consult to Projects to formulate and execute plans for business analysis, functional design, quality assurance and/or problem-solving activities.
-Facilitating workshops with key stakeholders (Project Sponsors, Product Owner, Architects, Developers, other divisions) to elaborate and align on business requirements
-Providing input throughout the delivery lifecycle – documenting requirements as they evolve, including contributing to design and ensuring adequate test case coverage and execution. 
-Ad-hoc production support (typically within normal working hours)

Skills & Experience

-Experience and understanding of Cyber Security technologies, including Identity and Access Management, Security Operations Centre, security standards and processes.
-Strong ability to communicate and represent the project across multiple and varied stakeholder’s groups
-Ideally a background in Operational Technology or experience within Cyber Security domain
-Solid experience working on large and complex projects
-Experience facilitating workshops and focus groups
-Strong stakeholder engagement skills, communication and listening skills
-Ability to work with challenging stakeholders and coordinate multiple resources inc. technical and business resources aligned to project timelines
-Experience developing instructional and procedural documentation and presentations
Competent influencing and negotiating skills, coupled with strong self-motivation, drive and initiative
-Proven ability to produce, consult and follow through on components of implementation plans
-Prior experience working in financial services is highly desirable
-Prior experience working on an RBAC project is highly desirable
-Prior experience working under an agile methodology

Location: Melbourne
Permanent Full time position

Name: Senior Consultant / Manager - Corporate Tax
Description:
What are you looking for from your next employer?

Diversity - At BDO this isn’t just a buzz word! We embrace the diverse world that we live in with our workforce reflecting the clients we service throughout the world we encourage our staff members to bring their true self to work each and every day. This was capped by being named an Inclusive Employer for 2021-2022 by Diversity Council Australia (DCA).
Professional development - BDO offers genuine professional development with our market leading RISE program, local technical training, professional study support, on the job coaching and mentoring.
Flexibility - At BDO we have embraced the new working life with hybrid Working from Home (WFH), safety checklist for all WFH enviro, annual allowance for home office upgrades, as well as other Flexible working options including part-time, compressed hours and home-based work and are available to ALL staff based on individual and firm needs.
Extra Leave - At BDO we offer extra annual, personal, carers, compassionate, parental – primary and secondary carers, long service with the ability to purchase even more leave
Care - Above all else BDO cares about you! We offer discounted gym membership & health insurance, wellbeing workshops, group fitness classes, active social club, workplace giving, daily breakfast and fresh fruit and an inclusive culture where you can bring your true self to work.
Your new opportunity

If you’re looking for an opportunity to make your mark in the Corporate & International Tax field we have opportunities available in our Sydney team for experienced senior consultants or new managers. As part of one of the largest and most dynamic tax practices in Australia, we offer you extensive resources and wide-ranging diversity in your role with the ongoing training, development and mentoring you need to excel. We offer hybrid working arrangements, a modern office in the CBD and monthly social activities to help you get to know your team and stay connected.

You’ll be part of a collaborative team who take a holistic approach to tax advisory, covering all aspects of the Australian and international tax spectrum. You’ll provide advisory and compliance services to our clients ranging from medium sized clients to household multinational brand names.

Ideally you’ll have:

Minimum 2 years corporate tax experience in a mid-tier or Big 4 environment for senior consultant
Minimum 4 years corporate tax experience in a mid-tier or Big 4 environment for Manager
Tertiary qualification in Commerce or Accounting
Strong commitment to quality service and client relationships
Solid research, writing and analytical skills with interest to develop these further
Excellent interpersonal skills
Experience coaching and mentoring junior staff
What we will offer you

BDO offers professional development, collaborative culture, workplace flexibility, global career growth opportunities and an industry-competitive salary package (minimum starting salary for Senior Consultant is $85,000 inclusive of superannuation - subject to level of experience).

We are committed to building your technical, advisory, leadership, and management skills, and balance work with promoting health, wellbeing, workplace giving and social activities. At BDO, we want you to enjoy what you do and the community of colleagues and clients you work with.

As a firm, we embrace an inclusive culture and value the difference and unique perspective of every individual. We are proud to be named an Inclusive Employer for 2019-2020 by Diversity Council Australia (DCA).

IDEAS | PEOPLE | TRUST

#BDOCareers
www.bdo.com.au/careers

To apply visit the BDO Careers Page to submit your application.

Name: Senior Consultant - Digital Forensics & Incident Response
Description:
With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)

 

What will you create?

 

You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.

 

Cybersecurity & Digital Trust builds trust in Australian organisations by securing their digital future and developing the nation's leading cybersecurity workforce.

 

As a Senior Consultant in our Defensive Security team your impact will be seen by:

Conducting cyber detection and response including incident response, threat intelligence, hunting and security monitoring

Developing cyber intelligence assessments and briefs for both technical and business stakeholders

Developing internal tools and procedures to contribute to the team’s knowledge base;

Reporting and presenting to both technical and business stakeholders

 

About you

 

You have a background in cyber security with experience in incident response, threat intelligence, threat hunting, or security operations and are able to independently manage engagement delivery. You have a strong grasp of technical/business writing and have the ability to train and mentor junior members. As a bonus, you may hold security related certifications such as CISSP, CISM, ITIL or GIAC. You may also hold relevant vendor certifications. 

Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Consulting team deliver practical advice that speaks straight to the heart of client business issues and deliver innovative results.

 

You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.

 

Life at PwC 

 

Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together. 

 

We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.

 

We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well. 

Paul Bui is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all. 

 Location: Flexible (any major city)

We welcome the opportunity to speak to candidates about our value proposition and recognition and reward approach. The minimum full time salary for this role is $77,000.00 including 10% Superannuation, however will be determined based on the skills and experience that the candidate brings.

#LI-PWCLMT

PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.

PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html

Name: Recruitment Consultant - Melbourne & Sydney
Description:
Salary commensurate with experience 
	 25 Days Annual Leave 
	 Comprehensive Incentives & Rewards 
	 $80,000 + Super 
 

   

 Founded in 2003, Charterhouse Recruitment is a privately held, growth-based Recruitment Consultancy, head office in Sydney and with offices globally. Our business is people focused; internally and externally and this shows in all that we do and all that we say.? Our philosophy is based on the premium we place on human interaction and deep seeded belief that we should be putting people over placements; always.? This credo matters; and we’re now looking for people to join us who legitimately share this belief system; who place a premium on discretionary effort and who have a genuine desire to apply their skills in an environment that rewards those who look to learn and better themselves. 

 Our recruiters invariably come from two distinct avenues.? You will either be an accomplished recruiter already or you will be an industry professional who is looking to apply your career learnings to date within a career choice like recruitment.? We have opportunities in each of our teams; IT, Accounting & Finance, Legal, Sales & Marketing, Strategy & Policy and Government.? At your disposal will be a full support network to assist you in your day-to-day; a comprehensive L&D framework that is geared to developing your recruitment skills and your broader business skills? 
You will have access to a strong candidate, and client network and you will be able to leverage a strong brand to enable you to do your job to the best of your ability. 

 Ideally you will: 

 
	 Have at least 2 years recruitment experience OR have worked within the industry that you wish to recruit in to. 
	 Be highly emotionally intelligent 
	 Be naturally communicative and engaging; able to bring the best out in those with whom you interact. 
	 Be comfortable operating in agile environments where your priorities can constantly shift and alter course. 
	 Be highly organised; placing a premium on methodology and workflows to help manage the high degree of ambiguity that can exist in this role. 
	 Thrive when required to problem solve. 
 

 In return, you will: 

 
	 Benefit from a rigorous internal and external learning regiment that is focused on “making you a better you”. 
	 Enjoy 25 Days Annual Leave 
	 Enjoy Workplace Flexibility that is meaningful and considered 
	 Enjoy our comprehensive array of reward and recognition incentives that we invest in to help drive behaviours and outcomes. 
	 Enjoy a clear progression path with clear milestones that removes ambiguity and rewards meritocratically. 
 

   

 To hear more about the opportunities at Charterhouse please send your resume and covering letter to Amber Bedford.

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
$75-85k + Super 
	 New office launch in Brisbane 
	 Market leading commission scheme and unrivalled career progression 
 

   

 About Us 

 Founded in 2003, Charterhouse Recruitment are proudly one of Australia’s largest and most reputable privately-owned recruitment companies and we are looking for an ambitious recruiter to help launch our Brisbane office. 

 You'll be working in a "start-up" environment while having the backing of a highly successful company, so you get the best of both worlds! 

 You’ll be joining a company that value people, diversity and opportunity. We are passionate about building a company that is recognised for excellence and quality. Our leadership team across Sydney and Melbourne has over 170 years’ experience collectively, so you’re in good hands to help take your career to the next level. 

 What else? Oh, I forgot to mention that we're also one of the Top 20 best places to work in Australia... 

 https://greatplacetowork.com.au/gptwcertified/charterhouse/ 
(https://greatplacetowork.com.au/gptwcertified/charterhouse/) 

   

 About the Role 

 This year Charterhouse are lunching our Brisbane office and we’re looking for talented and career minded Recruiters to help us grow the business and office. 

 You won’t be stepping on any toes, so you can recruit in any corner of the market for any clients that you like. Not to mention, you will have a clear career path through to management and beyond. 

 This opportunity is perfect for someone with a couple of years’ experience, who is looking to step out from under a manager or for someone who wants to recruit in a more lucrative patch. 

 Duties will include, but not be limited to: 

 
	 Full 360 recruitment for your own desk 
	 Business Development and client management – Dealing with your portfolio of clients 
	 across your industry to better understand their business/hiring needs to create business 
	 opportunities. Clients will include a mixture existing PSA accounts and new business 
	 development/cold calling. 
	 Arrange and attend client meetings, both new and existing relationships including regular 
	 contact and follow up opportunities. 
	 Attend training sessions, BD/industry meetings to share intel, one to one’s and reviews. 
	 Ad-hoc projects just as CRM/tech reviews, input into office design and culture changing ideas, website updates and general marketing activities. 
 

   

 About You 

 To succeed in this job, you will either be an established Recruiter with a track record of billing who is looking to join a high growth office. 
In addition, you should also have the following skills/experience: 

 
	 Strong interpersonal skills and be willing to contribute ideas to your peers and business 
	 leaders. 
	 At least 24 months recruitment experience and a proven billing track record. 
	 Australian Citizen or Permanent resident preferred. 482 visa transfer is an option. 
 

   

 Culture & Benefits 

 
	 26 days annual leave 
	 Market leading commission structure designed to help you earn sooner and more often. 
	 Flexible working, including working from home and flexi-hours. 
	 Corporate Dental care discounts and discounted gym memberships including F45. 
	 No internal competition – no split desks or geographical restrictions 
	 Client & Candidate care is important to us – take them for coffee, brekky, lunch, or dinner, on us. 
 

 To apply please send your CV to adam charterhouse.com.au

Name: Cloud and Security Analyst
Description:
About the role

Reporting to the Head of Technology Services, this role is required to advise our customer on their transformational journey. 

Roles & Responsibilities
•	As a customer facing analyst you will be required to advise our customers, as your clients, on transformational journey’s whilst following the guidance of your Senior Consultant team members
•	Work with customers to review & progress open customer issues when required
•	Self-manage personal workload balanced against customer service level expectations, timelines and business impact
•	Equip yourself and maintain up to date working knowledge of the technology services being delivered by SoftwareONE
•	Partner with SoftwareONE Technology Services team member consultants, especially, but not limited to, Security
•	Provide technical advisory services. Providing skills transfer and customer readiness through the remote delivery of workshops, hands on technical, and documentation.
•	Relay customer needs and requirements back to your SoftwareONE team colleagues for future Service and Solution development
•	Demonstrate an ongoing commitment to learn and develop in line with the SoftwareONE Technology Services strategic direction
•	Intentionally apply base qualification with your creative thinking while contributing to the SoftwareONE entrepreneurial culture
•	Deliver excellent customer service skills. Able to confidently lead conversations, demonstrate empathy, set appropriate expectations, and handle workload with the needs of the customer in mind
•	Invest in learning and developing to ensure able to upskill on new solutions (including SoftwareONE developed, new Microsoft functions and solution and third party software such as SAP and Oracle to be able to perform workload migration)

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
•	At least or In pursuit of a Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering required from an accredited institution
•	Excellent and confident interpersonal and communication skills (both written and oral) to enable effective management of customer expectations in a professional, methodical and mature manner.
•	Excellent problem-solving skills, including attention to detail, a pragmatic approach and the ability to identify multiple options and recommend preferred solutions
•	Goal-oriented, with perseverance and drive – possessing the determination to see investigations through to successful completion
•	Ensure Information Security best practice is followed, and work is compliant with internal and external audit and regulatory requirements
•	Understanding of network dependencies, implications & requirements needed for all Cloud services
•	Working knowledge of LAN/WAN protocols & services i.e.: TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, WINS
•	Understanding of ITIL framework
•	With a passion for technology you will have ability to learn new technical skills, in particular knowledge of Microsoft Cloud (O365 & Azure/Security), including but not limited to:
o Exchange Server (2010, or 2013, 2016) and Exchange Online
o OneDrive for Business/Office 365 Groups/SharePoint Online
o Microsoft Teams
o Enterprise Mobility and Security
o Azure Active Directory including identity synchronisation
o Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS)
o PowerShell Scripting / Graph API
o Azure IAAS and PAAS
o Office365 Design and Implementation Projects
o Single Sign On
o Security Center, OMS and Log Analytics
o Active Directory Domain Services (ADDS) and AD Connect / DirSync Services
o Wintel Server, Clustering and Active Directory Certificate Services (ADCS)

Name: Contact Centre Consultant
Description:
Join a B Corp certified Bank in their customer contact centre. Supporting customers, there is room for career growth. Multiple locations in Victoria, including Collingwood and Moe with a hybrid model and flexible work arrangements.  Do you want to create positive impact for people and the planet? Then this company and role is for you. No contact centre experience is needed. We are looking for candidates that are value driven with customer service experience and a can-do attitude.  You will: 

Be responsible for handling inbound enquiries and transactions as well as outbound follow-up activity
Communicating the brand and value proposition
Fully understand the customers' needs
Offering our products range where relevant

You will have: 

The demonstrated ability to cross sell products
Above all, a passion for customer service and a strong phone manner
Knowledge of lending legalisation highly regarded but not a requirement to apply
Time management and organisational skills
Ability to work in a team and solo
Professional presentation and attitude
Empathy and above average listening skills
PC literacy

This is an exciting opportunity for career growth and to work with a brand that aligns with your values. To find out more and kick start your career apply now or call Kate Butt on 0419 755 433 today  
At HOBAN we embrace diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity. We welcome and encourage applications from people from all backgrounds.
We provide reasonable adjustments; including alternate formats to the recruitment process for individuals with disability. If you require an adjustment to be made during the recruitment process, please email adjustments@hoban.com.au or visit hoban.com.au/adjustments.Please click here to apply.

Name: Senior UX Design Consultant
Description:
At Insight, our mission is that every employee is recognised and valued as their whole self and that our globally diverse and multicultural clients, partners and communities are reflected within Insight. As an equal opportunity employer, diversity, inclusion, and belonging will continue to be a particular focus in 2022.

We are looking for an ambitious and self-driven user-experience (UX) designer to join our Strategy & Design team. As an analytical and creative designer, you will be required to grasp user needs and solve problems to enhance the user experience of the solutions we deliver to our clients. You will need to understand business requirements and any technical limitations and be responsible for conceiving and conducting user research, interviews and surveys, and translating them into sitemaps, user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mockups and prototypes.

Ultimately, you will design solutions that meet user needs in an intuitive way, therefore driving adoption and delivering value to our clients.
As part of a highly experienced team, you will have many opportunities to advance and grow your career. A senior consultant is a subject matter expert who will be engaged in the delivery of solutions for our valued clients and who also provides specialist IP support to sales and services teammates.

What You'll Be Doing
Understand business requirements and any technical limitations.
Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mock-ups and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences.
Facilitate the client’s vision by researching, conceiving, sketching, prototyping, and user-testing experiences for digital products.
Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mock-ups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.
Make strategic design and user-experience decisions.
Take a user-centred design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
Communicate design ideas and prototypes to developers.
Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.
Develop and maintain effective customer and user relationships, including representing Insight at conferences, User Groups and other marketing/PR activities as appropriate.
Other duties as assigned.
What We're Looking For

Key skills
A strong portfolio of successful UX and other technical projects is essential.
Expertise in standard UX software such as Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, InVision, UXPin, and the like is a must.
Able to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet user needs and the client’s vision.
Experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions, and an understanding of mobile-first and responsive design principles.
A solid grasp of user-centred design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.
Able to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.
Able to work effectively in a team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.
Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders.
Be passionate about resolving user pain points through great design.
Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.
Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Research and showcase knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies.
Experience with Design Thinking workshops and related activities
 Desirable
Experience in Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a bonus.
Experience working in an agile delivery team would be well regarded 
One of our core values at Insight is “Harmony”: We are a team of diverse individuals who value inclusivity and create meaningful connections so we can win together.

At Insight, we make hiring decisions based on your passion, skills and experience. We offer flexible working arrangements.

Given this role is client facing – applicants are required to be fully vaccinated 

We look forward to your application.

Name: Product Consultant
Description:
Product at Bilue 
 
 About Us 
At Bilue we aim to inspire people with the work we create. Through technology, we aim to improve people’s lives. We do this by solving complex problems, pushing the boundaries of what is possible, building trust through visibility and with a deep understanding of the product journey.  

 
 About the Role 
Day to day you’ll be working alongside a team of engineers, product managers and clients on varied and exciting projects. Our clients include some of Australia’s best known organisations, including a number of high profile, high usage, consumer facing applications. 

 
As a Product Consultant at Bilue you will: 

 
	 Conduct research, user testing and design activities throughout the life of a project  
	 Draw on your past experience in designing mobile products and applying the latest guidelines and principles 
	 Work in an agile environment, taking a highly iterative approach for project success. 
	 Run co-design workshops with stakeholders  
	 Manage and continually improve design systems 
	 Work collaboratively with the engineering and customer success teams, as we problem-solve together 
	 Be passionate about improving people’s lives through user-centered design solutions 
	 Articulate your ideas and design decisions clearly, both verbally and in written & visual formats 
	 Facilitate design sprints with proven experience 
 

 Benefits 
To thank our employees for the value they bring to our business, we offer a wide range of benefits including a generous annual training budget and bonus leave for training and development. We aim to ensure our employees are constantly upskilling and staying on top of the latest industry developments, as well as providing workplace flexibility and a great work/life balance. Product salaries at Bilue range from $60,000 - $165,000+ (inclusive of superannuation) depending on skills and experience. 
 
** Being a consultancy, means we require a minimum of two years experience in your field.

Name: Senior Lecturer, Cyber Security
Description:
•	Based at our Burwood Campus 
•	Full time and Continuing
•	Level C $122,950 + 17% Superannuation 

Founded in 1974, Deakin is a public university in Victoria with 61,000 students across five campuses: Melbourne Burwood, Geelong Waurn Ponds, Geelong Waterfront, Warrnambool, and the online Cloud Campus. We are a progressive and open-minded university, with the highest student satisfaction in Victoria and consistently ranked in the top 1% of the world’s universities.

The Senior Lecturer will be responsible for providing leadership in research, teaching and engagement in the area of Cyber Security. The role will promote the School and maintain links and partnerships with relevant academic, industry and professional communities.

Your key responsibilities will include:

•	Integrating industry and research practice into unit/course design in the area of Cyber Security and applications
•	Leading teaching teams to develop effective unit and course curricula and learning material (including through course leadership roles)
•	Leading the development and/or adoption of new innovation in curriculum design within a course
•	Delivering learner-centric, research and industry-informed active learning teaching practices across different levels / modes of delivery
•	Leading unit and course teaching teams and working collaboratively with other teaching teams in the faculty
•	Leading the review of units and courses and implementing refinements and updates
•	Providing clear assessment rubrics and timely feedback to learners to demonstrate learning outcomes
•	Developing effective assessment tasks and rubrics at unit and course level
•	Leading the moderation of assessment tasks at the course level and adapting practices to improve learning outcomes
•	Applying leading industry and research practice into student learning experiences and resources 
•	Supporting diverse learners by designing accessible and inclusive unit and course material and practices. 

To be successful, you’ll have:

•	A PhD in a relevant discipline and/or advanced qualifications and experience in the relevant discipline area
•	An excellent record of scholarly learning and teaching in undergraduate and/or postgraduate programs, including innovative curriculum design and research supervision
•	A nationally recognised research reputation underpinned by publications in quality journals and/or exhibitions and/or success in obtaining external research grants
•	Positive engagement with research, community, industry and government to enhance the national standing of the discipline
•	Demonstrated capacity and passion for leadership of teaching, research and/or administration
•	Excellent interpersonal skills and a proven ability to establish good working relationships with colleagues.

For a copy of the position description, please visit Deakin Careers.

Please submit your resume, a short cover letter and responses to the Key Selection Criteria by 17 July 2022
For a confidential discussion regarding this position, please contact John Yearwood, Head of School on john.yearwood@deakin.edu.au 

Please note that whilst we still accept applications from any persons interested in our roles, we are currently prioritising applications from those with current working rights in Australia and who are not affected by travel restrictions. 

Offers of employment from Deakin University are conditional upon the applicant being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or medically exempt and providing satisfactory evidence of the same. You can view a copy of the University’s COVID-19 Vaccination Procedure. 

Are You Ready?
Deakin is a Victorian university with a global impact. We are an agile, dynamic and innovative university committed to making a positive impact through our excellence in education, research and innovation and the contributions we make to the wider community. 

We understand that our reputation has been built on the dedication and expertise of our staff and we offer a dynamic and diverse working environment with opportunities to grow and develop careers. We believe that a progressive, thriving culture will ensure that people choose to come, and stay at Deakin and contribute to our ongoing success.

We value diversity and aim to build an inclusive environment that champions, embraces and respects differences. We support and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, and people of all abilities, cultures, sexual orientation, and genders.
We understand that our academic workforce is increasingly diverse, and we recognise academic careers may be placed on hold throughout many life circumstances. Achievement relative to opportunity places more emphasis on the quality, as opposed to the quantity of research outputs. In your application, we strongly encourage you to comment on your achievements relative to opportunity.

Name: L3 Senior Consultant
Description:
The Company

Tridant Pty Ltd is one of Australia's largest specialist consulting firms focused on designing and implementing Financial Performance Management, BI, Financial Reporting, Data Visualisation, Predictive Analytics and Information Management solutions, for both public and private sector organisations throughout Asia Pacific. Tridant partner with multiple market leading technologies to deliver the best solution to our clients.

Tridant's expertise spans a number of market sectors including: Financial Services, Mining, Retail, Education, Media & Entertainment, Oil and Gas, Government and Communications. 

Tridant operate from multiple locations across Australia and Singapore. Our consulting team is home to a number of the most experienced and respected consultants, who have implemented solutions across Australia, New Zealand, Singapore and many other countries.

Since our founding in 2007, Tridant has earned an enviable reputation for delivering some of the largest and most successful IT projects in Australia. Our collegiate culture sets us apart from others in our industry, as does the diversity and quality of our people.


The Role

Tridant is seeking an experienced L3 Senior Consultant with TM1 and/or Anaplan skills, to fill a full-time role within our Support Services team. This is a hybrid work arrangement where work will be undertaken both from home and our modern offices across the country including Sydney CBD and/or Melbourne CBD offices.

Responsible for:

The Support Services practice is responsible for delivering systems support both internally and to clients. At the core of the Support Services practice is the Service Desk, an ITIL aligned function providing multi-channel access to incident and problem management support processes.

Additional to the Service Desk, the Support Services team is responsible for managed services, hosted solutions, internal systems, minor changes, upgrades and patches. 

Accountabilities include, but are not limited to:
•	Provide remote and onsite support to Tridant’s customers which involves supporting applications and resolving customer issues and queries.
•	Development and deployment of enhancements as and when required across Tridant’s suite of CPM solutions, specifically TM1 and Anaplan.
•	Analysis, troubleshooting and tuning applications and solutions.
•	Maintaining and developing customer reports
•	Participation in consulting engagements as necessary
•	General IT support, development and consulting activities. 
•	Knowing your deadlines, and adhering to them is essential, equally knowing your escalation point and using it when required is a must


Desired Skills and Experience

Essential

•	Greater than 5 years’ experience in delivering or supporting IBM TM1 (Planning Analytics) and/or Anaplan solutions
•	Minimum education level of Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant subject – Computer Science, Business, Finance & Accounting.
•	Relevant experience in the design, build, implementation, and support of TM1 and/or Anaplan solutions.
•	Previous experience driving a customer-centric culture
•	Background in financial roles within the corporate sector is desirable 
•	Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Highly Regarded

•	Experience with Adaptive Planning, in delivering or supporting solutions will be looked upon favourably
•	Experience in SAP, Cognos, Power BI or Oracle would be preferred.
•	Background in financial or supply chain roles is desirable
•	Well-developed skills/ability identifying, investigating, and resolving/implementing solutions for customer queries
•	Ability to identify opportunities and taking action to help achieve business goals.
•	Ability to identify process improvement opportunities
•	Team player with a professional, pro-active approach

Why Tridant

Our company offers a unique culture second to none; our ethos is that we are professional, but we make work an enjoyable experience. Tridant offer a collegiate team environment that embraces diversity and allows our staff the opportunity to grow independently in a supportive environment. 

Our team are offered a flexible working arrangements, ongoing learning and development opportunities as well as access to an Employee Assistance Program.

What makes Tridant different? Our culture; our people; access to the leadership team; and the ability to make an impact.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a reputable, fast-growing company where there is a wealth of opportunity for the right candidate. 

Salary for this role is $90,000 - $100,000 (plus Super), commensurate with experience and includes other employment benefits such a corporate flu immunisation program.

For further information on Tridant, please see our website www.tridant.com.

If you fill the required selection criteria and hold appropriate work rights, we invite you to apply for this role.

Name: Senior Consultant
Description:
Technology People Group, part of Xpert Group, is a well-established specialist IT recruitment firm, with a national presence, and Head Office in Sydney CBD. Our diverse clients range from ASX Top 50 organisations to the tech industry’s most promising digital start-ups. 

 Our vision is simple – to set new standards in search for digital talent, and we continue to evolve alongside the technology industry to provide the best possible outcomes for our clients’ success. 

 At the heart of realising this vision, is our people. Our most important asset. 

 Hiring the best talent in the business is our biggest focus, and our team is considered family, where all interactions are based on a level of trust and camaraderie. 

 As part of our clear growth aspirations, we are seeking experienced Senior Recruitment Consultants for each of our offices (Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane). 

 This is the chance to truly build your own practice, within your area of technology specialisation, with the support of a mature research/delivery and leadership team to ensure your success. 

 Senior Consultants are responsible for driving a culture and foundation built on regular business development, continually seeking out and securing new business opportunities, and managing relationships for key customers of the business. They oversee core technical components of client engagement and oversight of delivery quality and execution. 

 Senior Consultants form part of the senior leadership team and are a significant contributor to the overall success of the business. 

   

   What will you do? 

 Development of New Client Opportunities and Existing Accounts 

 Take a proactive approach to business development within both new and existing clients, targeting acquisition of new business opportunities and leverage of services. 

 You will focus on end-to-end recruitment delivery for permanent opportunities, whilst growing a contractor base supported by our mature delivery team. 

   

 What are we looking for? 

 
	 A proven track record as a high achiever, consistent in New Business billing activity 
	 Extensive understanding of the end-to-end recruitment processes, and best practice sourcing principles 
	 Strong business development skills; can demonstrate where you have actively targeted and secured new business opportunities 
	 Prior experience working across specialist (vertical)  I.T.markets, and able to demonstrate your knowledge 
	 A strong network of customers and contacts, preferably of a senior nature 
	 Experienced in mentoring junior consultants and rookies 
	 An appreciation for profit and loss (P&L’s) 
	 Extensive experience in responding to tenders, and presenting to customers on business capability; specifically, technology related solutions and capability 
 

   

 WHAT’S NEXT? 

 Apply now for the opportunity to join our team!

Name: Talent Acquisition Consultant
Description:
Where do you want to take your career? We're building something special here and we need you to help shape how Novon will look in the near future. 

 Xpert Group  is a large Sydney based IT Services business. We operate a number of Technology centric brands including  Novon , our IT Services business focused on delivering Data Transformation Services for clients large and small. 

 Are you currently working in a Talent Acquisition or Recruitment Agency position and searching for something more fulfilling and rewarding? Where do you want to take your career? We’re building something special here and we need you to help shape how Novon will look in the near future. 

 We are searching for a Talent Acquisition Consultant for our Sydney CBD HQ. This hybrid role combines recruitment delivery and staff engagement, whilst growing our team in an organic and sustainable way. Oh, and we pay personal and company bonuses. 

 Reporting to the Head of Talent, this hands-on role will involve sourcing and securing technical talent, predominantly across our Project Services (PMs & BAs) division, as well involvement in People & Culture and other key strategic projects. 

 For you to be successful in this role it is expected that you have resourcing/recruitment experience working in IT, with experience and knowledge mapping out candidates, talent pooling, and developing strategies to take our Employee Value Proposition to market. 

   

 What makes a great Talent Team member at Novon? 

 
	 A good understanding of technical environments particularly with a knowledge of Project Services 
	 Highly developed social skills with the ability to work in an ever-growing, innovative community. You should genuinely like people! 
	 Strong written and verbal communication skills both actual and virtual 
	 A proactive personality with the drive and passion to take ownership of your area and grow our business 
 

   

 Who are we? 

 Novon is a rapidly-growing consultancy headquartered in Sydney. We are focused on building our expertise around Data, Integration and Business Consultancy and are technology agnostic, ensuring that our customers get the best solution for their business. This is an exciting time to join the team, we are in growth phase with many opportunities for you to develop outside of your comfort zone and help build a best in class consulting organisation. 

   

 Why work at Novon? 

 
	 Interesting and diverse projects with customers such as large retail, investment and neo-banks, transport, and government 
	 Study support and clear career development path 
	 Meritocracy – you are valued for how good you are and what you do, not your tenure 
	 Regular check points, social events and monthly team meetings 
	 Value sharing knowledge and helping to build other skills and experience 
	 Help you grow both technical and consulting skills 
	 We live our values of  Be Innovative, Be Humble, Be Yourself . 
 

   

 What do you need to do? 
APPLY NOW!
