Name: Network Security Operations Centre Network Engineer
Description:
Why work for Aussie? 

For the same reason our customers love us.  We are Australian operated, local from the ground up.   We’re recognised for our quality, great value internet, phone and mobile services that suit the needs of Australians and we like to punch way above our weight in the industry.

Our fantastic culture thrives on our values:
- Don't be ordinary, be awesome
- Think BIG
- No bullsh*t
- Be good to people
- Have fun

We’re Australia’s 5th largest telco and one of Australia’s fastest growing companies.? Don’t just take our word for it – amongst other things, we’ve won some of Australia’s top customer service and employer of choice awards.

What does Aussie offer?
- Discounted internet which always helps the hip pocket 
- Day to day benefits like flexible working arrangements, paid parental leave, employee assistance program
- Empowered in your career growth, so you will also be supported with ongoing training and development and access to LinkedIn Leaning
- Celebrating you! with awards and recognition
- Discounts at various retailers and gyms
- Community Impact Programs, some of the ways we help can be found here
- We also can’t forget the very hard-working coffee machine and the casual dress code. 

The NSOC Network Engineer is a member of Aussie Broadband’s Network Security Operations Centre (NSOC) team and plays a key role in managing, assuring, and maintaining Aussie’s telecommunications network. 

Reporting into the Network Operations Manager, your day-to-day responsibilities will include:
- Ensuring that Aussie’s Network meets and exceeds performance and service level targets.
- Performing Network Monitoring and Event management duties to identify performance issues, outages, and risks to network availability and reliability within targets.
- Managing and restoring Network and Network Security Incidents as quickly as possible, within performance targets. This includes performing jeopardy and escalation duties, PIR (Post Incident Reviews), and improvement actions.
- Performing Network Change Enablement duties to plan, communicate, execute, and support network maintenance and upgrades.
- Perform Problem Management duties to identify and treat problems both proactively and reactively.
- Proactively identifying and actioning areas of Continual Improvement within the network and work practices.
- Proactively identify risks to network security and resiliency and work with the team to treat these.
- Working with, creating, and updating technical knowledge documents, work instructions, and records.
- Act as an escalation point to resolve Residential, Corporate and other incidents impacting customer service, and perform Technical or Hierarchical escalations to vendors, Engineering, and management.
- Support Network Engineering and Business provisioning on project implementation, configuration, cutover, acceptance, and quality checks.
- Working closely with major stakeholders, including but not limited to, Network Engineering, Provisioning, Residential Customer and Corporate Support teams on incident management, request fulfillment, network problems, projects, and new product rollouts


The position is offered on a full-time basis, located in Dandenong South. Working hours are on a rotational 24X7X365 shift roster. You may also be required to work reasonable additional hours. Some travel may be required.

All entitlements will be in accordance with the Telecommunications Award 2020, and the Fair Work Australia National Employment Standards (NES). The starting range for this position is AUD85,000 + superannuation dependent upon skill set and experience. Shift penalty rates will be payable where shift work occurs. 

We require all Aussie Broadband employees to return a satisfactory police check and to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or medically exempt. 

The things that are really (really) important:
- An unequivocal commitment to the Aussie values and using them to make decisions
- Over 3 years' technical networking experience, preferably within an ISP or RSP NOC.
- Excellent communicator, verbal and written, being able to bridge the gap between helping staff and customers at a technical level and reporting key needs of the team to management.
- A willingness for self-directed learning.
- Good understanding of networking protocols (e.g., MPLS, IPSEC, BGP, OSPF, VLANs, VRF)
- Good active (devices) and passive (fibre) network troubleshooting skills
- Understanding of network design.

Other things we’d like to see:
- Relevant vendor certifications, e.g., Cisco CCNA/P, Juniper JCNA, Fortinet NSE, F5, ITIL v4, Network Security
Experience with Cisco ASR9k routers, Cisco NCS routers, Juniper routers, EVPN, EIGRP, Fortinet firewalls, F5 or Fortinet CG-NAT
- Experience with network monitoring and ITSM (event/incident/problem/change) systems and tools, e.g. LogicMonitor and ServiceNow.


We’re unconventional in many ways - we’re fast and considered, we take risks, we question the norms and above all, we’ve got your back. If you’re after a tribe of innovative storytellers, apply directly

At Aussie Broadband we see difference as our point of difference.? We celebrate it, we support it, and thrive on it – because it means our team can bring their whole selves to work, and that we can better represent our customers and community.? We’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, and our stand for inclusion and diversity is just one way we can demonstrate our value of ‘Be Good to People’.

Name: Security Specialist
Description:
Job Requirements 

 Key Responsibilities: 

 
	 Should play a vital role in engaging the activities and manage the team in Designing, Implementation phases. 
	 Preparing and maintaining documentation, policies and instructions, and recording and detailing operational procedures and system logs. 
	 Assist in patching, upgrades and disaster recovery for systems.

 Technical Experience:

Name: Consultant – Project Manager/ICT Business Analyst
Description:
The Role
The primary focus will be to manage and deliver quality outcomes to our diverse range of clients across a selection of ERP solutions; you will champion quality methodology and ensure all elements of multiple implementations run smoothly whilst supporting the goals and strategies of MicroChannel.

Key Responsibilities:
Ability to analyse client requirements and business needs or objectives to determine how software can best meet client’s requirements and objectives.
•	Identify, investigate, and analyse business processes, procedures and work practices
•	Ability to monitor the cost, and calculate and deploy the appropriate resources
•	Assist with creating user and training documentation
•	Take responsibility for deploying functional solutions, such as creating, adopting and implementing system test plans, which ensure acceptable quality and integrity of the system
•	Design a project schedule and set timeline for each member of the team and delegate specific tasks to each resource of the project.
•	Liaise with product vendors on any issues relevant for our customers or MicroChannel.
•	Ensure that the technical aspects of projects meet required standards for functionality, operability, and documentation.
•	Act as the main point of contact for customers, providing guidance and assistance in the decision-making process.

Knowledge and skills that will support success:

•	Exceptional Stakeholder management skills with demonstrated experience working with executives and senior leadership is a must.

•	Strong training and understanding of project management frameworks and methodology (Agile, Prince2, PMP, PMBOK etc...)
•	The ability to work in both a team environment and on an individual basis in a motivated manner
•	Exceptional communication, interpersonal, negotiation and dispute resolution skills
•	Advanced user of MS Project and Microsoft Office suite

•	Tertiary qualifications in ICT is desirable 

Great time to join the MicroChannel family. Apply now by forwarding a detailed resume to our HR Team.

Name: Senior Consultant - Retail/POS Software
Description:
MicroChannel is a leading business technology solutions company founded in 1995 with a diverse solutions portfolio across ERP, CRM, Retail, Managed Services, and business applications. A market leading and progressive company, MicroChannel has received more than 100 awards, providing a rich environment for career growth and development.
 
About you
As the Retail Software Senior Consultant, you will be an integral part of MicroChannel’s growth trajectory by providing customers who purchase our products with a positive experience. Your day will consist of liaising with clients, collecting data, customising features, defining objectives and conducting training sessions.

Key responsibilities:
•	Autonomously implement technical software projects using Microchannel retail products and retail technologies
•	Designing, analyse and building retail solutions to fit customers business processes
•	Proactively engaging with clients to further extend value from existing retail systems or to introduce new technologies and solutions
•	Conducting workshops and analysis for customers’ systems to understand their business processes
•	Work closely with the technical team for successful project outcomes.

Experience you will need:
•	Proven experience in the following: POS/Retail systems/Integrations and APIs/ERP systems
•	Solid knowledge of SQL Language and Microsoft SQL Server product suite
•	Prior experience with LS Retail/BC/NAV is preferred
•	Understanding business processes and customer needs
•	Strong technical literacy
•	Ability to drive conference room pilots and walkthrough presentations
•	Excellent written and communication skills
•	Ability to work both autonomously and collaboratively
•	Strong attention to detail, high-quality standards, and processes
•	Tertiary Qualifications in ICT, Computer Software/Engineering or Business will be highly regarded.
•	Certifications in LS Retail or other retail software is highly desirable

This is the perfect position for a passionate and creative professional, to join a leader in business technology solutions that has a focus on a wide range of innovative and forward-thinking retail technologies. Apply now by forwarding a detailed resume.

Name: Management Consultant
Description:
About the company

Effective Logistics is a third-party logistics provider. Our team works for one goal: to ensure the customer satisfaction by implementing comprehensive and coordinated systems in the transport and delivery of facilities and services. We are a customer go-to expert for simplifying operational complexities to achieve effective logistics. Effective Logistics has been providing 3rd party logistics to our clients for over 15 years.

About the role

We are seeking a Management Consultant to be based in our Melbourne warehouses to assist our organisation to achieve greater efficiency and solve daily challenges, also study our structures, methods, systems and procedures. 

This role will be in charge of developing, monitoring and continuously improving the quality, safety and risk management systems across our business. The Management Consultant, will design and implement an overall risk management process for the organisation, which includes an analysis of the financial impact on the company when it occurs. From strategic procurement, forecasting, planning, inventory management, S&OP’s and distribution. With extensive cross functional collaboration throughout the organisation, The Management Consultant will engage, mentor and lead a team of direct reports. 

This position is part of the senior leadership team and is responsible for leading and directing all facets of the warehouses process. 

 

Duties will include, although are not limited to:

 

carry out research and data collection to understand the organisation
conduct analysis
interview the client's employees, management team and other stakeholders
run focus groups and facilitate workshops
prepare business proposals and presentations
identify issues and form hypotheses and solutions
present findings and recommendations to clients
implement recommendations or solutions and ensure the client receives the necessary assistance to carry it all out
manage projects and programmes
lead and manage those within the team, including analysts
liaise with the client to keep them informed of progress and to make relevant decisions.
What you will have

Qualification and/or relevant experience within the HSEQ/Business Management/ Organisation Management discipline or at least 5 years of experience;
Experience in planning, scheduling, prioritising, conducting and managing audits;
Able to express ideas clearly, effectively and with meaning (written & verbal), and to a variety of audiences.
 

Why Choose Us

We may not be the only logistics company in Melbourne that offer reliable and professional services. However, Effective Logistics has several qualities that make its team a key player in the logistics management services and transport industry.

How to Apply

If you believe that you have the necessary attributes to succeed in this challenging and rewarding role, please forward your resume in 'word' format by selecting apply. 

 

Only successful applicants will be contacted!

Name: Firewall/ Network Security Specialist
Description:
Efiniti Telecommunications Services?is a lead supplier of professional services in the Telecommunications and Information & Communications Technology (ICT) industry. Efiniti is an Australian owned and based company that specialises in these fields across three business sectors — Carrier & ICT, Corporate & Government, and Technology Vendor.

We are currently looking to fill full-time contract position?in our team?as a Firewall/ Network Security Specialist. It is an opportunity to work in agile engineering environment and to develop automated solutions and tools for the manual process to help us improve the performance of the systems.

Contract term: 12 months + extension

Business hours between 7am-7pm (Monday to Friday)

Within this challenging and rewarding position, you will be responsible for:
The successful candidates need to have experience on firewall provisioning across the various networks and security vendor firewall appliances, i.e. FortiNet, Checkpoint, Cisco etc...
*Strong security firewall provisioning skills and experience across various security firewalls
*Telco experience
*Premium customer service skills
*Premium analytical skills
*Solid technical skills
*Solid security processes, procedures and policies knowledge

Technical Skills (Must have):
*Check Point Multi-domain Manager, Smart Dash Board, SmartView Monitor, SmartView Tracker;
*Forti Manager and Forti Analyser

Other skills:
*Qualification in Engineering, Computer science or IT
*Proficient with Microsoft Office applications
*Strong communications skills, both written and verbal, including a personable and professional
*Troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
*Ability to work autonomously or collaboratively
*Able to adapt and adopt to changing situations
*Available to start immediately
*What you'll need to succeed

To Be Successful In This Role, You Will must Have
*At least 3 years’ experience in General IT Communications
*At least 2 years Network Security operations and management experience
*At least 2 years of Check Point NG/NGX, VSX, and MDSM (Provider 1) experience
*At least two (2) years Fortinet experience
*Sound knowledge of routing (ex. OSPF, BGP, MPLS), VRFs, load balancing, L2/L3 protocols.
*Sound knowledge of TCP/IP and service provider networks.
*Sound knowledge of three Tier security architecture and L3/L4 firewalling
*Sound knowledge of IPS/IDS

What can Efiniti offer?
We know there are many aspects of our employees’ lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include:
*A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
*Competitive salary package
*Learning and development opportunities to support your desired technical or leadership career path
*Join a dynamic and supportive team
*A hybrid work system where you can work from home (depending on your role)

Due to high volume of application, only shortlisted candidate will be contacted.

Please note, due to the requirements of this role, candidates must have working rights in Australia.

You should submit a cover letter and CV outlining your experience, qualifications, and other relevant telecommunication experience.

To be successful in this job, it is essential that you have a professional approach, ability to learn and adapt quickly in new environment, time management skills and emotional intelligence, previous experience within the telecommunications industry.

Efiniti values social and cultural diversity and is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and the provision of a safe and healthy work environment.

Name: Principal Consultant (Manager level), Infrastructure Advisory
Description:
Company Description
Turner & Townsend is an independent professional services firm specialising in program management, project management, commercial management and advisory across the real estate, infrastructure and natural resources sectors. With 112 offices in 45 countries, we draw on our extensive global and industry experience to manage risk while maximising value and performance during the construction and operation of our clients’ assets.

At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realise their potential, and doing our part to create a green, inclusive and productive world, where opportunities are open to all.

In 2020 we launched our Infrastructure Program Advisory practice in Australia, as part of our global strategy to increase the consulting and advisory support we provide to our major clients. Our Program Advisory business advises our clients on how to set-up, transform, optimise, and operate major programs and projects across the infrastructure sector. With our Program Advisory business flourishing, we now seek an experienced Principal Consultant to join our Sydney team.

In this client-facing role you will work on a variety of consulting/advisory assignments. Each assignment is led by a Turner & Townsend director, and you would work as part of that multi-disciplinary team to deliver excellent outcomes for our clients. Your knowledge and experience in delivering consulting and advisory services will be critical to our work for our clients. Specific responsibilities are set out below. The role is based in Sydney. Business travel outside of Sydney may be required as part of this role.

Job Description
The primary responsibilities of the role are as follows:

Being strategically involved with exciting and challenging commissions that improve the way an organisation develops its capital strategy, assesses and allocates capital, and sets up its major programs and projects for success.
Providing best-practice advice and hands-on help to our clients in relation to establishing, transforming, operating and optimising major programs and projects.
Deploying a variety of consulting techniques to improve performance across the capital and project lifecycle.
Working as part of an integrated team, taking ownership of major workstreams and deliverables, directing and coaching more junior consulting staff.
Supporting the definition and development of tools and techniques that support our service delivery.
Supporting business leaders with business development and practice development.
Contribute to a collaborative and supportive team environment.
Qualifications
Candidates will require the following:

Ability to provide value-adding advice and hands-on help to clients in the infrastructure sector especially in the areas of establishment and operation of major capital projects and programs.
A thorough understanding of business improvement approaches and frameworks including business process definition, systems thinking, change management and other relevant techniques.
4 to 6 years’ experience in a similar consulting role OR
5 to 7 years’ experience in a relevant role in the infrastructure / construction sector.
Bachelor degree or other recognised professional qualification in one of the following fields: management consulting, business management, engineering, construction, procurement, contract management, project management, project controls or information technology.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
The following are beneficial but are not mandatory:

Experience in rail, aviation, power & utilities, renewables or defence.
Experience in the construction sector in Australia or New Zealand.
Additional information
Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.

We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive, and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance. We also encourage our staff to strive to ‘make a difference’ and become involved in various working committees and forums (for example, Inclusion Working Group, Social & Wellness, Learning & Development, Corporate Social Responsibilities and Net Zero Vision).

At Turner & Townsend we offer a competitive remuneration package and company benefits which include gym membership allowance, generous employee scheme, parental leave, social events, employee assistance program, flu vaccinations, discounted private health insurance, health and wellbeing assessments, purchasing annual leave, family support scheme.

Turner & Townsend value greatly and have a focus on Corporate Responsibilities (CR), this includes a day’s leave entitlement to support a local charity or community activity along with the opportunity to participate in several office events that held throughout the year.

Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people from all sectors of the community.

Turner & Townsend does not accept any speculative or unsolicited CV’s that have been sent to our internal recruitment team or hiring managers from agencies outside of our preferred supplier list. Any speculative or unsolicited CV’s will be treated as a direct application.

Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com/.

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
The Company 
Kona Recruitment is Australia's most innovative Insurance Recruitment Agency, with extensive experience servicing key client's across General Insurance, Life Insurance, Workers Compensation and Superannuation. 
Founded in 2020, Kona & Co Insurance looks after some of the worlds most renowned Insurers and Brokers, aswell as Underwriting Agencies and Boutique Brokerages at the heart of Australia's General Insurance Industry. 
Our established Life Insurance and Superannuation division offers candidates the opportunity to explore positions with Australia's largest Super Funds, globally renowned Life Insurers, as well as other leading Financial Institutions.
 
The Opportunity 
We are currently looking to recruit a Recruitment Consultant, Full Time, Perth WA, to come in and help grow the business as we enter our first phase of growth here in Australia. 
Working closely with our Managing Partner, you will cultivate key client relationships, aswell as identifying and winning new business partnerships inline with our brand values. You will also be responsible for sourcing Talent across the insurance industry, creating, posting position descriptions and managing key internal relationships 
Undertake 360 recruitment and develop a pipeline of specialist talent within the Insurance space; Leverage multiple online channels to source in demand talent for our customers; Proactively headhunt to connect and engage with niche talent in the Insurance space for current and future roles; Build a talent pool for the key pipelines critical to our customers; Deliver excellent customer experience to clients through exceptional delivery of the recruitment process; Meet with clients to understand role briefs, culture and environment; Maintain accurate record keeping forecasting and reporting on talent pipeline metrics; Manage a portfolio of clients to drive retention and growth whilst maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction; Provide mentorship and support to junior recruitment consultants as required.

Skills and requirements 
•	A desire to help grow and establish a new Insurance recruitment brand here in Australia and Internationally
•	Bachelor Degree 
•	4 Years Experience within Recruitment 
•	Sound understanding of the General Insurance industry and roles 


Whats on Offer 
•	Opportunity to become a part of a multi-award-winning company 
•	Support and collaborative team environment with high growth ambition over the next 12 months 
•	No KPI’s, comprehensive Work From Home capabilities, Best in Industry Work/Life exibility International Brand Exposure with opportunities to move interstate and internationally
•	Australia's best commission structure 
•	$125,000 + Super 

We are continuing investing in infrastructure and people to support their transformation journey and are looking to attract the best and brightest talent, where people can make an impact and forge rewarding careers.

Name: Senior Recruitment Consultant – SYD
Description:
Who we are:

JIVARO are the industry leader in recruitment for all head office and retail operations within Australia. We pride ourselves on our long-term industry reputation, based on our unparalleled recruitment delivery; and the service we provide to our clients and candidates.

We currently have openings for a Senior Recruitment Consultant who wants to join our highly successful and close-knit Sydney team. This role will see you specialising in your own area of the market, and allow you the opportunity to become an expert in your field!

You will be provided with a strong training, development and succession plan to set you on the path to success!

What we are looking for:
•	Minimum 2 -5 years recruitment experience
•	You don't need to have recruited in retail, we are open to experienced recruiters who are looking to move into a new division 
•	You will need a proven track record to meet revenue targets 
•	Display a high work ethic and determination to achieve results 
•	Excellent relationship building skills and a customer centric attitude 
•	A flexible mind set and adaptable and open to change
•	A passionate recruiter that can bring a high level of drive and energy to the team
What we offer you:
•	A highly competitive uncapped bonus structure
•	Quarterly incentives for high achievers and value driven individuals
•	Quarterly team incentives including weekends away
•	Weekly team lunches, weekly drinks and regular social events
•	As a business we set achievable and realistic targets, as we want you to succeed
We are not a traditional recruitment agency - we are an incredibly open, collaborative and social team looking for a like-minded individual to join us.
We would also be open to consider sponsorship for this role.

If you are interested in this role, please apply or email your resume through to applications@jivaro.com.au

Name: Senior Consultant, Alternative Investment
Description:
Who we are

Northern Trust is a preeminent global financial institution that provides asset servicing, investment management and wealth management services for institutions, high-net-worth individuals and families. For more than 130 years, our success has been anchored in one purpose: to serve as our clients’ most trusted financial partner, guarding and growing their assets as though they are our own. Our market-leading technological capabilities—spanning from artificial intelligence for currency management, blockchain for fund administration and cloud-based solutions to deliver personalized wealth management services—allow us to deliver the highest level of service to our clients with speed and precision.

What we do

Northern Trust’s international business has grown significantly over the last decade. Some of our largest clients are located in Asia and Australia, which represents a rapidly growing client base for the company. Our intricate understanding of the region allows us to provide unique insights and strategic perspectives to our clients. Currently, we have client offices in Beijing, Hong Kong, Melbourne, Singapore, Tokyo and Kuala Lumpur. 
 
Northern Trust is proud to serve the Australian community with global capabilities, meaningful insights and exceptional service. Institutional clients across Asia Pacific have relied on Northern Trust for effective solutions and ethical guidance across asset servicing and asset management since 1986.

Role Summary

This role will form part of an existing Alternative Assets Consulting team that is responsible for providing consultative services and subject matter expertise to clients and prospects as it relates to the Alternative Asset Services Practice (AAS). In addition to supporting new business opportunities (including pre and post implementation processes), the Senior Consultant will also work closely with existing clients to improve/refine existing operating model as client needs change, as well as serving on large and/or complex projects. 

This role reports to Manager, Alternative Investment. 

What you will do

Your primary responsibilities will include supporting business expansion opportunities, and providing a direct liaison between our clientele and the Northern Trust. This will include working on new product initiatives, particularly assisting with the design, review and implementation of corporate initiatives impacting the processing of Alternative Assets around the globe.

•	Support new business opportunities, and provide consultative oversight and expert advice to new clients on the operational capabilities of the practice. 
•	Leads new client onboarding, including participating in client discovery sessions, setting client expectations, agreeing service levels, and post-implementation monitoring
•	Create presentation material and other documents to share with clients, prospects and internal partners.
•	Develop an in-depth understanding of client’s support model and end-to-end processes
•	Research, analyse and resolve ad-hoc client requests
•	Provides support for escalation of issues and complex problem resolution
•	Consult on effective ways to meet client needs through continuous process review and improvements 
•	Be a part of a self-motivated team, who will develop periodic goals, set short-term priorities, and ensure timely and accurate completion of the work. 

Your Knowledge/Skills

•	Excellent oral and written communication skills are required
•	In-depth knowledge of alternative investments, ideally within the asset processing/servicing space
•	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to exercise judgement and dealing with ambiguity
•	Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills
•	Tech savvy with the ability to use initiative and flexibility to meet client expectations
•	Preferred candidates will have a Finance/Accounting/Commerce degree, and at least 5 years client-facing experience in the financial services industry

As of 31 March 2022, Northern Trust Corporation had:

•	$15.5 trillion in assets under custody/administration
•	$12.0 trillion in assets under custody
•	$1.5 trillion in assets under management
•	$173 billion in banking assets

As a Northern Trust partner, you will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture, which has a strong history of financial strength and stability. Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company that is committed to strengthening the communities we serve! 
 
We recognize the value of inclusion and diversity in culture, in thought, and in experience. Which Is why we are honored to receive the following awards in 2021:

•	Gender Equality Index Member, Bloomberg, 2021 (4th consecutive year)
•	Top ranking of 100% on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation’s, Corporate Equality Index, 2021 (For the 14th consecutive year, Northern Trust has scored 100% and earned the designation as a “Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality”)

In Australia, we are actively involved in many ways with both community and diversity organisations, which includes charity participation days. For families we offer a very generous parental leave scheme, and all staff have access to subsidised health insurance if they choose.
 
We’d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world’s most admired and ethical companies. Build your career with us and apply today! 
 
•	Want to learn more about our company? Visit www.northerntrust.com
•	We are a leading global financial institution- Click here to check out our company accolades!

Name: Consultant - Developer
Description:
About Polymathian

At Polymathian, we apply Industrial Mathematics to complex problems faced by industry to transform the way companies run their business operations. Our hosted software solutions deliver significant value to its clients by driving better business decisions to ultimately revolutionise the way industry operates.

We work across a wide range of sectors including: Mining, Rail, Maritime, Energy, Agriculture, and Oil & Gas, for some of the world’s largest companies.

We offer a great workplace that combines exceptional colleagues, a culture that values innovation and the chance to work on exceptionally difficult problems all using the latest technology.

About the Role

As a Python developer, we offer you the opportunity to play a key role in projects for some of the largest companies in Australia and around the world. We believe in small, project-dedicated teams where every member directly affects the end product. At Polymathian you'll have the opportunity to play a crucial role in developing software which will be vital in making what could be multi-million dollar decisions for our clients.

You'll work in an environment where everyone understands what you're doing. Meet people in industry, around Australia and all over the world, talking about your work, selling the code you have developed. We want people who can be amazing coders and amazing business representatives, all in the same day.

If you are interested in helping to solve planning and scheduling related optimisation problems, using modern software development tools and frameworks, with cutting edge cloud environments, you will love working in Polymathian. More important than experience and qualifications is attitude. A willingness to learn, a positive attitude, and passion is key. As a developer, you need to care about and take pride in your code. In providing customer support, you'll strive to continually delight our customers.

More than a desk job

You'll work in an environment where everyone understands what you're doing.
Meet people in industry, around Australia and all over the world, talking about your work, selling the products and projects you work on.
We want people who can be some combination of an amazing consultants, product evangelists and amazing business representatives, all in the same day.
Skills, Experience, Qualifications and Competencies

Required

Fantastic interpersonal and communication skills
Consulting experience in some combination of: using/developing/supporting/training/enhancing software systems
Willingness to work as part of a team
Formal qualifications or experience in software development or interacting with software development teams
Desired

Experience with object orientated programming languages
Formal qualifications and/or experience in Python and/or C++
Bonus (but no essential)

Experience and/or formal qualification in applied mathematics
Familiarity with parts of Polymathian's tech stack
Type of Employment

Full Time
Based in Brisbane
Tech Stack

The dominant languages used in Polymathian include: Python, C++ and JS.

The kinds of frameworks, toolkits, IDEs and third party software we use include: Docker, Flask, SQLAlchemy, Celery, NumPy, Pandas, R, Alembic , KnockoutJS, React, Bootstrap, D3, Plot.ly, Google Charts, Boost, Salt, Jenkins, Jira, Confluence, Slack, Git, Visual Studio, PyCharm, Gurobi, PuLP, PostgreSQL, Boto, Zappa, and all manner of Amazon Web Services… to name but a few.

Remuneration and Benefits

Salary commensurate with formal qualifications and level of experience
Flexible working environment
Access to learning and development programs and conference events
Company funded team event (Skiing in Japan Jan 2019, hiking in Tasmania Jan 2020)
Other company funded social events throughout the year
Company funded Friday lunches
How to Apply

Send your application through the link and be sure to include:

CV
Cover Letter
Any work or projects which support your application
Github, Bitbucket, Stack Overflow or other relevant accounts
Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $90,000.00 – $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

Free drinks
Free food
Referral program
Visa sponsorship
Schedule:

Monday to Friday
Ability to commute/relocate:

South Brisbane, QLD 4101: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)
Education:

Bachelor Degree (Required)
Experience:

Software development: 2 years (Required)
Work Authorisation:

Australia (Preferred)

Name: Consultant Software Developer
Description:
At Thoughtworks, Software Developers collaborate with Business and Quality Analysts, Designers, Project Managers and more to design software solutions that will create meaningful change for our clients. They listen thoughtfully to understand the context of a business problem and write clean and iterative code to deliver a powerful end result. By balancing strong opinions with a willingness to find the right answer, Software Developers bring integrity to technology, ensuring all voices are heard.

Job responsibilities
- You will champion best practices like writing clean and reusable code using practices like TDD, SOLID principles, OO design, and pair programming
- You will partner with other technologists from cross-functional teams advocating devops culture
- You will work in collaborative, product-focused teams to build innovative customer experiences and create meaningful change for a variety of clients
- Take ownership and accountability beyond individual deliverables, always pushing the envelope in order to deliver awesome results for our clients
- Learn, digest and subsequently apply the latest technology thinking from our Technology Radar to solve client problems

Job qualifications

Technical skills
-You have 2+ years* of experience using two or more development languages (Java, JavaScript, Ruby, C#, etc.) with experience in Object-Oriented programming
-You can write clean, high-quality code in a variety of languages and are also able to spot (and improve) bad code
-You have experience with Agile, Lean and/or Continuous Delivery approaches such as Continuous Integration, TDD, Infrastructure as Code, etc.
-Bonus points if you have knowledge of cloud technology such as AWS, Docker or Kubernetes

Professional skills
-You thrive in a collaborative, flat environment that values transparency, openness, feedback and change
-You have a passion for learning and sharing knowledge as well as a desire to create the right solutions for business problems
-You're resilient in ambiguous situations and can approach challenges from multiple perspectives

*For candidates with less than 2 years of experience, please visit the Graduates page on our career site.

Other things to know

L&D

There is no one-size-fits-all career path at Thoughtworks: however you want to develop your career is entirely up to you. But we also balance autonomy with the strength of our cultivation culture. This means your career is supported by interactive tools, numerous development programs and teammates who want to help you grow. We see value in helping each other be our best and that extends to empowering our employees in their career journeys.

What's on offer
-All Thoughtworkers receive an annual professional development allowance to attend conferences, courses, workshops and to purchase books
-Other benefits include a large network of mentors and coaches, generous paid parental leave package, a communications allowance, a monthly health and wellness allowance, free and discounted tickets to major industry conferences, and catered Friday lunches

About Thoughtworks

Thoughtworks is a global technology consultancy that integrates strategy, design and engineering to drive digital innovation. For 28+ years, our clients have trusted our autonomous teams to build solutions that look past the obvious. Here, computer science grads come together with seasoned technologists, self-taught developers, midlife career changers and more to learn from and challenge each other. Career journeys flourish with the strength of our cultivation culture, which has won numerous awards around the world.


Join Thoughtworks and thrive. Together, our extra curiosity, innovation, passion and dedication overcomes ordinary.

Please apply directly to our Careers website - https://www.thoughtworks.com/en-au/careers/jobs/2864502

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
•	Salary range - $70k - $80k base + commissions 
•	Join an inspiring team of dynamic deal makers
•	Take ownership of your journey & be supported by an experienced team

Established in 2006, we have cemented ourselves as one of Australia's most recognisable and respected recruitment group operating within the fields of construction, engineering, architecture and mining.

As we continue to expand, we are looking to welcome a Recruitment Consultant into our well-established Perth team. Your days will be spent working alongside other experienced recruiters, and proactively networking to source quality candidate options to our client base within the construction sector.

The Ideal Candidate

•	Previous experience in a Recruitment role, working to targets in a fast-paced environment
•	Degree qualified in HR, or Business Management desired but not essential 
•	Have an eye for detail and know how to work and think outside of the box
•	Exceptional communication skills and very well presented
•	A successful track record in your previous recruitment roles
•	Delivery and execution in every aspect of your working career
•	Ability and maintain long-term relationships

The Marble Offer

•	Established desk with commitment clients & candidates
•	Generous base salary + commissions OTE $100-200k+
•	Ongoing training and transparent progression structure
•	Extended holidays securing you 23 days annual leave a year
• Permanent position with ongoing training and development days 
•	International all expenses paid high performers trip every year
•	An incredibly positive, motivated and supportive team

Name: Customer Support Consultant at Appliances Online (Head Office)
Description:
About us

Winning Group is more than just a retailer, we are on a mission to deliver inspiration and create the best experiences in the world, and for the world. From our luxury Winning Appliances retail showrooms, Appliances Online, Rogerseller bathrooms, Heelix, Home Clearance to our national logistics and installation business, Winning Services… We aspire to create the best experiences for our customers, our people, our community and our planet.

Why Join Us?
A full time, permanent position - we have different shift options available!
Earn bonuses from $250 - $1,000 per fortnight for smashing your KPIs
Tons of career progression into other departments
Fun laid back call centre environment
Great office location in Redfern or Rosehill 

About The Role
The 'Engine Room' is the heart of Appliances Online... they are the vibrant team that deliver customer support and sales to all of our customers. As part of the team you'll be answering emails, call or live chat from our customers to WOW them with our service! That might be making sales, changing delivery dates or advising them on the best products - and don't worry we have plenty of training to get you up and running!


What Your Day-To-Day Will Look Like
Every day you'll have a half an hour training with your team You'll be answering phone calls, live chats and emails to WOW our customers with your ability to go above and beyond for them
You'll have targets to achieve in regards to number of phone calls to answer, live chats to respond to and emails to reply to (don't worry, we are busy and this isn't such a challenge!)Smash your targets to earn bonuses and commission
Work amongst the team to support each other 
Please note: This role is a Sydney-based position based full time in our Waterloo HQ.

A bit about you
You'll need to be available full time (5 days per week!) We have shifts starting from 6:30am, 8am, 8:30am, 9:30am and 10:00amEager to learn! You don't need experience for this position - we can train you!
Passionate about the opportunity to chat with customers and meeting goals
Amazing multi-tasker, our phones ring A LOT and you’ll also have emails and live chat on the go
A sense of humour - we love to have fun at work! 

We are always on the lookout for people that encompass our values and ways of being. At Winning Group, we value those that think outside the box, that own their decisions and their position, care about the effects of their actions and those around them, and, most importantly, to WOW others - to delight, learn and inspire those around them. Come and join us on our journey.

Name: Senior Consultant – Dynamics Finance & Operations
Description:
About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their businesses by harnessing the power of technology. Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last ten years in a row, we are a diverse, values-driven organisation of over 325,000 team members in more than 50 countries.

Now is the time to join our Australian and New Zealand business as we rapidly expand - purposefully investing into specific technology capabilities whilst designing and driving integrated strategies and solutions across our business lines. 

This is an opportunity to be at the forefront of finding new ways technology can help us reimagine what’s possible, collect unique career experiences with global clients and game-changing tech projects. 
Let's talk about the team:

Our Dynamics FinOps team work closely with our clients across a variety of industries, advising on how to use Dynamics 365 F&O to meet their business objectives. They work in partnership to understand their key objectives, then design and consult on solutions and best approach. They’re well-versed in the D365 F&O Finance modules, the go-to in their regions and comfortable working with C-level executives, leveraging their specialist knowledge to add value to all client projects. 

Let’s talk about the role and responsibilities:

•	Facilitate workshops with a variety of users to clearly define the requirements, scope and desired outcome of the solution
•	Take ownership of consultancy, configuration engagements and solution delivery, working with peers and clients to ensure successful delivery 
•	Undertake client consultancy and product configuration in line with business requirements 
•	Develop solution prototypes to prove solution approach and design 
•	Provide quality assurance across solutions and client engagements as a value-add to the quality of solutions and deliverables 
•	Work in partnership with clients, advising them how to use information technology thus enabling them to meet their business objectives, overcome problems and gain an understanding of high-level technical concepts 
•	Work as a team player to ensure successful delivery
•	Be willing to share your knowledge with the wider team

Let’s talk about your capability and experience:

•	Be a specialist and have solid, proven experience in Microsoft Dynamics solutions relating to Finance management 
•	Have demonstrable experience leading consultation engagements with an excellent understanding of AX / D365 F&O and best practices 
•	Have a strong understanding of wider Microsoft technologies with the ability to present their benefits to existing and potential clients 
•	Be confident working directly with clients to gain a thorough understanding of their vision 
•	Excellent verbal and written communications skills with a focus on capturing requirements and use cases, developing a solution and articulating business value

Let's talk about what's in it for you!

At Capgemini, we help you get the future you want not only in your career but for your life, and your wider community. Here’s how:

Bring your whole self to work in an inclusive environment – our inclusive culture creates a safe place for our people to be themselves and truly belong at Capgemini. We are big on being active allies for everyone, celebrating special events and days of significance important to our people and instilling a genuine curiosity about one another. We actively champion our community groups like Women Capgemini, OutFront, Reconciliation action, parents and carers and Neurodiversity to name a few. We are proud to say we were named employer of the year for LGBTQ (lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer) inclusion and received the trans and gender diverse award at the 2021 Australian LGBTQ Inclusion Awards. 

Benefit from learning for life – we offer a huge variety of in-person and digital learning courses, partnering with leading providers like Pluralsight, Harvard Managementor, Harvard Spark and Coursera, offering external certifications and opportunities for you to grow. 

Have flexibility to work your way - we aim to build an environment where everyone can enjoy a positive work-life balance. We champion remote working – even though you’ll want to check out our beautiful offices - and are in the process of making ‘truly flexible’ working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people.

Contribute to society - we offer opportunities to use your skills to help society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution. Our CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility) program provides opportunities to give back to not for profit and social enterprise organisations aligned to our values. We also help our clients move towards more sustainable business models and are committed to becoming a netzero business by 2030. 
Comprehensive Benefits Program – this includes EAP, access to a medical network, financial assistance for relevant tertiary education, study leave, salary continuance insurance and an extensive discount and rewards program.

Committed to equal opportunities for all – we work to recruit and retain a talented and diverse workforce. We strongly encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age. 

For more on life at Capgemini and to hear from our own people, visit: https://www.capgemini.com/au-en/employee-stories/ 

Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered. 
Capgemini Australia has developed and manages, process orientated Management Systems compliant to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001 and ISO14001. We are committed to delivering secure solutions and services through state-of-the-art processes and continual improvement frameworks in line with industry best practices as well as contractual, statutory and regulatory requirements.

Name: Therapist and Clinical Consultant / Behaviour Support Practitioner
Description:
Our client is looking for the right person to join their Darwin team, no matter where you are located in Australia we are here to work with you if you are looking for a change. Our client has housing/accommodation available + are happy to pay for a one way ticket from wherever you might be relocating from. The entire package is negotiable. WE CAN HELP! 12 Month contract options are also available.

Our fantastic client is one of Australia's leading human services consultancies that is focused on providing customised support to people and agencies within the health and community services sector, including organisations focusing on:

- Supporting children, and youth
- Clients with a disability
- Persons/families with mental health support needs

Creating strong, collaborative relationships with individuals and organisations through communication and working together plays an integral part in our clients practice and ethos. Our Client is a registered NDIS provider in NSW, VIC, WA, ACT and NT.

Please see key responsibilities and role description below:

Experience with young people and trauma victims will be advantageous

MISSION, VISION, ETHOS of our Client:
• Act in accordance with the Ethos of the organisation at all times
• Maintain a high standard of professional conduct when dealing with internal and external stakeholders
• Contribute to the achievement of the strategic direction and goals of the organisation

Workplace Health and Safety:
• Contribute to a safe working environment by identifying risks and managing risks whenever possible
• Participate in workplace health safety procedures as required

Practice:
• Tertiary qualifications in Psychology or Social Work
• Establish positive, trusting rapport with clients
• Provide therapeutic intervention to a range of clients using evidence-based models
• Meet with clients regularly to provide their therapeutic sessions / intervention
• Prepare, write and deliver individualised treatment plans according to client needs and circumstances
• Provide updated therapy reports to service providers
• Adjust treatment plans as necessary
• Conduct ongoing assessment of client’s progress
• Involve and advise family / carers/ external services when necessary
• Maintain thorough notes of client sessions and progress
• Follow all safety protocols and maintain client confidentiality
• Contribute to practice by accomplishing related tasks as needed
• Attend regular therapy supervision
• Provide training in key areas
• Participate in work / other duties as may be reasonably required Inclusive to therapy role:
• Undertake specific assessments, such as adaptive functioning or NMT, using evidence-based tools as appropriate to the role and qualifications
• Working within a multidisciplinary team to provide comprehensive assessments such as FASD
• Undertake Lead Position when allocated
• Develop and provide group work to therapy clients with specific goals and outcomes
• Participate in other work/duties as may be reasonably required Secondary to the therapy role:
• Provide behavioural assessment and report of a client’s presenting issues and support needs and identify appropriate supports, interventions and recommendations
• Behaviour Support Plans and Risk Assessments
• Clinical Support
• Provide feedback and liaise with external agencies regarding individuals and teams, and/or report issues relating to risks and/or actions that may compromise the ethics, wellbeing and or professional standing of individuals, teams or agencies
 
Projects:
• Work within a project team in a cooperative and timely manner
• Participate within project team and assume responsibility for shared leadership
• Undertake Project Management as required

Internal Relationships:
• Work cooperatively to achieve a high standard of communication and collaboration with all staff working within the organisation, including the team of consultants, Portfolio Managers, and Administration staff
• Develop and maintain a supportive work environment for all staff working within the organization
• Share and contribute ideas, resources and skills with the broader team
• Attend and participate in meetings, reviews and committees as required

External Relationships:
• Ensure family / care teams / service providers are notified of any serious concerns relating to a client’s mental health / behaviour during a therapy session
• Follow the necessary protocols
• Provide any necessary support required
• Focus on building and maintaining relationships with external colleagues and services
• Collaborate and engage with relevant external stakeholders involved in projects or clinical tasks
• Be a positive representative of SAL Consulting Group at all times when liaising with external stakeholders as a consultant, promoting and maintaining our organisation’s reputation

Technical Skills & Knowledge:
• Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of complex trauma, mental health, acquired brain injury, cognitive impairment and disability for children, adolescents, and adults
• Demonstrated knowledge of neurodevelopmental, attachment and developmental trauma and its impact on a child, adolescent or adult’s presentation
• Demonstrated Knowledge of relevant state and federal based Disability legislation including the NDIS and Quality & Safeguarding Commission
• Understand the fundamental principles of Positive Behaviour Support
• Understand the rights of children, people with disabilities, people with mental health conditions, and people from diverse backgrounds, culture, gender and sexuality
• Professional Writing
• Presenting
• Teaching & Understanding of Child, adolescent & adult learning principles
• Change Management
• Current and valid Drivers Licence and ability and willingness to travel
• Professional Level Information Technology Skills

Emotional Intelligence Skills:
• Self-Awareness
• Self-Regulation
• Motivation
• Empathy
• Social Skills (Interpersonal, Communication)

Therapy Skills:
• Listening
• Observation
• Validation
• Empathy
• Critical thinking
• Non-judgemental
• Boundary setting
• Flexible approach
• Confidentiality
• Perception
• Affective modulation and expressiveness
• Warmth and acceptance
• Client feels understood
• Awareness of cultural differences

General Consultancy Skills:
• Undertake work in a timely, efficient manner meeting appropriate internal benchmarks as identified within supervision
• Problem Solving
• Analysis
• Decision Making
• Collaboration
• Teamwork (including working with a transdisciplinary team)
• Creativity
• Organisation
• Prioritisation
• Time Management
• Discipline
• Flexibility
• Adaptability
• Acquiring and Processing Knowledge
• Stress Tolerance
• Resilience
• Commercial awareness
• Ability to manage constructive feedback
• Growth Mindset

APPLY WITHIN 
EMAIL US : jobs@lhr.net.au
CALL US: (03) 500 200 30
VISIT US: www.labourhireandrecruitment.com.au

Name: Oracle Data & Analytics - Senior Consultant
Description:
From day one at our firm you'll be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word. Being part of an innovative and collaborative team will provide an existing environment to work in. Take part, contribute to innovations aimed at building solutions using emerging and cutting-edge technologies. Part technical, Part client facing. Flex your data and analytics skills in a supportive team as you watch your ideas come to life in solutions we offer clients! 
What will your typical day look like?As a systematic and inquisitive learner, you will find yourself continually growing and developing your career, specialising in data, analytics and reporting with all the resources Deloitte has to offer! As a subject matter expert, you will contribute with your deep understanding of the technology to drive solutions. As an emerging leader, you will be supporting junior staff in the team and help them grow as effective practitioners.
You will flex your natural "people" talent by forming authentic relationships with clients to understand and deliver their analytics and information requirements. This role is 50% technical and 50% client facing.
About the teamWelcome to Deloitte's Enterprise Application Team in Australia and meet our talented Oracle Consultants! No two days are the same as we leverage cutting-edge technologies such as Business Analytics, Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning and delivering our solutions through our strategic Partnership with Oracle Cloud to craft innovate business solutions for clients. 
Enough about us, let's talk about you.We're looking for someone with:

5+ years of experience in a professional services environment within the technical data and analytics domain.
Experience with enterprise data migration, data warehousing, data quality and analytics projects.
Experience with Oracle Analytics tools and methodologies. Including Oracle OBIEE, Oracle Analytics Cloud and BI Publisher.
Experience and knowledge with analytics components and design methodologies including Data Lake, Enterprise Data warehousing, Kimball methodology and dimensional modelling.
Experience with developing complex Oracle SQL queries and data models, data marts and conformed data models.
Use of 'traditional' data migration and analytics tools and techniques (e.g. SQL, Oracle, MySQL) and ETL software (e.g. Oracle Data Integrator, Azure Synapse).
Experience with multi-cloud architectures/ solutions for Analytics and Data management (e.g., Azure, AWS etc) will be an added advantage.  

Why Deloitte?Embracing people from different backgrounds and thinking styles is at the very core of Deloitte. We create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to be their best and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia's borders.
Next Steps
Sound exactly like the sort of role for you? Apply now! If you've got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact Ian Whitmore from the Talent Acquisition team. We'd love to hear from you!
The minimum salary requirement for this role is $95,000 inclusive of 10% superannuation.
Please click here to apply.

Name: Senior Consultant
Description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating many opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. Moreover, this is your chance to be part of the success story.



Position Summary:
Cognizant are seeking a Senior Business Analyst in the Life Insurance domain, to work within Cognizant’s Industry Consulting Team.

Mandatory Skills:
•	Required 15+ years as a Senior Business Consultant with primary experience in the Insurance domain.
•	A strong understanding of Life Insurance, Superannuation, Retirement Incomes, Corporate / Group Life Insurance, and General Insurance. Additional experience in the broader BFSI domain is welcomed.
•	Looking for an experienced candidate who has expertise in Life insurance, and General Insurance Policy Administration systems (including Mainframes, Client / Server, and Digital systems).
•	Expertise in different Policy Administration system such as IntegralLife, OIPA (Oracle Insurance Policy Administration).
•	Technical Experience in product configuration on Policy Administration systems.
•	Extremely strong Data Analysis Skills required.
•	Strong experience and expertise in Claims management systems to articulate business requirements for effective, efficient use by the Development and Test Teams.
•	Experience in documenting, and reviewing BRD, FRD, FSD in both Waterfall, and Agile formats.
•	Extensive knowledge in SQL, PLSQL scripts and project management tools such as JIRA, Rally, QC, RTC.
•	Good experience in reviewing Test scenarios, and cognitive execution of UAT testing (not simply following the bouncing ball).
•	Excellent Client Relationship and Stakeholder management skills.
•	Exceptional communication, documentation, and presentation skills.
•	Ability to problem-solve and think critically.
Duties and Responsibilities:
•	Review and analyse process documentation to ensure, and understand the organisation’s function, and capabilities. Also lead relevant research, and studies to understand, and support for developing comprehensive solution
•	Serve as liaison between Stakeholders - demonstrate understanding of business requirements, and operational processes to the Business Team
•	Provide recommendations and supporting data, to formulate a solid, logical and understandable business case
•	Provide appropriate business modeling techniques to represent and graphically depict various activities, processes and data which may include, but is not limited to:
?	Business process modeling
?	Process flow modeling
?	Data flow modeling
•	Lead the Team to achieve all parties agreement on new or existing requirements, process changes, and provide recommendation(s) for integration level changes
•	Consolidate business requirements, which includes functional, non-functional, and integration requirements, and obtain business Stakeholder review, and sign off
•	Conduct user story grooming sessions.
•	Review, and manage Product backlog, and prioritise, in conjunction with the Business, according to the project need
•	Review, and update sprint plan according to the client requirement
•	Conduct business value sessions
•	Conduct walkthrough sessions with Technical Team(s), and other project Team members to elicit and elucidate business requirements
•	Review, and update test cases, help in making the test plan, participate in triage meetings
•	Provide various recommendations as per industry best practices
•	Provide, and drive recommendation(s) on process change, and also proactively identify and address missed requirement(s)
•	Prepare, and maintain requirement traceability matrix, and requirement prioritisation for future release(s), and provide workarounds for interim solutions

Qualifications, and Certifications:
•	Bachelor, or Master’s degree
•	Project Management certification
•	Additional OTJ, or Industry certifications welcomed

Next steps 

If you feel this opportunity suits you, or Cognizant is the type of organization you would like to join, we want to have a conversation with you! Please apply directly with us. 

For a complete list of open opportunities with Cognizant, visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers 

Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Successful candidates will be required to undergo a background check.

Name: Sales Consultant
Description:
Established in 1982, Johnson’s Trucks is known for its quality sales, service and genuine parts. We are a Volvo, UD, Mack and Hino dealership with 40 years’ experience and success due to decade long partnerships with market leading brands and a commitment to the safety and culture towards our People, Suppliers & Customers. 

An exciting opportunity has become available for an experienced Sales Consultant to join our highly successful sales team. With an increased interest in Heavy Vehicles, we are seeking the right candidate to help build and strengthen our Sales Department. 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
•	Build on existing customer relationships through account management and utilising your excellent communication skills to maximise results
•	Achieve and succeed targets and profit levels
•	Maintain CRM data base producing reports accurately in a timely professional manner
•	Demonstrate a high level of customer satisfaction
•	Make high level account calls
•	Maintain up to date knowledge of all vehicles, accessories, financing options and promotions
•	Negotiate deals in a clear, concise, and highly ethical manner
•	Develop sales pipelines to generate quotes and proposals
•	Create and propose presentations to a wide range of customers

ABOUT YOU:
•	Industry knowledge and experience with truck or equipment sales
•	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
•	The ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment
•	Great time management and organisational skills
•	Proven strong sales achievements
•	Exhibit a strong ongoing motivated and supportive mindset
•	Outstanding customer service experience 

WHAT’S ON OFFER:
•	On-going training and support
•	Excellent working environment
•	Flexible working hours
•	Weekly pay
•	No Sunday trading

If this sounds like you.....APPLY TODAY!
note: only successful candidates will be contacted. Thank you.

Name: Principal Technical Consultant
Description:
Responsibilities

•	Work directly with customers to scope, gather, review, create, and implement their technical requirements and steer them towards the company’s best practice solutions.
•	In-depth, hands-on involvement directly with customers implementing the Calypso system.
•	Work directly with the customer project team implementing the company’s system and assist them in implementing their users’ requirements.
•	System installation, including Java JRE download and installation, relational database installation, data model installation and upgrade scripts, setup, and configuration of the event-driven framework, the configuration of real-time market data feed, etc. 
•	Follow up with the client’s end-users to validate the solution delivered, test the implementation, achieve signoff, and continue to move the system towards go-live.
•	Identify and raise approved core product gaps and follow-up using established internal processes until delivery.
•	Work with Calypso business analysts, Calypso core development, or customer development team to code prototypes of enhancements to ensure they will meet business requirements. 
•	During the development of enhancements, work with core development or customer development to iteratively test enhancements to ensure they meet business requirements.
•	Assist developers in understanding the API required to extend the Calypso system, add data to the Calypso system, and build interfaces between Calypso and external systems. 
•	Hands-on with the system, configuring it and testing it so that it meets the customer’s technical requirements. Assist in deployment and validation by the client. Work with Project Managers to set and manage customer expectations around project timelines. 
•	Manage technical issues, track the timeline of deliverables to keep the customer informed of progress, and assist customers with the development of their own internal project plans including identification of key setup and configuration tasks, scope considerations, timeline and scheduling, and resource requirements. 

Skills And Requirements

•	10+ years of experience working in systems or technical analysis, preferably in the capital markets industry with software including Java, Swing, JDBC, RMI, J2EE, Linux, Sybase, XML.
•	Strong GUI and server-side development.
•	Excellent object-oriented analysis, design & development skills.
•	Knowledge of relational databases and SQL including working experience with Sybase and/or Oracle.
•	Experience in developing or implementing software in support of any or all the following asset classes: credit derivatives, interest rate derivatives, equity derivatives, fixed income, or FX. 
•	Experience designing/building front-to-back capital markets trading systems. 

More About Us

Our Office:
Calypso Technology Pty. Ltd (now known as Adenza) creates and delivers market-leading solutions to help optimize investment, unlock value and drive incremental growth. Our end-to-end trading, treasury, risk management and regulatory compliance solutions enable financial institutions to consolidate and streamline their operations. We serve global, central and regional banks, broker-dealers, insurers, asset managers, pension funds, hedge funds, stock exchanges and clearing houses, securities services providers and corporates.

Why Apply:
Adenza’s mission to pioneer innovative technology offering efficient, accessible, and transparent, fully integrated solutions is only achievable due to our outstanding workforce. The fusion of deep technical knowledge with the element of human passion, understanding and energy is what makes Adenza’s employees exceptional. At Adenza, we offer great opportunities to collaborate on challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. As we continue our exciting growth trajectory, we recognize how important investing in the best talent across the globe is. Are you self-driven, innovative, execution-focused and customer centric? If yes, we want to invest in you. 

Adenza is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). We are dedicated to building and supporting a culture of diverse perspectives and talents as well as inclusivity to support individual growth and superior business results.

To apply, please send resume quoting reference KM2617 to calypso_jobs@calypso.com.

Name: Cloud Security Service Delivery Lead
Description:
Work onsite with one of Australia’s leading energy pioneers Contribute to one of their key IS-driven strategic initiatives Adelaide CBD location About the company Santos is one of the leading independent oil and gas producers in the Asia-Pacific region, supplying the energy needs of homes, businesses and major industries throughout Australia and Asia. Chandler Macleod supports the workforce needs of Santos, hiring and mobilising office and field-based professionals to Santos’ facilities across Australia.
