Specifically, this will include: Develop Cloud security requirements by evaluating business strategies and requirements; research information security standards; conduct system security and vulnerability analyses and risk assessments; study architecture/platform; identify integration issues; preparing cost estimates Lead security team operations in the Cloud environment, and manage competencies by planning the delivery of…

...Please follow the Website URL for the full details.

Name: Dynamics 365 F&O Principal Consultant
Description:
DXC helps enterprise and mid-market organisations to digitally transform their business and move to the cloud with cost-effective, rapid projects that offer lower risk and are delivered in a faster time to market using Microsoft applications.

We are dedicated to delivering business-improving software and solutions built on Microsoft Dynamics with the highest levels of customer service and support.

The largest independent Microsoft Dynamics partner in the world, the DXC team in Australia, New Zealand and the Pacific supports over 1,200 customer sites in the region. We specialise in new implementations and upgrades to cloud-based industry-specific solutions, powered by Microsoft Dynamics 365.

F&O Functional Senior Consultant / Principal Consultant
 
 
In this role you will be a part of large-scale, complex D365 implementations. You will be responsible for working with DXC customers and leading solution teams in planning, designing, building, testing, and maintaining Dynamics 365 implementations. 

Role Responsibilities
 

Work with the client to meet timelines, ensure quality and meet budget
Involved with the end-to end implementation, including scoping, design, configuration and testing
Analyse business processes and provide solutions
Continuously update business on implementation progress and problem resolution
Assist in system and business process re-engineering as required
Ensure technical design quality requirements are met

Experience Required
 

Extensive experience with Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations
Strong Consulting experience in the Microsoft eco-system including D365 F&O or AX 2012 R2, R3 full lifecycle implementations - specifically in Finance and/or Supply Chain and/or Retail
Experience with the Microsoft Power platform, specifically Power BI
Exceptional Consulting skills gained across multiple projects and industries
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage competing priorities in a complex environment
Ability to convey a strong presence, professional image, and deal confidently with complex technical problems
Client Centric attitude, with a sense of urgency, strong teamwork, flexible and positive ‘can do’ approach

Name: Lead Insights Consultant, FMCG
Description:
About the job
Since 2002, Quantium has combined the best of human and artificial intelligence to power possibilities for individuals, organisations and society. Whether it be building forecasting engines that are driving down food wastage or creating mapping tools to support targeted measures in combatting human trafficking, Quantium believes in better goods, services, experiences, and championing the benefits of data for a brighter future.

Our partnership with Woolworths means that we have unparalleled access to customer behaviour data of over 10 million customers that we leverage to provide insights for Woolworths and FMCG supplier clients.

The Role
This role sits within our passionate and friendly FMCG consulting team – we are going through a period of growth and with growth comes opportunity! We thrive within Quantium’s unique, fast-paced environment and we also know how to enjoy and celebrate our successes. Whilst our teams continue to work flexibly, this role is typically based in Quantium’s Sydney office with some travel required to client sites (normally 1 to 3 days per week depending on client’s needs).

This role sits within our passionate and friendly FMCG consulting team – we are going through a period of growth and with growth comes opportunity! We thrive within Quantium’s unique, fast-paced environment and we also know how to enjoy and celebrate our successes. Whilst our teams continue to work flexibly, this role is typically based in Quantium’s Sydney office with some travel required to client sites (normally 1 to 3 days per week depending on client’s needs).

As a Lead Consultant, you'll be directly responsible for managing a small team so previous experience managing is essential. You will also play a key role in driving our continued success, ensuring value is identified and delivered to our clients through Quantium’s unique and cutting-edge analytics solutions and bespoke projects.

You will have a flair for relationship management, an analytical mind, a thirst for understanding customers and thrive in a collaborative environment.

Key Responsibilities:
- Client management: manage your own portfolio of approximately ~3-4 clients; build and maintain working relationships with key client stakeholders. Clients may be small, medium or large; expectation to own and lead all clients with senior level stakeholder engagement
- Business development: upsell and cross sell projects and products to new and existing FMCG clients by actively building industry relationships, understanding client needs in detail and being willing to go the extra mile to create value for our client businesses
- Project delivery: able to juggle multiple complex project requirements, including both completing the analytical work yourself and leading cross-functional teams to bring ‘the best of Quantium’ to our clients
- Culture: contribute to a high-performing, dynamic and engaged culture with your creative ideas, knowledge and desire to make an impact
- People management and leadership for ~1-4 direct reports: providing technical support, managing career conversations and championing your teams career progression within Quantium

About you:
- Approximately 8+ years of experience within a related role leveraging data to generate insights that solve business problems
- Ideally, you will have experience within an FMCG / retail business in a buying, sales, category or an account management-related role
- We will also consider candidates with similar experience in a consulting environment, delivering analytical solutions within an FMCG context
- Knowledge and experience interpreting large quantitative data sets (e.g. customer and shopper data) and deriving relevant insights to solve commercial problems
- A strong business development and commercial mindset
- Excellent client leadership capability and confident presentation skills
- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and regularly changing environment, juggling multiple stakeholders and projects
- Loves collaborating within a supportive and high performing environment
- An active learner with an inquisitive mind and talent for problem solving
- Previous experience leading high performing teams
- Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline

More about Quantium
We are passionate about creating opportunities for ourselves and each other. You will have access to relevant, meaningful and actionable learning. No time wasters, no cheese, just the good stuff. We are growing our technical, professional and leadership capabilities through our robust internal learning curriculum, team knowledge-sharing sessions and our mentoring program.

Join our team of intelligent and fun people in an environment where colleagues quickly become friends. You might find our team working hard trying to solve tough, commercial problems for our clients or winding down with a drink in hand on a Friday afternoon. We also believe there is more to a successful career than just hard work and recognise the need to balance personal and family commitments with work. You'll also enjoy plenty of social events, including company overnight trips, and our offices are stocked with snacks and drinks all year round.

Quantium are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We are a multicultural team of various beliefs, sexual orientations and gender identities. We celebrate our diversity of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status and disability status.

Please note, this role is not suitable for Graduates. If you are a graduate and you’d like information about our Graduate Academy, please visit https://au.gradconnection.com/employers/quantium/about-us/

Name: Senior Environmental Consultant - Contaminated Sites
Description:
About us

We have recently joined forces with Golder, making WSP the largest environmental consulting firm globally, with over 14,000 environment professionals. Together, we can accelerate our global Environmental, Social & Governance vision, and make an impact on our built and natural environment.

The two firms coming together has strengthened our technical capabilities and is enabling like-minded professionals to collaborate more easily, better leverage technology and access a broader client base.



The Opportunity

As greenfield sites become scarce, there is a need to rehabilitate or repurpose existing or derelict sites for new uses.

As we're seeing significant growth in our projects value and pipeline, we’re looking for a Senior Environmental Scientist/ Engineer/ Consultant.

The location is flexible between Brisbane, Gold Coast or Sunshine Coast. We're also open to Townsville and Cairns where we have offices.

You will play a key role in delivering stimulating Contaminated Sites advisory projects, including environmental due diligence, portfolio assessment and advisory, risk assessment and mitigation, and remediation planning and implementation.

Day you day, you can expect to: 

Oversee contaminated land and groundwater field investigations with complex geological and hydro-geological problematic
Coordinate projects, including budget, scope, time, stakeholder communication and client relationships
Oversee contractors and take responsibility for safe, compliant and quality field works programs
Interrogate investigation data, develop conceptual site models and prepare technical reports and assessments
Review and approve the work produced by junior team members, providing coaching and mentorship
Foster strong relationships with existing clients and develop local relationships


Some of the key QLD projects we’ve recently been involved in:

Gold Coast Council Surface Water and Landfill Gas Monitoring Programs – sample collection in over 50 locations from a boat or kayak throughout several recreational lakes, and digital recording of field parameters
RAAF Base Townsville/ Lavarack Barracks PFAS Investigations – regulatory compliance investigations, development of monitoring programs and design/implementation of remedial options
Cairns Airport – Multiple different projects including environmental monitoring, PFAS assessment, hydrocarbons management, risk assessments and due diligence.
Other – Acid Sulfate Soil investigations, Environmental Due Diligence (mergers and acquisitions), Statistical analysis of groundwater monitoring data, Landfills investigation, management, contamination management plans for construction projects, remediation action plans.


What we'll love about you

You’re enthusiastic, reliable and great at building collaborative working relationships.

You will typically have 7-15 years of experience in delivering (substantial) projects.

We specifically seek individuals with:

Knowledge of soil contaminants and remediation strategies
An understanding of the obligations associated with the role of Principal Contractor under WHS Regulations
Broad knowledge of contaminated land site sampling technique, investigation methodologies and remediation technologies for groundwater, soil and gas
Understanding of local regulations pertaining to the management of contaminated sites
A desire to mentor and train junior staff and grow local business
Tertiary qualifications in environmental science/ engineering, chemistry, biology, geology or related
A current Australian Driver’s License
 

What we will offer you

At WSP we provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many personal and professional development opportunities that are aimed to help you deliver your best self to the role whilst managing your personal life in balance. We have been recognised for the second consecutive year as a Great Place to Work® with year-on-year increases in employee engagement.

Some of the many benefits we offer our employees include:

Flexible working hours and working from home
Global mobility
Parental leave & purchased additional annual leave
Corporate employee discounts and offers
Salary continuance insurance
Wellness at work & social club
Workplace giving /volunteering
Employee reward & recognition program
Professional and technical development opportunities

Name: Principal Consultant
Description:
About us:
We are Wipro (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO), a rapidly expanding and leading global Information Technology, Consulting and Business Process Services company with over 200,000 employees worldwide, servicing clients in 175+ cities across 6 continents. For more information, please visit www.wipro.com

With over 2,000 employees in Australia, we are committed to increasing localization. We serve over 75 customers across diverse industry segments, with at least a third listed in the 100 ASX. We started our journey in Australia over 15 years ago and this has been a pioneer of new age, disruptive and transformative innovations. We believe in the power of diversity in the workforce, and we encourage applications from people of all diverse backgrounds, with focus including, but not limited to Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islanders, Women in Technology, Sex/Gender diversity, disability, racial & cultural diversity, sexual orientation + others.


To be successful in this role you will:

ANZ's card transaction and settlement platform is part of the ANZ Card Switch Solution, and handles both real-time and batch transaction processing. The team need a new developer who can enhance and support the platform within the wider context of the overall Switch System.
Candidate will also be expected to have active involvement with other roles in the SDLC including design, analysis, testing and support.
A desire to own a problem from end to end is a valued attribute.
The primary development language is Java, and familiarity with SQL is also assumed.

Desirable technical experience in one or more of the following is advantageous: Spring, Camel, Maven, Concordian, Groovy, LiquiBase, urbanCode Deploy (uDeploy), Oracle SQL and Jenkins, CI/CD, AS2805.

If you only meet some of the requirements for this role, that's okay!!! We value a diverse range of backgrounds & ideas and believe this is fundamental for our future success. So, if you have the curiosity to learn and the willingness to teach what you know, we'd love to hear from you.


Positions Flashed : 5

Name: ICT Security Specialist
Description:
Manvision Consulting provides IT Contracting and Professional Services to the Australian Market since 2008. Join a talented team and work in a culture that stimulates an inclusive and flexible work environment, offering opportunities to grow and contribute to the company.
Roles and responsibilities:
•	Setup Identity Access Management by integrating the access to the root directory for users.
•	Setup Network intrusion detection system, logging system and intrusion prevention system.
•	Implement security policies as outlined by the corporate security policies and government policies.
•	Building SOD policies and implementing identity life cycle management requirements.
•	Conduct regular audits of the assets being used, logs of usage, incidents tracking & management and database, application access, and rest of the IT infrastructure.
•	Perform vulnerability tests of the firewalls.
•	Conduct risk assessment for client infrastructure security requirements.
•	Implementing and testing security protocols for ongoing projects.
•	Design and implementation of disaster recovery plans from a security perspective.
•	Firewall planning, installation, and management of the client data centres.
•	Deliver on HLD and LLD of the Network Security Solution for data centres.
•	Plan, investigate, set up, and test implementation of VPN, WAN, LAN, and other related devices.
•	Design certification authorities and digital signatures.
•	Help clients in due diligence for WAN Rationalization and DC Transformation
Key Requirements:
•	Applicants must have a minimum of 5 years of work experience in IT security. Must have experience in working, investigating, setup, and testing the implementation of VPN, WAN, LAN, and other related devices. Strong knowledge of Network and Systems Security. Proficient with MAC and OS.
•	Ability to communicate clearly verbally and written with cross-functional teams and external stakeholders
•	Extensive experience within the application and web security
•	Expertise with security tools – static code analysis and vulnerability scanning
•	Provide direction and consultation to development teams, providing security services and influencing change to positively impact the security posture of the organization.
•	Work autonomously within Security; uplifting secure coding practice, through training and education programs delivered to colleagues working in the delivery of change.
•	Build networks and strong working relationships with colleagues, and been seen as a trusted provider of application security services and advice.

This role is a Full-Time Salary of $70,000 - $100,000 per annum. Citizens and Permanent Residents are preferred. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
Patrese People are a boutique recruitment company offering both temporary and permanent recruitment options, coupled with a variety of HR Solutions.
 
We are a generalist recruiter providing commercial staff across most sectors ranging from administrators, sales, middle to senior management. Recruiting nationally, our aim is to find the right people for the right jobs and you will see by our Google reviews we have an outstanding reputation.
 
Our team is small, friendly and motivated for success with customer service at the forefront of all that we do. We have excellent process and systems to ensure we are efficient and well equipped to deliver on our client expectations. If you are a passionate and experienced recruiter with the career aspirations of managing of your own division - this is the opportunity you have been waiting for.
 
The role
 
Due to continued growth, we are looking for another Recruitment Consultant to join our team, with a focus on growing our existing temporary division, whilst managing some permanent placements. This is a 360 role where you will be developing new business and fulfilling your client requirements, with the support of team resourcers.
 
Key responsibilities
 
Job/ Candidate Management - you will manage the recruitment process from start to finish including:
• Advertising job vacancies and posting to job boards and social media sites
• Shortlist, telephone screen & interview suitable applicants to ensure suitability
• Present employment conditions & pay rates to candidates to ensure they are the right match to the job
• Maintain accurate database records, including candidates files, vacancies and employers to ensure descriptions, proof of working rights, salary information etc is all recorded accurately.
• Arrange inductions for workers as and where required
• Liaise and advise management accordingly regarding performance and HR issues with workers.
• Direct and train resourcers to maximise candidate / applicant numbers and ensure the candidate availability list is managed
 Client Relationship Management
• Liaise with employers to understand their needs and Identify areas of growth with client/business relationships
• Negotiate with employers on behalf of candidates with regards to the package and benefits being offered, as and when required
• Attend appointments and present services to potential clients
• Assess clients’ requirements and respond accordingly with an appropriate solution Quote clients by interpreting award / legislation
• Devise strategic, targeted, and quantifiable marketing & promotional campaigns; both digital & non-digital
• Network to build business relationships that can be converted into commercial opportunities
• Manage your desk, including budgeting and forecasting and business planning
 
The ideal candidate
 
We are looking for someone who is an accomplished recruiter, someone capable of growing a warm desk and taking it to the next level.

• You must have previous experience working as a recruitment consultant- ideally in an agency although Internal Recruiters may be considered.
• A proven track record of managing candidates and writing job adverts
• You will have previous experience interpretating awards
• An understanding / previous sales experience in the recruitment industry – within the temp / labour hire market ideally
• Good computer skill and good working knowledge of Applicant tracking systems
• Strong and proven track record in sales, networking and/or client development abilities
• Excellent time management and organisational skills
• Strong commercial business acumen – Someone who knows how to grow a business is highly advantageous
• Previous management experience would be highly regarded, to grow your desk and a team in the future
• A passionate desire to succeed and build a successful career
• A winning mentality and the ability to negotiate and close the deal
• Ability to work together to further grow Patrese People’s good reputation

 Benefits
• Full time opportunity
• Office hours – no weekends
• Good bonus structure & package available
• Birthday – day off

If you have the passion to succeed and want to join an expanding business, please send your resume and shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

 Apply Now

Name: Senior Consultant
Description:

Sharp & Carter is a specialist recruitment agency that was established in 2009. Name: Manager Strategic Insights / Consultant
Description:
Our Company: Faethm by Pearson is an augmented analytics platform that provides scenario-driven predictive analytics on the impact of external trends on the workforce. Our SaaS AI-driven capability is the world’s data source for navigating external impacts like AI/ robotic technologies, the evolution of work, and Covid-19 on the workforce. Our data, analytics and insights help clients evaluate the impact of these trends on any economy, industry, organisation, or job to suggest viable transition pathways for impacted employees into 'future proof' career pathways.

The role: As Manager, Strategic Insights at Faethm, you will help structure and solve complex issues regarding the future of work. You will work together across customer insights, product, and data science teams to provide knowledge assets, analysis, and expert advisory to internal and external clients. You will provide expertise and insights on responsible automation, technology adoption and disruption. 

The role requires the typical management consultant skill set, as well as originating research ideas. Some weeks, you will support the Data Science team in developing existing and new intellectual property and knowledge assets, while others might ‘go deep’ on a single problem for a specific client, sometimes directly with the client counterparts. As a Manager, you will take responsibility for delivering projects and managing a team of analysts. Most of your projects, however, will be internal facing, with some external client engagement.

You will be contributing directly to equipping our clients with data and research-led insights to enable them to navigate the future of work.

What you will do:

You will manage a team of research analysts and be responsible for working on internal and external client engagements, building strong customer relationships for client engagements, and supporting the delivery of insights.
You will assess different areas of the future of work and identify opportunities for improvement. You can expect to work with top tier clients, ranging from government to industry, and address complex future of work, emerging technologies and upskilling and reskilling of their workforce, as well as internal teams, solving equally important and challenging problems.
You will engage in research ranging from new technologies and trends to the development of future economic scenarios and models.
You will be helping clients interpret and understand methodologies and solutions applied to organisational design, future scenarios, and technology roadmaps.
You will assist both internal and external clients in understanding how to implement recommendations.
You will manage, analyse, and present data (primarily excel based). Quantitative and qualitative analysis will come through life through your visualisations.
Collaborate with internal teams to create, develop, and bring to life new features or products and continue to shape Faethm’s evolution.
You will build strong stakeholder relationships across the organisation and effectively communicate technical and complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
 
To be successful in this role, ideally, you will have:

An MBA or other advanced business or analytics degree
3-6 years of consulting experience across workforce transformation
Prior consulting experience has included working with human resource data and projects in strategic workforce planning, economic scenario modelling and technology maturity assessment
Knowledge and interest in emerging technologies
Exceptional time management and presentation skills, as well as analytical, problem-solving, and research skills
Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, written and verbal
Ability to navigate complexity and ambiguity
Flexibility, openness to new things and ability to propose innovative ideas
Ability to work in a growing and dynamic environment with integrity and a sense of humour
 
Join Faethm and you will: Work for an inventive, purpose-driven and civic-minded company with an ambitious but realisable mission and vision that tackles a very real and globally important issue. People are our secret sauce. So what are you waiting for? Come and work with an amazing team of professionals, in an autonomous, agile, yet supportive and flexible environment.

Faethm is an equal opportunity employer. We find excellence in diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

"All data is handled in accordance with Faethm's privacy policy."

Name: Recruitment Consultant
Description:
ABOUT US

Beaumont's charity team was set up in 2009 in order to offer charitable organisations Beaumont People's full-service recruitment model at a fee that is much more affordable to our charity clients. The sector response has been overwhelming and we have steadily grown from a team of 1 to 14 people as a result. We are proud to have saved charitable organisations almost $30,000,000 in recruitment fees to date while also maintaining steady growth and market share. 


ABOUT THE ROLE

We are currently looking for a Recruitment Consultant to join a team of passionate, driven and accomplished Consultants and Senior Consultants within our Charity Division. 

The Consultants on this team recruit permanent Fundraising positions within the Charity Sector. 

As we continue to grow we are looking for a team player to join us on this very busy and established desk. 

This potentially could be that next opportunity for you if: 
You have full-service recruitment experience and a recruitment style that is engaging and consultative
You want to feel more connection with the work you are doing and feel like you would like to give back to the community through your professional work
You have impeccable communication skills and enjoy both verbal and written interaction with people
You are a fast, methodical worker with a focus on positive long term outcomes
You have a warm engaging personality and enjoy interacting with people at every level
You pride yourself on the depth of your customer care
You enjoy working autonomously and consider yourself to be a self-starter

ABOUT YOU

Ideally, we are looking for an experienced Consultant who has a real interest in recruiting a variety of Marketing or Fundraising positions. 

This is a role that will require you to develop relationships and manage the end to end recruitment process of multiple roles in the Charity sector within a successful, energetic and experienced team. 

You will have a competitive base salary and opportunity to earn uncapped commission. In accordance with this, you will set your own activity level and be expected to manage your own priorities, as micromanagement isn’t our thing. 


CULTURE AND BENEFITS

We take our culture seriously at Beaumont People and believe it’s critical to our success. We ensure our team thrive, not just survive and do this through a generous benefits programme, a high performance but mature culture, significant value adds for our clients and candidates as well as ourselves, and ensuring we have a lot of fun along the way!

Key benefits include:
Competitive salary, monthly paid bonus structure
Paid Parental Leave benefits
Flexible work environment, (with the opportunity to work part-time, work from home, have a flexible start time, etc)
Additional annual leave available based on tenure
Three days of paid volunteering days within the year to make a difference within the community
Performance based incentives such as bonuses and yearly trips (for example a trip to Hamilton Island)
Significant training and development
Health and well-being programme
If you are interested in this role and align with our purpose and mission, please get in touch with Taylor Sharp - our People & Culture Lead, OR apply now!

taylor@beaumontpeople.com.au

Name: Security Guard
Description:
State-of-the-Art facilities
$29.38/hr plus casual 25% loading
Casual Role - minimum 2 shifts per week

It's not every day you get to join a hospital team with a commitment of excellence housed within a spectacular new facility.  About the role
The Gold Coast Private Hospital is currently seeking an experienced Security Officer on a casual basis to maintain and evaluate security procedures across the hospital.  Key Responsibilities
This position operates in a hands on roll across the hospital site. The Security Officer will be responsible for delivering all aspects of the Security service including but not limited to;

Undertaking duties in compliance with GCPH Policies and procedures
Compliance with the daily duties lists
Staff liaison identification and access cards
Compliance with rosters
Chief fire warden duties
Contractor management
Building management system monitoring

About us  Our 336 bed, 22 operating theatre facility is conveniently co-located with the Gold Coast University Hospital and Griffith University, forming part of a truly unique healthcare and education precinct.  At Gold Coast Private Hospital, we offer flexible work arrangements, ongoing learning, a comprehensive range of career pathways across specialties and a truly rewarding working experience.  Essential Criteria:

Experience as a Security Officer in a Healthcare or a similar environment.
Hold a current QLD Security License (Guarding/Monitoring\Crowd Controll)
A Certificate III in security
Evidence of Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office and general computer programs relevant to the role
Excellent customer service skills
Current first aid/CPR certificate

Highly Desirable:

Knowledge and experience in security management systems including access control and CCTV system
Knowledge and experience of building management systems, monitoring and reporting
Knowledge and experience in fire warden duties and fire indicator panel
Initiative and proactive persona

Why Healthscope? As the only national private hospital operator and healthcare provider in Australia, our 42 sites are supported by our central Support Office, enabling them to provide an exceptional experience for the communities we care for. Healthscope opens the door to endless opportunities for our people, giving them the flexibility to work across one or multiple hospitals across our network.  Come and be the difference in our patient's lives.  Applications close: 27th June, 2022  To Apply: Please click on the 'Apply' button to be taken to our online application form. For any questions, please reach out to  More Information: Our commitment to quality and safety for our patients, staff and visitors is our highest priority. Applicants will be required to provide a current National Police check, WWCC (where applicable) and Evidence of right to work in Australia prior to appointment. Staff in patient contact roles will be required to provide proof of immunity to specified infectious diseases as a Category A Healthcare worker. Please click here to apply.

Name: eDiscovery Consultant
Description:
TIMG is one of Australia’s great innovators, delivering smart and secure information management solutions to Australia’s best and brightest companies. We are now seeking a motivated and consultative focussed individual to join our eDiscovery team. 

Located out of our central Brisbane based facilities, this role will see you as being responsible for assisting in the growth of the business across eDiscovery services. The Successful candidates will be an integral member of the eDiscovery team. 

In this role you will be responsible for engaging with established clients as well as generating new sales opportunities including researching and prospecting potential clients, aiming to introduce our business and set up our consulting team to manage the relationships.

The successful candidate will have an open mind promoting the company's service and brand. To be successful in this position you will have previous legal industry experience as well as face to face sales experience with a focus on new business.
 
Must haves:
•	A minimum of 3 years' relevant industry experience
•	A legal background
•	Certifications in Nuix and Relativity
 
Requirements of the role – What to highlight in your application.
•	A track record of winning new business
•	Experience pre- and post- sales support
•	Experience preparing and providing quotes
•	Project management of implementations and suppliers
•	The ability to be innovative and look to improve offerings and solutions
•	Previous experience training staff on new products and solutions
•	Understanding of the Australian legal and corporate market to ID opportunities
•	Experience establishing key contacts and maintaining an active network
•	Experience prospecting and qualifying leads
•	Being well versed in successful and winning sales strategies
 
In addition, your role & responsibilities will include:
•	Work Closely with the eDiscovery team to implement solutions
•	Positioning the product suite to business and technical customers, management and executive staff
•	Document solutions for clients
•	Attend Management and sales meetings as required (weekly or more)
•	Maintain knowledge on new products and services, competitive products and services and other general market information of interest or value to customers.
•	Develop strong working relationships and rapport with key clients. Manage key accounts by analysing client sales against forecast and highlighting trends and exceptions to the TIMG Management Team as often as required by TIMG. 
 
In return we offer:
A growth position with an existing experienced team offering a base salary of $105,000 - $115,000. Being a part of a large organisation with group benefits from different career and location opportunities to an employee discount program including discounts with major retails.

If this sounds like you, please follow the apply link and fill out our application form.

Name: Vulnerability Engineer (Cyber Security / Penetration Testing)
Description:
SUMMARY: 

We are a diverse collection of thinkers and doers, continually re-imagining our products, systems, and practices to help people do what they love in new ways. This is a deeply reciprocal place, where everything we build is the result of people in different roles and teams working together to make each other’s ideas stronger. That same real passion for innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices, strengthening our dedication to leave the world better than we found it!
Apple is seeking an outstanding Information Security Engineer to support our vulnerability response program in Australia. This is a technical hands-on role in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. You’ll be working with various application and system owners to report vulnerabilities, to drive remediations, and also to improve our current processes. 


KEY QUALIFICATIONS: 
•	Self-Starter and okay with working remotely and supporting a global team
•	Ability to track and lead numerous parallel activities
•	Passionate about keeping our customers data safe
•	Good English communication skills
•	Driven to automate and improve continuously
•	Familiarity with common security vulnerabilities and the ability to judge their severity and impact to the business
•	High standard of ethics
•	Excellent knowledge of large-scale security solutions integration
•	Knowledge of the security research community is a strong plus
•	Demonstrable understanding of IPv4 and IPV6 networks
•	Very good understanding of vulnerability scanning tools
•	Skills and Experience with either Python, Go, Rust, and/or Bash scripting
•	Experience with SQL and Linux
•	Experience on Web Services
•	Experience implementing solutions in the cloud
•	Experience with big data
•	Requirement for on-call rotation, which includes weekends
•	International travel will be occasionally required


DESCRIPTION: 
You will join a team that passionately stays up to date on emerging security vulnerabilities and threats, keeps a cool head in crisis, and advocates every single day for improving the security of Apple products and services. You will need to have a good technical background, superb communication skills, and a strong interest in network, system, and web security. The role also requires a demonstrable ability to work with incomplete information and to adapt to changing priorities. Specific responsibilities include: 
•	Strategize vulnerability management for application and business teams
•	Author clear, authoritative responses to vulnerability inquiries
•	Provide guidance to engineering teams regarding the impact of security issues
•	Work closely with project management to drive issues to closure


EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:
•	BS in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Security, or related field
•	Experience in Information security or related field 
•	Requires more than 7 years of experience


ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
•	Experience in Information Security Engineering 
•	Experience in Unix/Linux systems engineering background
Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Name: Consultant Psychiatrist, Early in Life Mental Health Services
Description:
About Monash Health

Monash Health is an impressive organisation of seven public hospitals, 21 community health sites, five aged care facilities, university affiliated international research and tertiary education. We provide healthcare for the entire lifespan from pre-birth to palliative care and all stages in between, and we have recently opened the new 230-bed Monash Children's Hospital.

About Monash Doctors

There are more than 900 Junior Medical staff positions at Monash Health in over 200 medical specialties, to help grow your career. We offer unparalleled opportunities in Victoria's largest & most clinically diverse teaching health service.

About ELMHS

ELMHS provides a range of mental health services to pregnant mothers, infants, children, adolescents and their families within the Southern Region.

The organisational and clinical model has been developed to provide mental health care that is flexible and responsive to the individual and developmental needs of the perinatal to adolescents populations and their families. As such, this model will support the provision of integrated mental health care for young people, guided by consistent, service-wide protocols and principles of care.

About the Role

 The Early in Life Mental Health Service of Monash Health's Mental Health Program is seeking a dynamic, experienced psychiatrist for 1.0 eft consultant psychiatrist position. This position is to cover various community teams across ELMHS. The successful consultant psychiatrist would be working with a multidisciplinary team. The consultant psychiatrist position provides high-level psychiatric services within their approved scope of clinical practice as part of the Monash Health Mental Health Program at Monash Health. This is a senior Medical Position and carries with it the professional responsibilities of clinical leadership, teaching and training as well as administrative requirements. 

About you 

Applications should include an up to date Curriculum Vitae and the names of three professional referees. Applicants must hold FRANZCP or equivalent, be registrable in Victoria. A Certificate in Child & Adolescent Psychiatry (Mindful) or equivalent is desirable but not essential. 

What You Need 

Relevant Qualification – RANZCP Fellowship
Demonstrated experience (aligned to position description noting no reference to years of experience)
Current AHPRA registration
Include any other mandatory/required skills or licenses
Australian working rights 
What We Offer 

access to Monash Health in-house learning portals to further expand your acute clinical skills & knowledge base
avenues to further develop your leadership & project management skills
mentorship & career guidance
support to attend relevant forums & conferences
a supportive learning environment, should you wish to undertake postgraduate studies
Monash Health recognises the value of equal employment opportunity and is committed to patient safety and promoting fairness, equity and diversity in the workplace. At Monash Health we are relentless in our pursuit of excellence and work to our six guiding principles.

Applications will only be accepted via the Monash Health online Mercury System only. Email applications will not be considered.

Existing Monash Health Employees should apply using your Monash Health employee account. For any queries regarding employee accounts contact Recruitment Services by email – recruitment@monashhealth.org.

Offers of employment can only be made once all required probity checks have been completed. These include:

reference checks;
a clear Police Check conducted within the last three months;
a current Victorian Employee Working with Children’s Check (or proof of payment for same);and
proof of immunisation.
A request to conduct probity checks does not guarantee that an offer of employment will be made.

As part of our selection process, you may be invited by email to participate in an on-camera video interview.

Under the Victorian Public Health orders, all employees working within the Public Health system must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and are required to provide acceptable evidence of their vaccination status. The current orders require evidence of three doses.
All applicants to positions with Monash Health will need to upload acceptable evidence of full vaccination against COVID-19 as part of their application. Acceptable evidence is a copy of your Immunisation History Statement or your COVID-19 Digital Certificate, which can be accessed via MyGov.

Please feel free to contact us directly to explore your suitability for this position prior to submitting an application -

Enquiries to Dr Michael Gordon Unit Head - Child, Adolescent & Family Stream, ELMHS ph 95941300

Name: Senior Business Consultant
Description:
BluJay Solutions, now part of E2open, is a leading provider of cloud-based, on-demand software solutions enabling enterprises to procure, manufacture, sell, and distribute products more efficiently through collaborative execution across global trading networks. Brand owners use E2open solutions to gain visibility into and control over their trading networks through the real-time information, integrated business processes, and advanced analytics that E2open provides. E2open customers include Bosch, Cisco, Dell, Shell, IBM, L'Oréal, Unilever, Procter & Gamble, Seagate, HP, Canon and Vodafone. E2open is headquartered in Austin, Texas with operations worldwide. 

BluJay Solutions (Australia) Pty Ltd currently searching to fill a full-time position of Senior Business Consultant located in Melbourne. The Senior Business Consultant will be part of our Professional Services team to help guide customers to establish effective processes and steer the direction for the solution implementation for large programs. 

The tasks of this role include the following: 

•	Identify and communicate with customers to formulate and produce appropriate requirements specification to create system and software solutions for the customer for the implementation of the E2open software
•	Responsible for a small number of our large multi-national clients running supply chain transformation programs, guiding these clients through the solutioning process to identify business priorities, shape the customers’ supply chain roadmap and choose the best fit of our software modules
•	Work closely with our clients to review and optimize solutions for customer specific business problems 
•	Collaborate with our project teams and steer the project as necessary during its lifecycle
•	Create presentations and lead discussions with customer stakeholders 
•	Keep abreast of industry trends, competition, and new opportunities
•	Analyse client’s requirements for their business process management initiatives and e2open deployment, acting as a central reference and information source, providing guidance and assistance in the system project decision making process
•	Travel approximately 20-30% of the time to customer sites / workshops across Europe

Skills and experience required for the position:
·	Bachelor Degree in Business Intelligence
·	Supply chain experience from business operations or consulting engagements paired with excellent communication skills and ability to guide our clients in various supply chain areas and processes 
·	10 years plus of experience in in IT supply chain management projects, out of which 5+ years in consulting, with exposure to multiple different processes such as Supply Chain Network Planning, Demand Planning, Forecasting, Forecast Collaboration, Channel management, Order to Invoice, Purchase to Pay, Inventory Management, Demand Sensing
·	5 years plus experience as business consultant (including project management, design, testing, training, business stakeholder) in software deployment projects is a plus 
·	Strong analytical skills and business acumen
·	Strong communication skills
·	Thorough experience in giving presentations
·	Willingness to travel

If you meet this profile and you would like to work with E2open, please send your application to andrew.howison@e2open.com

Name: Consultant/ETL Developer
Description: Description: Develop, unit test and deploy Ab Initio components and miscellaneous technical components. Ensure Ab Initio code base is appropriately engineered to maintain current functionality and development adheres to performance optimization, interoperability standards and requirements, and compliance with client IT governance policies. Conduct database programming, performance tuning, relational model analysis and data migration. Execute appropriate changes and recheck programs to ensure that desired results are produced. Prepare trial runs of programs and software applications to confirm that desired information and instructions are produced. Contribute to the technical design documents, Use Cases, test cases and User Manuals for various projects. Must have a Bachelor’s degree in computer sc. or related + 2 yrs. experience or related. Salary between $80,000-$140,000 commensurate with education and experience. Send resume to Incandescent Australia, 201 Sussex Street Level, Darling Park L20 T2, Sydney, NSW 2000 or admin@itidata.com Positions in Sydney & Melbourne.

Name: Senior Recruitment Consultant – Engineering
Description:
Join the Titan Family 
Our service delivery is underpinned by traditional values and an innovative approach to help clients, candidates and staff achieve their goals: 

 
	 Integrity - we do the right thing when nobody is watching 
	 Passion - we take pride in what we do and have a genuine enthusiasm for work and life 
	 Innovation - we explore new ideas and embrace change allowing us to grow and reinvent ourselves 
	 Knowledge - we apply current events and changing trends towards best practice 
 

 The Team 
Our Resources & Energy Team work to provide white collar professionals primarily to the Mining, Oil & Gas, Power and Renewables markets. 

 
	 We work on Hybrid desks with consultants working both contract and permanent vacancies 
	 We manage a large contractor workforce 
	 We have large and small accounts with mostly repeat clients 
	 We strive to be innovative and proactive in all we do with a big care factor for the results we achieve for our clients and candidates. 
 

 Titan have an established framework that allows driven individuals to achieve their targets and be rewarded with a competitive incentive package, attractive salary and mentorship from our Leadership Team. Our environment maintains a strong balance between competition and support, while encouraging autonomy to achieve and accountability to represent Titan and your personal brand. While our focus is on both permanent and contract recruitment, we go above and beyond with candidate and contractor care as well as client engagement initiatives.  

 Job Tasks and Responsibilities 

 
	 Complete all daily and weekly activities diligently 
	 Interviewing, References and Candidate calls 
	 Client Business Development and Account Management calls 
	 Post advertisements and Maintain a social media presence 
	 Undertake creative and innovative search techniques as part of your daily job 
	 Complete compliance tasks and due diligence requirements 
	 Effectively manage your Job Vacancies with an innovative approach and keep stakeholders informed of progress at all times 
	 Ensure effective records keeping 
	 Ensure awareness of risk and commercial issues are handled diligently and proactively. 
	 Negotiate terms of business with clients to ensure a positive working framework 
 

 Key Criteria 

 
	 Demonstrated understanding of the recruiting process, across the entire life-cycle. 
	 Ensure satisfaction with all parties involved. 
	 Effective delivery of quality service within your discipline. 
	 5 year experience with agency white collar recruitment is a minimum requirement for this position and will be highly valued, along with confidence and ability to work autonomously within a mature and driven team; experience within Engineering industry preferred but not mandatory. 
 

 What's on Offer? 

 
	 Salary Package - $85,000 - $100,000 depending on experience 
	 A contractor base to get you going quickly towards your target 
	 Excellent competitive Incentive System 
	 To support and maximise your efficiency and success, we offer the best management tools and systems in the market 
	 Hot desk of clients, candidates and jobs 
	 Flexible Working Environment 
	 Knowledgeable and established management team 
	 Personal development and career advancement opportunities 
	 Unique CRM, ATS and online, sourcing tools 
	 Extensive database of candidates and talent pools built and maintained over two decades 
	 Operational support for resume, contract and general administration 
	 Marketing support to assist with online, social media and brand initiatives 
	 Modern, serviced CBD Office 
 

 For a confidential discussion on this position please contact Craig Van Heurck on 08 6467 0611 or 0408 898 700  or click ‘Apply Now'. 

 About Us 
Titan Recruitment has been delivering complete, innovative and effective recruitment solutions across Australia for over two decades and is recognised as a leading Engineering and Technology recruitment and contracting specialist. Our service delivery is underpinned by traditional values and an innovative approach to help clients, contractors and candidates achieve their goals. 

 Titan Recruitment is an advocate for Equal Employment Opportunity, and we encourage applications from all interested applicants.

Name: Principal/Senior Human Factors Consultant - Brisbane
Description:
Role available for Principal consultant 
	 Play a key role in exciting rail, transportation & other engineering projects 
	 Friendly, dynamic engineering and management consultancy         
 

 About Acmena 
Acmena is an engineering consultancy working in the transportation and other safety-critical systems sectors. We specialise in the integration of systems and software engineering methodologies, including human factors and system safety, with practical program delivery. Our clients include government transport agencies and key project delivery organisations. 
  
 About the role   
You will be responsible for the efficient delivery of high quality human factors / human systems engineering services to clients, particularly in the area of human factors integration. You will engage and manage stakeholders, elicit requirements, apply appropriate human factors methods and techniques pragmatically, and develop human factors integration plans, analysis and evaluation reports and human factors issues logs as evidence of human factors integration. 

 You will exercise a high degree of independence in approach, using considerable originality, ingenuity and judgment to formulate solutions or resolve complex human factors issues. Your work products will be accurate and authoritative, requiring minimal supervision to achieve successful outcomes for our clients.   

 You will help develop and grow the business by assisting with tender and sales activities, identifying opportunities for new or follow-on work, following up leads, and fostering good relationships with clients and potential clients. 
  
 Essential Requirements :  

 
	 Degree in human factors or ergonomics or a related field 
	 Minimum of 7 years’ experience. 
	 Good knowledge and understanding of human factors integration processes and standards 
	 Advanced skills and experience with the following:
	 
		 Planning for and managing human factors activities across the project lifecycle 
		 Establishing and documenting contexts of use / concept of operations, and human factors / user requirements 
		 Research and benchmarking 
		 Stakeholder and user engagement, including workshop facilitation and training 
		 Human factors methods including task analysis, human error identification, communications analysis, training needs analysis 
		 Iterative design evaluation, including physical ergonomic assessments, HCI evaluation, implementation prototyping and usability trials   
	 
	 
	 Well-developed analytical and judgment skills for solving complex problems and evaluating alternative courses of action 
	 Highly developed interpersonal and communications skills including negotiating trade-off solutions with other disciplines to optimise design solution 
 

 Desirable Skills and Experience :  

 
	 Membership of professional body, such as HFESA, HFES, IEA or equivalent 
	 Professional certification (CPE) or equivalent, or working towards certification 
	 Post graduate qualifications in systems engineering or human factors related fields 
	 Previous experience in consultant organisations 
	 Good knowledge and understanding of systems engineering and assurance processes and standards, such as the INCOSE handbook, CENELEC 50126 and IEC 15288, Engineering Safety Management (iESM)

Name: Senior consultant
Description:
About Infosys:

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.

Location: Sydney, Australia

Short Description: 

If your passion is to build solutions that really make a difference to enterprises, the community and your world, Infosys is the right place for you. 

Roles and Responsibilities:
•	Develop, maintain, and oversee the execution of a testing plan for projects including System Testing (ST), System Integration Testing (SIT), Non-functional testing (NFT), Cloud Platform Readiness Testing (CPT) and Simulation Testing for IaaS, PaaS and Shared Services from On-Prem.
•	Familiarity with HLD, LLD, NFR, IT Controls and automation frameworks. 
•	Design Test scenarios, Develop test cycle plans. and create Test scripts for Hybrid cloud platform.
•	Work towards continuous improvement, automation, and cadence-based delivery of all the apps in the ecosystem.
•	Review vendor’s Test Strategy document and provide feedback wherever necessary.
•	Leading Test Data preparation activities, creation of test run sheets, test analysis or coverage and creation data sets.
•	Creation of test plans and test cases to ensure effective coverage of testing for projects and smaller initiatives.
•	Work with other teams as required to coordinate testing activities to ensure traceability and overall testing best practice is maintained in accordance with the Overall Test Strategy.
•	Work closely with the Business Analysts, Solutions Designers / Architects, and stakeholders within the program as testing activities are in progress from planning to execution.
•	Coordinate / Govern the testing activities throughout the testing lifecycle.
•	Conduct testing status meetings and defect meetings (where required).
•	Initiates sign off Entry and Exit Criteria’s (if required).
•	Daily Status Reporting to management with test progress reports and the Test Summary Report at the completion of each test phase.
•	Communication and escalation of testing risks and issues to the SME’s and Project Manager’s.

Skills /Competencies:


Essential:

•	Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field; or related work experience.
•	6 – 10 years of overall experience in Cloud / Infrastructure Testing that includes public, private or hybrid 
 
Preferred:
•	3+ years of relevant Cloud Automation Framework
•	Experience in AWS / Azure and Hybrid Cloud Based technologies.
•	Expert in cloud concepts, Devops Enablement, Self - Service and Cloud Infra Provisioning 
•	Comprehensive understanding of overall software testing processes, methodologies and tools e.g., Jira, Confluence, Kanban etc
•	Demonstrated experience with system testing, Systems Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing, functional and non-functional and regression test types
•	Demonstrated experience with the design of test cases and test scenarios
•	Experience in delivering high-quality testing approaches to ensure high-quality standards are maintained in released systems
•	Experience with working in Agile & Waterfall projects

Additional Skills:

•	Ability to engage with stakeholders of all levels, to drive decision making, where required
•	Excellent communication skills, written & verbal, towards formal documentation, presentations, facilitation, and elicitation
•	Demonstrable leadership skills and an ability to adapt quickly, work under pressure and manage multiple releases in accordance with delivery requirements and timelines
•	The right mindset, demonstrating a can-do attitude, navigating a complex environment

All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
 
At Infosys, we recognize that everyone has individual requirements. If you are a person with disability, illness or injury and require adjustments to the recruitment and selection process, please contact our Recruitment team for adjustment only on Infosys_ta@infosys.com or include your preferred method of communication in email and someone will be in touch.
 
Please note in order to protect the interest of all parties involved in the recruitment process, Infosys does not accept any unsolicited resumes from third party vendors. In the absence of a signed agreement any submission will be deemed as non-binding and Infosys explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire the submitted profile. All recruitment activity must be coordinated through the Talent Acquisition department.

Name: Professional / Senior Sustainability Consultant
Description:
The Role

AECOM’s Melbourne Sustainability & Resilience team is a group of like-minded professionals working collaboratively to deliver outstanding sustainability and resilience outcomes for our cities and communities. We are collaborative, grounded and maintain a strong focus on planetary outcomes beneficial to our natural and communal environment. We are seeking Professional and Senior Professional advisors with interests in sustainability, decarbonisation and climate resilience to join our team of diverse, supportive, change orientated professionals.

Through AECOM’s Sustainable Legacies strategy, we are embedding sustainability and resilience into everything we do. We are currently working across a number of major projects and clients to help implement and facilitate ideas, initiatives and tools to better understand and address sustainability and resilience challenges. We are using our skills and strengths to drive change, develop solutions and support our clients and projects to meet and exceed their sustainability goals and objectives. This role will provide you the opportunity to work on unique, impactful projects helping our clients and communities reduce their environmental and social impacts and adjust to a changing climate. The role also presents opportunities to work collaboratively across AECOM design and engineering teams and the broader ANZ Sustainability and Resilience practice on projects from the local to the national and international scales. The types of projects we get involved in include embedding sustainability and resilience into the planning and delivery of infrastructure, undertaking climate risk and adaptation studies and developing community resilience strategies.

We are a diverse team that values diverse perspectives. We invest in our team members and support each other, providing mentoring, technical support and opportunities to engage in large scale, city shaping projects which improve lives and support resilience. We care about each other, our planet and its future.

Some of your key responsibilities will include:

Support projects to prepare outputs and deliverables that meet contract requirements and are aligned with project plans

Provide technical advice to resolve client and project requirements

Prepare reports, proposals, tender documents and correspondence

Work collaboratively across AECOM’s business lines and regions to support an embedded approach aligned with AECOM’s Sustainable Legacies strategy

Undertake ad-hoc project related tasks as required which may include studies and assessments, data analysis, technical writing, presentations, and legislation research

Develop and maintain positive relationships with clients to enhance client retention and growth.

Salary range: $80,000 - $120,000 (total package, dependent on experience).

Ideally, you will have:

3+ years’ experience working in sustainability and resilience and an understanding of current industry trends related to infrastructure sustainability and climate resilience is desirable

Consulting, engineering, decarbonisation and/or resource modelling experience will be highly regarded

Demonstrated experience working in a dynamic, deadline-driven environment

Passion for innovation and project delivery

Collaborative team and client approach

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Relevant tertiary qualification in sustainability, environmental science/management, environmental engineering (or similar).

Name:
Metal Fabricator
                                New listing
Description:
Metal Fabricator

Respected Consultants looking for a busy client to secure their new full time Metal Fabricator.

About the Business:

Established in 1985, the business is an Australian owned and run family business. Their product portfolio covers markets such as hospitals, medical centres, pharmacies, laboratories, convenience stores, bakeries, cafes, shopping centres, clubs, bars, and restaurants.

They are specialise in quality cabinets. Our extensive range of Australian built cabinets is complemented by a range of imported products. These cabinets which are predominately of European manufacture, are carefully selected and imported for their quality, performance, and appearance.

Among their commercial refrigeration solutions, you can find upright and under bench refrigerators and freezers, gelato display cases, cake & patisserie display cabinets, butcher (meat) display cabinets, dairy refrigerators, and heated cabinets.

About the role:

Working as part of a cohesive team you will be expected to carry out the full gamut of duties of a metal fabricator. While you will work in a team which has more senior employees who will be able to guide you from time to time, you are expected to have an appropriate skill level to carry out the work required without supervision and be able to produce high quality work we expect of all our qualified metal fabricators.

Your tasks while not exhaustive are summarised below:

- Carefully review detailed drawings or specifications for each job and request clarification or further information 
 if drawings have conflicting/wrong for the job or unclear specifications.
- Assess and ensure we have material and equipment required for each assignment undertaken.
- Ensure appropriate materials are to be used for each job, if need be consult with superiors.
- Cut, roll, shape, bend, mould, spin, heat or hammer metal products to fabricate parts or sub-assemblies.
- Heat treat metal parts and components.
- Set up and/or operate hand and machine tools and welding equipment. Where appropriate utilise computer 
 numerically controlled (CNC) machines to help set up machinery and welding equipment.
- Assemble parts and structures by lining up and joining them by welding, bolting or riveting.
- Finish products to ensure a fine and clean product with the appropriate finish be it high shine, matt and other. -- - Utilise techniques such as polishing, filing, bathing components of the entire finished structure in acid 
 solutions, or by applying proactive or decorative coatings.
- Ensure required paperwork is filled in properly and is submitted on a timely basis.

Successful applicants must have:

- Relevant Trade Qualifications to at least Cert 3 or 4 level or higher is expected. If no trade qualifications has 
 been obtained, we will reluctantly consider those with relevant proven and extensive quality metal fabrication 
 experience (at least three years but likely more) with high level skills in producing items of high standard.
- Those with certificate IV qualifications must also have a minimum of 2 years of full time experience.
- Ability to work full time and have full working right.
- High level of competency in MIG welding is essential.
- Competency in TIG welding is preferred but not essential.
- Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
- Strong orgnisational and time management skills.
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
- An ability to work autonomously and in a team environment.
- High level of safety orientation.

Why join the team?

This is an ideal opportunity for a qualified and skilled Metal Fabricator seeking their next valuable role. Excellent conditions, salary in the range of $60 to $70k plus superannuation along with first-rate facilities, awaits the successful applicant.

Interested?

Apply today using the facilities on this site and please ensure you attach an updated resume and cover letter.

Please note: The shortlisted candidates will only be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $60,000.00 – $70,000.00 per year plus superannuation

Name:
Recruitment Coordinator
                                New listing
Description:
About the Role

MSS Security has an opportunity for a full time Recruitment Coordinator to join our team in Silverwater. The role is integral to the operations of our Aviation business, responsible for managing the day-to-day recruitment and administration tasks associated with attracting, recruiting and on-boarding of all security personnel across a variety of roles and sites, which includes regular and proactive communication with managers to understand business needs and provide appropriate recruitment support.

This role will also be tasked with working with the business on initiatives to attract and retain a diverse workforce, including indigenous and female candidates as well as completing accurate recruitment reporting to ensure compliance and monitor trends across the Aviation business.

About You

Proven experience in fast-paced end to end recruitment, including advertising, shortlisting, interviewing and on-boarding
Ability to facilitate and drive bulk recruitment activities
Ability to establish and maintain both internal and external relationships
Proven time management and organisational skills
Natural ability towards learning new talent management systems and processes quickly
Proven administrative skills including data entry and high attention to detail
Great communication skills (both verbal and written) including spelling, grammar, and phone manner
Passion for delivering remarkable customer service and great results
Strong work ethic, safety awareness and ensure processes and procedures are followed
Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines

Culture
Our employees enjoy working with MSS because of our;
People and culture focus
Extensive development and progression opportunities
The stability and certainty we provide
Safe, healthy, and productive workplace focused on wellbeing
Passionate organisation, always looking forward and continuous improvement focused.

The team enjoy working with each other because we;
Encourage each other in a positive way to get the best out of each other
Work collaboratively together
Are high achievement focused
Know how to have fun whilst getting the job done
We value and promote an environment that fosters open communication, working as an integrated team, being committed to the delivery of professional services and providing individuals with opportunities to develop as well as offer from nationally recognised companies.

How to Apply

Click APPLY and you will be taken through to the MSS Talent Management System to complete your application. Once there, you will be prompted to answer a few simple questions and upload your cover letter and CV. To give yourself the best opportunity to progress your application, please outline in your cover letter how your skills and experience meet the role requirements.

We thank you for taking the time to consider MSS as a future employer and look forward to hearing from you.

Women make up 19% of MSS Security employees - help us grow this number by joining the team!

MSS Security is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Crisis Management, Executive Manager
Description:
See yourself in the team
 Group Corporate Services manages the property, procurement, protective security and business resilience functions for the Group.  A diverse team, Protective Security and Business Resilience are responsible for ensuring the protection of people and assets, as well as ensuring the Group plans for and retains the ability to respond to and recover from major disruptive risk events including safety and security events, technology and payment issues, and cyber or privacy issues.  Do work that matters  Reporting to the Head of Business Resilience, your role will require you to provide CBA and Bankwest functional leadership for the development, implementation, and continual improvement of crisis management capabilities. This includes:

the integration of aligned Group capabilities including IT Service Management, Disaster Recovery, Cyber Recovery, and Communications;
coordinating and supporting the development of Group level improvement actions, such as operational resilience contingencies and involvement in industry response frameworks
development and delivery of crisis exercises at various levels, from business unit specific issues to the Group Crisis Management Team level;
lead operational level responses and support Group level responses to a diverse range of Group level disruption events including natural disasters, technology issues, physical safety/security events and supplier issues.
Adhere to the Code of Conduct, which sets the standards of behaviour, actions and decisions we expect from our people.

We want to hear from you if you have

Experience in leading crisis management capabilities and teams within large organisations.
Strong stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration skills across complex issues and diverse business functions.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to take complex information and communicate a clear and concise message.
A strong customer focus.
Experience in Risk Management, incident response or program management (of benefit but not essential.)

To be considered for this role, you will need to meet The Group's Covid19 Vaccination policy.
Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you.  
Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. One where we're driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.
Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges, and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We really love working here, and we think you will too.
We're determined to make a real difference for Australia's first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.
